1.head: Blessed is the man who has not walked in the counsel of the ungodly,
1.tail: nor stood in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the seat of the scornful;

2.head: But his delight is in the law of the Lord,
2.tail: and on his law will he meditate day and night.

3.head: And he shall be like a tree planted by the waterside,
3.tail: that will bring forth his fruit in due season.

4.head: His leaf also shall not wither;
4.tail: and look, whatever he does, it shall prosper.

5.head: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them;
5.tail: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scatters away from the face of the earth.

6.head: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgment,
6.tail: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

7.head: For the Lord knows the way of the righteous,
7.tail: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

1.head: Why do the nations so furiously rage together?
1.tail: And why do the peoples devise a vain thing?

2.head: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together,
2.tail: against the Lord and against his Anointed:

3.head: Let us break their bonds asunder
3.tail: and cast away their cords from us.

4.head: He who dwells in heaven shall laugh them to scorn;
4.tail: the Lord shall hold them in derision.

5.head: Then shall he speak to them in his wrath
5.tail: and terrify them in his great anger:

6.head: I myself have set my King
6.tail: upon my holy hill of Zion.

7.head: I will proclaim the decree of the Lord;
7.tail: he said to me,  You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.

8.head: Ask of me, and I shall give you the nations for your inheritance
8.tail: and the ends of the earth for your possession.

9.head: You shall bruise them with a rod of iron
9.tail: and break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

10.head: Be wise now, O you kings;
10.tail: be warned, you judges of the earth.

11.head: Serve the Lord in fear,
11.tail: and rejoice with trembling.

12.head: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish in the way; for his wrath is quickly kindled.
12.tail: Blessed are all those who put their trust in him.

1.head: Lord, how they are increased who trouble me;
1.tail: many are those who rise against me.

2.head: Many there are who say of my soul,
2.tail: There is no help for him in his God.

3.head: But you, O Lord, are my defender;
3.tail: you are my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.

4.head: I called upon the Lord with my voice,
4.tail: and he heard me from his holy hill.

5.head: I lay down and slept, and rose up again,
5.tail: for the Lord sustained me.

6.head: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people
6.tail: who have set themselves against me round about.

7.head: Rise up, O Lord, and help me, O my God;
7.tail: for you smite all my enemies on the cheek-bone; you have broken the teeth of the ungodly.

8.head: Salvation belongs to the Lord;
8.tail: may your blessing be upon your people.

1.head: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness;
1.tail: you set me free when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

2.head: O you children of men, how long will you blaspheme my honor,
2.tail: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after falsehood?

3.head: Know this also, that the Lord has chosen for himself the one that is godly;
3.tail: when I call upon the Lord, he will hear me.

4.head: Stand in awe, and sin not;
4.tail: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still.

5.head: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness
5.tail: and put your trust in the Lord.

6.head: There are many that say,  Who will show us any good?
6.tail: Lord, lift up the light of your countenance upon us.

7.head: You have put gladness in my heart,
7.tail: more than when others' grain and wine and oil increased.

8.head: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest;
8.tail: for you, Lord, only, make me dwell in safety.

1.head: Give ear to my words, O Lord;
1.tail: consider my meditation.

2.head: O hearken unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God,
2.tail: for unto you will I make my prayer.

3.head: My voice shall you hear in the morning, O Lord;
3.tail: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto you, and will look up.

4.head: For you are not a god who has pleasure in wickedness,
4.tail: neither shall any evil dwell with you.

5.head: The boastful shall not stand in your sight,
5.tail: for you hate all those who work iniquity.

6.head: You shall destroy those who speak lies;
6.tail: the Lord will abhor the bloodthirsty and the deceitful.

7.head: But as for me, through the multitude of your mercies I will come into your house,
7.tail: and in reverence will I bow myself toward your holy temple.

8.head: Lead me, O Lord, in your righteousness, because of my enemies;
8.tail: make your way straight before my face.

9.head: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
9.tail: their heart is eaten up with wickedness.

10.head: Their throat is an open sepulcher;
10.tail: they flatter with their tongue.

11.head: Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall because of their own devices;
11.tail: because of the multitude of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.

12.head: But let all those who put their trust in you rejoice;
12.tail: let them ever give thanks because you defend them; those who love your Name shall be joyful in you.

13.head: For you, Lord, will give your blessing unto the righteous,
13.tail: and with your favorable kindness you will defend him as with a shield.

1.head: O Lord, rebuke me not in your indignation,
1.tail: neither chasten me in your displeasure.

2.head: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am weak;
2.tail: O Lord, heal me, for my bones are racked.

3.head: My soul also is greatly troubled;
3.tail: but, Lord, how long will you punish me?

4.head: Turn, O Lord, and deliver my soul;
4.tail: O save me for your mercy's sake.

5.head: For in death no one remembers you,
5.tail: and who will give you thanks in the grave?

6.head: I am weary with my groaning;
6.tail: every night I flood my bed and drench my couch with my tears.

7.head: My eyes have become dim because of trouble,
7.tail: and worn away because of all my enemies.

8.head: Away from me, all you who work wickedness,
8.tail: for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.

9.head: The Lord has heard my petition;
9.tail: the Lord will receive my prayer.

10.head: All my enemies shall be confounded and greatly vexed;
10.tail: they shall be turned back and put to shame suddenly.

1.head: O Lord my God, in you have I put my trust;
1.tail: save me from all those who persecute me, and deliver me,

2.head: Lest they devour me like a lion and tear me in pieces
2.tail: while there is none to help.

3.head: O Lord my God, if I have done any such thing,
3.tail: if there be any wickedness in my hands,

4.head: If I have repaid evil to him who has dealt with me as a friend,
4.tail: or plundered him who without any cause is my enemy,

5.head: Then let my enemy pursue me and overtake me,
5.tail: let him trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust.

6.head: Stand up, O Lord, in your wrath, and lift yourself up against the fury of my enemies;
6.tail: rise up for me in the judgment that you have commanded.

7.head: Then shall the assembly of the peoples be gathered about you;
7.tail: lift yourself up again, O Lord, O judge of all the nations.

8.head: Give sentence for me, O Lord, according to my righteousness,
8.tail: and according to the innocence that is in me.

9.head: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end,
9.tail: but establish the just.

10.head: For the righteous God
10.tail: tries the very hearts and minds.

11.head: God is my shield and my defense;
11.tail: he preserves those who are true of heart.

12.head: God is a righteous judge, strong and patient;
12.tail: and God is provoked every day.

13.head: If a man will not repent, God will whet his sword;
13.tail: he will bend his bow, and make it ready.

14.head: He has prepared for him the instruments of death;
14.tail: he makes his arrows shafts of fire.

15.head: Behold, the ungodly is in labor with mischief;
15.tail: he has conceived wickedness and brought forth lies.

16.head: He has made a pit and dug it out,
16.tail: but will himself fall into the trap that he made for others.

17.head: For his malice shall come upon his own head,
17.tail: and his wickedness shall fall on his own scalp.

18.head: I will give thanks unto the Lord, according to his righteousness,
18.tail: and I will praise the Name of the Lord Most High.

1.head: O Lord our Governor, how excellent is your Name in all the world;
1.tail: you have set your glory above the heavens!

2.head: Out of the mouth of babes and infants you have ordained strength, because of your enemies,
2.tail: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.

3.head: When I consider your heavens, even the works of your fingers,
3.tail: the moon and the stars, which you have ordained,

4.head: What is man, that you are mindful of him,
4.tail: the son of man, that you visit him?

5.head: You made him little lower than the angels,
5.tail: to crown him with glory and honor.

6.head: You made him to have dominion over the works of your hands,
6.tail: and you have put all things in subjection under his feet:

7.head: All sheep and oxen,
7.tail: even the beasts of the field,

8.head: The birds of the air, and the fish of the sea,
8.tail: and whatsoever walks through the paths of the seas.

9.head: O Lord our Governor,
9.tail: how excellent is your Name in all the world!

1.head: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, with my whole heart;
1.tail: I will speak of all your marvelous works.

2.head: I will be glad and rejoice in you;
2.tail: indeed, my songs will I sing of your Name, O Most High.

3.head: When my enemies are driven back,
3.tail: they shall fall and perish at your presence;

4.head: For you have maintained my right and my cause;
4.tail: you sit on your throne judging right.

5.head: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the ungodly;
5.tail: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.

6.head: As for the enemy, their destruction has come; they are in perpetual ruin;
6.tail: like the cities which you have destroyed, their memory has perished with them.

7.head: But the Lord sits enthroned for ever;
7.tail: he has prepared his seat for judgment.

8.head: For he shall judge the world in righteousness,
8.tail: and minister true judgment to the peoples.

9.head: The Lord will be a defense for the oppressed,
9.tail: even a refuge in the time of trouble;

10.head: And those who know your Name will put their trust in you,
10.tail: for you, Lord, have never failed those who seek you.

11.head: O praise the Lord who dwells in Zion;
11.tail: tell the peoples what things he has done.

12.head: For when he takes vengeance for blood, he remembers them,
12.tail: and forgets not the cry of the poor.

13.head: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider the trouble I suffer from those who hate me,
13.tail: O you who lift me up from the gates of death,

14.head: That I may tell of all your praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion;
14.tail: I will rejoice in your salvation.

15.head: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made;
15.tail: in the same net which they hid secretly is their foot caught.

16.head: The Lord is known to execute judgment;
16.tail: the ungodly are trapped in the works of their own hands.

17.head: The wicked shall return to the grave,
17.tail: even all the peoples that forget God.

18.head: For the poor shall not always be forgotten;
18.tail: the patient hope of the meek shall not perish for ever.

19.head: Rise up, O Lord, and let them not have the upper hand;
19.tail: let the nations be judged in your sight.

20.head: Put them in fear, O Lord,
20.tail: that the nations may know themselves to be merely human.

1.head: Why do you stand so far off, O Lord,
1.tail: and hide your face in the time of need and trouble?

2.head: The ungodly in his pride persecutes the poor;
2.tail: let him be taken in the crafty schemes that he has imagined.

3.head: For the ungodly has boasted of his own heart's desire;
3.tail: the covetous holds the Lord in contempt and blasphemes his Name.

4.head: The ungodly is so proud that he cares not for God;
4.tail: neither is God in any of his thoughts.

5.head: His ways are always grievous;
5.tail: your judgments are far above, out of his sight, and therefore he defies all his enemies.

6.head: For he has said in his heart,  I shall never be cast down;
6.tail: no harm shall happen to me.

7.head: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud;
7.tail: under his tongue are ungodliness and vanity.

8.head: He sits lurking in the thievish corners of the streets, and in his hiding places he murders the innocent;
8.tail: his eyes are set against the poor.

9.head: For he lies waiting secretly, even as a lion lurks in his den,
9.tail: that he may ravish the poor.

10.head: He ravishes the poor
10.tail: when he gets him into his net.

11.head: The innocent is crushed and humbled before him,
11.tail: and the weak cannot stand against his might.

12.head: He has said in his heart,  God has forgotten;
12.tail: he hides away his face, and he will never see it.

13.head: Arise, O Lord God, and lift up your hand;
13.tail: forget not the poor.

14.head: Why should the wicked blaspheme God,
14.tail: while he says in his heart,  You, O God, do not care ?

15.head: Surely you have seen it, for you behold ungodliness and wrong,
15.tail: that you may take the matter into your hand.

16.head: The poor commits himself unto you,
16.tail: for you are the helper of the fatherless.

17.head: Break the power of the ungodly and malicious;
17.tail: search out his ungodliness until you have brought it all to light.

18.head: The Lord is King for ever and ever,
18.tail: and the nations have perished out of the land.

19.head: O Lord, you have heard the desire of the poor;
19.tail: you prepare their heart, and your ear hearkens to it,

20.head: To help the fatherless and poor with justice,
20.tail: that the one who is of the earth may terrify no more.

1.head: In the Lord I put my trust;
1.tail: how then can you say to my soul,  Flee as a bird unto the hill;

2.head: For behold, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrow upon the string,
2.tail: that they may secretly shoot at those who are true of heart.

3.head: For the foundations will be cast down,
3.tail: and what can the righteous do?

4.head: The Lord is in his holy temple;
4.tail: the Lord's throne is in heaven.

5.head: His eyes consider the poor,
5.tail: and his eyelids try the children of men.

6.head: The Lord tests the righteous,
6.tail: but the ungodly, and those who delight in wickedness, his soul abhors.

7.head: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest;
7.tail: this shall be their portion to drink.

8.head: For the righteous Lord loves righteousness;
8.tail: the upright shall behold his face.

1.head: Help me, O Lord, for there is no godly one left;
1.tail: for the faithful have vanished from among the children of men.

2.head: They speak falsely, every one with his neighbor;
2.tail: they flatter with their lips and deceive with a double heart.

3.head: The Lord shall root out all deceitful lips
3.tail: and the tongues that speak proud things,

4.head: Which have said,  With our tongue will we prevail;
4.tail: our lips are our own; who is lord over us?

5.head: Now because of the trouble of the needy
5.tail: and because of the deep sighing of the poor,

6.head: I will rise up,  says the Lord,
6.tail: and will give help to every one who longs for it.

7.head: The words of the Lord are pure words, even as silver that is tried in the furnace,
7.tail: and as gold that is purified seven times in the fire.

8.head: Preserve us, O Lord, and save us
8.tail: from this perverse and evil generation.

9.head: The ungodly walk on every side
9.tail: when wickedness is exalted among the children of men.

1.head: How long will you utterly forget me, O Lord?
1.tail: How long will you hide your face from me?

2.head: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul and be so vexed in my heart?
2.tail: How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

3.head: Consider and hear me, O Lord my God;
3.tail: give light to my eyes, that I sleep not in death,

4.head: Lest my enemy say,  I have prevailed against him ;
4.tail: for if I am cast down, those who trouble me will rejoice.

5.head: But my trust is in your mercy,
5.tail: and my heart is joyful in your salvation.

6.head: I will sing of the Lord, because he has dealt so lovingly with me;
6.tail: indeed, I will praise the Name of the Lord Most High.

1.head: The fool has said in his heart,
1.tail: There is no God.

2.head: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their doings;
2.tail: there is none that does good, no, not one.

3.head: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
3.tail: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.

4.head: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
4.tail: there is none that does good, no, not one.

5.head: Have they no knowledge, all those workers of evil,
5.tail: who eat up my people as bread, and call not upon the Lord?

6.head: There were they brought into great fear, even where no fear was;
6.tail: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

7.head: Though you have made a mockery of the counsel of the poor,
7.tail: yet they put their trust in the Lord.

8.head: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Zion?
8.tail: When the Lord restores his captive people, then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

1.head: Lord, who shall dwell in your tabernacle?
1.tail: Or who shall rest upon your holy hill?

2.head: Whoever leads an uncorrupt life,
2.tail: and does that which is right, and speaks the truth from his heart.

3.head: He has not spoken deceitfully with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor,
3.tail: and has not slandered his neighbor.

4.head: In his eyes the wicked is rejected,
4.tail: and he makes much of those who fear the Lord.

5.head: He swears to his neighbor and disappoints him not,
5.tail: though it were to his own hindrance.

6.head: He has not given his money for usury,
6.tail: nor taken a bribe against the innocent.

7.head: Whoever does these things
7.tail: shall never be overthrown.

1.head: Preserve me, O God,
1.tail: for in you have I put my trust.

2.head: O my soul, you have said unto the Lord,
2.tail: You are my Lord; I have no good apart from you.

3.head: All my delight is upon the saints who are on the earth,
3.tail: and upon those who excel in virtue.

4.head: But those who run after another god
4.tail: shall have great trouble.

5.head: Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
5.tail: neither make mention of their names with my lips.

6.head: The Lord himself is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup;
6.tail: you shall maintain my lot.

7.head: The boundaries have fallen for me in pleasant places;
7.tail: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.

8.head: I will thank the Lord for giving me counsel;
8.tail: my heart also chastens me in the night season.

9.head: I have set the Lord always before me;
9.tail: he is at my right hand; therefore I shall not fall.

10.head: Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices.
10.tail: My flesh also shall rest in hope.

11.head: For you shall not leave my soul in the grave,
11.tail: neither shall you allow your Holy One to see corruption.

12.head: You shall show me the path of life; in your presence is the fullness of joy,
12.tail: and at your right hand there is pleasure for evermore.

1.head: Hear what is right, O Lord; consider my complaint;
1.tail: hearken to my prayer, which does not come from lying lips.

2.head: Let justice for me come forth from your presence,
2.tail: and let your eyes look upon that which is right.

3.head: You have tested and visited my heart in the night season.
3.tail: If you try me you shall find no wickedness in me; my mouth shall not offend.

4.head: As for the works of others,
4.tail: because of the words of your lips, I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.

5.head: Hold my steps firmly in your paths,
5.tail: that my footsteps may not slip.

6.head: I have called upon you, O God, for you will hear me;
6.tail: incline your ear to me and hearken to my words.

7.head: Show your marvelous loving-kindness, you that are the Savior of those who put their trust in you
7.tail: from the ones who resist your right hand.

8.head: Keep me as the apple of your eye;
8.tail: hide me under the shadow of your wings,

9.head: From the ungodly who assault me,
9.tail: even from my enemies who encompass me to take away my soul.

10.head: They have closed their heart to pity,
10.tail: and their mouth speaks proud things.

11.head: They lie waiting in my way on every side,
11.tail: watching how they may cast me down to the ground,

12.head: Like a lion that is greedy for its prey,
12.tail: and like a young lion lurking in secret places.

13.head: Rise up, O Lord, confront them and cast them down;
13.tail: deliver my soul from the ungodly by your sword and by your hand,

14.head: From those, O Lord, from those whose portion in life is of the world,
14.tail: whose bellies you fill with your hidden treasure.

15.head: They have children at their desire,
15.tail: and leave the rest of their abundance for their little ones.

16.head: But as for me, I will behold your presence in righteousness;
16.tail: and when I awake and see your likeness, I shall be satisfied.

1.head: I will love you, O Lord my strength;
1.tail: the Lord is my rock, my stronghold, and my deliverer,

2.head: My Savior, my God, and my might in whom I will trust,
2.tail: my buckler, the horn of my salvation, and my refuge.

3.head: I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised;
3.tail: so shall I be safe from my enemies.

4.head: The waves of death encompassed me;
4.tail: the floods that would swallow me up made me afraid.

5.head: The cords of the grave surrounded me;
5.tail: the snares of death overtook me.

6.head: In my trouble I called upon the Lord
6.tail: and cried unto my God for help.

7.head: From his holy temple he heard my voice.
7.tail: My complaint came before him; it entered into his ears.

8.head: The earth trembled and quaked;
8.tail: the very foundations of the hills shook and were removed, because he was angry.

9.head: There went out smoke from his nostrils and a consuming fire out of his mouth;
9.tail: coals of fire issued from his presence.

10.head: He parted the heavens also and came down,
10.tail: and it was dark under his feet.

11.head: He rode upon the cherubim and flew;
11.tail: he came flying upon the wings of the wind.

12.head: He made darkness his secret place;
12.tail: dark waters and thick clouds were his covering round about him.

13.head: At the brightness of his presence his clouds broke forth:
13.tail: hailstones and coals of fire.

14.head: The Lord also thundered out of heaven, and the Most High gave forth his voice:
14.tail: hailstones and coals of fire.

15.head: He sent out his arrows and scattered them;
15.tail: he cast forth lightning and destroyed them.

16.head: The springs of water were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered,
16.tail: at your rebuke, O Lord, at the blasting of the breath of your displeasure.

17.head: He reached down from on high to grasp me,
17.tail: and he took me out of many waters.

18.head: He delivered me from my strongest enemy, and from those who hated me,
18.tail: for they were too mighty for me.

19.head: They confronted me in the day of my trouble,
19.tail: but the Lord upheld me.

20.head: He brought me forth into a place of liberty;
20.tail: he delivered me, because I had found favor in his eyes.

21.head: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteous dealing;
21.tail: according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me,

22.head: Because I had kept the ways of the Lord
22.tail: and had not forsaken my God, as the wicked do.

23.head: For I had an eye unto all his laws
23.tail: and did not cast out his commandments from me.

24.head: I was also uncorrupt before him
24.tail: and kept myself from my own wickedness.

25.head: Therefore the Lord rewarded me according to my righteous dealing,
25.tail: and according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

26.head: With the faithful you show yourself faithful,
26.tail: and with the upright you show yourself upright.

27.head: With the pure you show yourself pure,
27.tail: but with the crooked you show yourself shrewd.

28.head: For you shall save the people who are in adversity,
28.tail: but shall bring down the high looks of the proud.

29.head: You also shall light my lamp;
29.tail: the Lord my God shall turn my darkness into light.

30.head: For with you I shall crush a host of men,
30.tail: and with the help of my God I can leap over a wall.

31.head: The way of God is an undefiled way; the word of the Lord also is tried in the fire;
31.tail: he is the defender of all those who put their trust in him.

32.head: For who is God, but the Lord,
32.tail: or who is a rock, except our God?

33.head: It is God who girds me with strength for war

34.head: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer
34.tail: and sets me up on high.

35.head: He teaches my hands to fight,
35.tail: and my arms shall bend even a bow of bronze.

36.head: You have given me the shield of your salvation;
36.tail: your right hand also shall hold me up, and your loving correction shall make me great.

37.head: You have made a broad path for my feet,
37.tail: and my footsteps shall not slip.

38.head: I will follow my enemies and overtake them;
38.tail: I will not turn again until I have destroyed them.

39.head: I will smite them, and they shall not be able to stand.
39.tail: They shall fall under my feet.

40.head: You have girded me with strength for the battle;
40.tail: you shall throw down my enemies under me.

41.head: You have made my enemies turn their backs upon me,
41.tail: and I shall destroy those who hate me.

42.head: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them;
42.tail: even unto the Lord shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.

43.head: I will beat them as small as dust before the wind;
43.tail: I will tread them down as mire in the streets.

44.head: You shall deliver me from the strivings of the peoples,
44.tail: and you shall make me the head of the nations.

45.head: A people whom I have not known
45.tail: shall be in subjection under me.

46.head: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me;
46.tail: and foreigners shall cringe before me.

47.head: Foreigners shall lose heart,
47.tail: and, being afraid, shall come out of their strongholds.

48.head: The Lord lives, and blessed be my rock,
48.tail: and praised be the God of my salvation,

49.head: Even the God who sees that I am avenged
49.tail: and subdues the peoples under me.

50.head: It is he who delivers me from my cruel enemies, and lifts me up above my adversaries;
50.tail: you shall rid me of the wicked.

51.head: For this cause will I give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the nations,
51.tail: and sing praises unto your Name.

52.head: Great prosperity he gives unto his King,
52.tail: and shows loving-kindness to David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

1.head: The heavens declare the glory of God,
1.tail: and the firmament shows his handiwork.

2.head: One day speaks to another,
2.tail: and one night gives knowledge to another.

3.head: There is neither speech nor language,
3.tail: and their voices are not heard;

4.head: But their sound has gone out into all lands,
4.tail: and their words to the ends of the world.

5.head: In them he has set a tent for the sun,
5.tail: which comes forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoices like a strong man to run his course.

6.head: It goes forth from the uttermost part of the heavens, and runs about to the end of it again,
6.tail: and there is nothing hidden from its heat.

7.head: The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul;
7.tail: the testimony of the Lord is sure, and gives wisdom to the simple.

8.head: The statutes of the Lord are right, and rejoice the heart;
8.tail: the commandment of the Lord is pure, and gives light to the eyes.

9.head: The fear of the Lord is clean, and endures for ever;
9.tail: the judgments of the Lord are true, and righteous altogether.

10.head: More to be desired are they than gold, even much fine gold;
10.tail: sweeter also than honey, than the drippings from the honeycomb.

11.head: Moreover, by them is your servant taught,
11.tail: and in keeping them there is great reward.

12.head: Who can tell how often he offends?
12.tail: O cleanse me from my secret faults.

13.head: Keep your servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me;
13.tail: so shall I be undefiled, and innocent of great offense.

14.head: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be always acceptable in your sight,
14.tail: O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.

1.head: May the Lord hear you in the day of trouble,
1.tail: the Name of the God of Jacob defend you;

2.head: Send you help from the sanctuary,
2.tail: and strengthen you out of Zion;

3.head: Remember all your offerings,
3.tail: and accept your burnt sacrifice;

4.head: Grant you your heart's desire,
4.tail: and accomplish all your plans.

5.head: We will rejoice in your salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God;
5.tail: may the Lord grant all your petitions.

6.head: Now I know that the Lord helps his Anointed, and will answer him from his holy heaven,
6.tail: even with the saving strength of his right hand.

7.head: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses,
7.tail: but we put our trust in the Name of the Lord our God.

8.head: They are brought down and fallen,
8.tail: but we will arise and stand upright.

9.head: O Lord, save the King,
9.tail: and hear us when we call upon you.

1.head: The King shall rejoice in your strength, O Lord;
1.tail: exceedingly glad shall he be of your salvation.

2.head: You have given him his heart's desire,
2.tail: and have not denied him the request of his lips.

3.head: For you shall meet him with the blessings of goodness,
3.tail: and shall set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

4.head: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him:
4.tail: length of days, for ever and ever.

5.head: His honor is great because of your salvation;
5.tail: glory and majesty shall you lay upon him.

6.head: For you shall give him everlasting felicity
6.tail: and make him glad with the joy of your countenance.

7.head: For the King puts his trust in the Lord,
7.tail: and because of the mercy of the Most High, he shall not be moved.

8.head: All your enemies shall feel your hand;
8.tail: your right hand shall find those who hate you.

9.head: You shall make them like a fiery oven in the time of your wrath;
9.tail: the Lord shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.

10.head: Their offspring you shall root out of the earth,
10.tail: and their seed from among the children of men.

11.head: For they intended evil against you,
11.tail: and imagined wicked schemes, which they are not able to perform.

12.head: Therefore you shall put them to flight,
12.tail: and the strings of your bow you shall aim at their faces.

13.head: Be exalted, O Lord, in your own strength;
13.tail: so we will sing and praise your power.

1.head: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me,
1.tail: and are so far from my cry, and from the words of my complaint?

2.head: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but you do not hear;
2.tail: in the night season also, but I find no rest.

3.head: But you remain holy,
3.tail: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.

4.head: Our fathers hoped in you;
4.tail: they trusted in you, and you delivered them.

5.head: They called upon you, and were delivered;
5.tail: they put their trust in you, and were not confounded.

6.head: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man,
6.tail: scorned by all, and the outcast of the people.

7.head: All those who see me laugh me to scorn;
7.tail: they curl their lips, and shake their heads, saying,

8.head: He trusted in God, that he would deliver him;
8.tail: let him deliver him, if he will have him.

9.head: But you are he that took me out of my mother's womb;
9.tail: you were my hope, when I was yet upon my mother's breasts.

10.head: I have been cast upon you ever since I was born;
10.tail: you are my God, even from my mother's womb.

11.head: O go not far from me, for trouble is near at hand,
11.tail: and there is none to help me.

12.head: Many oxen have come around me;
12.tail: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.

13.head: They gape at me with their mouths,
13.tail: like a ravening and a roaring lion.

14.head: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint;
14.tail: my heart also in the midst of my body is like melting wax.

15.head: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaves to my gums,
15.tail: and you bring me into the dust of death.

16.head: For many dogs have come about me,
16.tail: and the council of the wicked lays siege against me.

17.head: They pierced my hands and my feet; I can count all my bones;
17.tail: they stand staring and looking upon me.

18.head: They part my garments among them,
18.tail: and cast lots for my clothing.

19.head: But be not far from me, O Lord.
19.tail: You are my succor; hasten to help me.

20.head: Deliver my soul from the sword,
20.tail: my life from the power of the dog.

21.head: Save me from the lion's mouth,
21.tail: and my soul in misery from among the horns of wild oxen.

22.head: I will declare your Name to my brethren;
22.tail: in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.

23.head: O praise the Lord, you that fear him;
23.tail: magnify him, all you seed of Jacob, and fear him, all you seed of Israel.

24.head: For he has not despised nor abhorred the low estate of the poor;
24.tail: he has not hidden his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard him.

25.head: My praise is of you in the great congregation;
25.tail: my vows will I perform in the sight of those who fear him.

26.head: The poor shall eat and be satisfied;
26.tail: those who seek after the Lord shall praise him; may your hearts live for ever.

27.head: All the ends of the world shall remember, and be turned unto the Lord,
27.tail: and all the families of the nations shall worship before him.

28.head: For the kingdom is the Lord's,
28.tail: and he is the Governor among the peoples.

29.head: All those who sleep in the earth, how shall they worship him?
29.tail: All those who go down into the dust, how shall they kneel before him?

30.head: But my life shall be preserved in his sight, and my children shall worship him;
30.tail: they shall tell of the Lord to the generations to come;

31.head: And to a people yet unborn shall they declare his righteousness,
31.tail: that he has brought it to pass.

1.head: The Lord is my shepherd;
1.tail: therefore I can lack nothing.

2.head: He shall feed me in green pastures
2.tail: and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.

3.head: He shall refresh my soul
3.tail: and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness for his Name's sake.

4.head: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil,
4.tail: for you are with me; your rod and your staff comfort me.

5.head: You shall prepare a table before me, in the presence of those who trouble me;
5.tail: you have anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.

6.head: Surely your goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life,
6.tail: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

1.head: The earth is the Lord's and all that is in it,
1.tail: the compass of the world and those who dwell therein.

2.head: For he has founded it upon the seas
2.tail: and established it upon the rivers of the deep.

3.head: Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord?
3.tail: Or who shall stand in his holy place?

4.head: He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
4.tail: and who has not set his mind upon vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbor.

5.head: He shall receive blessing from the Lord
5.tail: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

6.head: This is the generation of those who seek him,
6.tail: even of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.

7.head: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
7.tail: and the King of glory shall come in.

8.head: Who is the King of glory?
8.tail: It is the Lord, strong and mighty, even the Lord, mighty in battle.

9.head: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
9.tail: and the King of glory shall come in.

10.head: Who is the King of glory?
10.tail: The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory.

1.head: Unto you, O Lord, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in you;
1.tail: O let me not be ashamed, neither let my enemies triumph over me.

2.head: For all those who hope in you shall not be ashamed,
2.tail: but those who deal untruly shall be put to confusion.

3.head: Show me your ways, O Lord,
3.tail: and teach me your paths.

4.head: Lead me forth in your truth and teach me,
4.tail: for you are the God of my salvation; in you has been my hope all the day long.

5.head: Call to remembrance, O Lord, your tender mercies,
5.tail: and your loving-kindnesses, which have been from of old.

6.head: O remember not the sins and offenses of my youth,
6.tail: but according to your mercy think on me, O Lord, in your goodness.

7.head: Gracious and righteous is the Lord;
7.tail: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

8.head: Those who are meek shall he guide in judgment,
8.tail: and those who are gentle shall he teach his way.

9.head: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth
9.tail: to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.

10.head: For your Name's sake, O Lord,
10.tail: forgive my sin, for it is great.

11.head: Who is the one who fears the Lord?
11.tail: He shall teach him in the way that he shall choose.

12.head: He shall dwell at ease,
12.tail: and his seed shall inherit the land.

13.head: The Lord reveals his secret counsel to those who fear him,
13.tail: and he will show them his covenant.

14.head: My eyes are ever looking to the Lord,
14.tail: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

15.head: Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
15.tail: for I am desolate and in misery.

16.head: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged;
16.tail: O bring me out of my troubles.

17.head: Look upon my adversity and misery
17.tail: and forgive me all my sin.

18.head: Consider my enemies, how many they are,
18.tail: and how they bear a tyrannous hate against me.

19.head: O keep my soul and deliver me;
19.tail: let me not be ashamed, for I have put my trust in you.

20.head: Let integrity and righteous dealing preserve me,
20.tail: for my hope has been in you.

21.head: Deliver Israel, O God,
21.tail: out of all his troubles.

1.head: Be my judge, O Lord, for I have walked innocently;
1.tail: my trust has been in the Lord; therefore I shall not fall.

2.head: Test me, O Lord, and prove me;
2.tail: examine my heart and my mind.

3.head: For your loving-kindness is ever before my eyes,
3.tail: and I will walk in your truth.

4.head: I have not dwelt with evildoers,
4.tail: neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.

5.head: I have hated the company of the wicked,
5.tail: and will not sit among the ungodly.

6.head: I will wash my hands in innocence, O Lord,
6.tail: and so will I go to your altar,

7.head: That I may lift up the voice of thanksgiving
7.tail: and tell of all your wondrous works.

8.head: Lord, I have loved the habitation of your house
8.tail: and the place where your honor dwells.

9.head: O take not away my soul with the sinners,
9.tail: nor my life with the bloodthirsty,

10.head: Whose hands are full of wickedness,
10.tail: and their right hand full of bribes.

11.head: But as for me, I will walk innocently;
11.tail: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.

12.head: My foot stands firm;
12.tail: I will praise the Lord in the congregations.

1.head: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom then shall I fear?
1.tail: The Lord is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?

2.head: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh,
2.tail: they stumbled and fell.

3.head: Though a host were encamped against me, yet my heart would not be afraid,
3.tail: and though war rose up against me, yet would I put my trust in him.

4.head: One thing have I desired of the Lord; one thing I seek:
4.tail: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,

5.head: To behold the fair beauty of the Lord,
5.tail: and to seek him in his temple.

6.head: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle;
6.tail: indeed, in the secret place of his dwelling he shall hide me, and set me high upon a rock of stone.

7.head: And now he shall lift up my head
7.tail: above my enemies round about me.

8.head: Therefore I will offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness;
8.tail: I will sing and speak praises unto the Lord.

9.head: Hearken to my voice, O Lord, when I cry unto you;
9.tail: have mercy upon me and hear me.

10.head: You speak to my heart and say,  Seek my face.
10.tail: Your face, O Lord, will I seek.

11.head: O hide not your face from me,
11.tail: nor cast your servant away in displeasure.

12.head: You have been my helper;
12.tail: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

13.head: When my father and my mother forsake me,
13.tail: the Lord takes me in.

14.head: Teach me your way, O Lord,
14.tail: and lead me in the right way, because of my enemies.

15.head: Deliver me not over to the will of my adversaries,
15.tail: for there are false witnesses who have risen up against me, and those who speak wrong.

16.head: I would utterly have fainted,
16.tail: had I not believed that I would see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

17.head: O wait for the Lord; be strong, and he shall comfort your heart.
17.tail: O put your trust in the Lord.

1.head: Unto you will I cry, O Lord my rock; do not be deaf to my prayer;
1.tail: lest, if you do not answer, I become like those who go down into the pit.

2.head: Hear the voice of my humble petitions when I cry unto you,
2.tail: when I hold up my hands toward the sanctuary of your holy temple.

3.head: O cast me not away, neither destroy me with the ungodly and evildoers,
3.tail: who speak as friends to their neighbors, but imagine evil in their hearts.

4.head: Reward them according to their deeds
4.tail: and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.

5.head: Recompense them according to the work of their hands;
5.tail: pay them what they have deserved.

6.head: For they regard not in their mind the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands;
6.tail: therefore he shall break them down and not build them up.

7.head: Praised be the Lord,
7.tail: for he has heard the voice of my humble petitions.

8.head: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart has trusted in him, and I am helped;
8.tail: therefore my heart dances for joy, and in my song will I praise him.

9.head: The Lord is my strength,
9.tail: and he is the sure defense of his Anointed.

10.head: O save your people, and give your blessing to your inheritance;
10.tail: feed them, and lift them up for ever.

1.head: Ascribe unto the Lord, O you mighty,
1.tail: ascribe unto the Lord worship and strength.

2.head: Give the Lord the honor due unto his Name;
2.tail: worship the Lord with holy worship.

3.head: It is the Lord that commands the waters;
3.tail: it is the glorious God that makes the thunder.

4.head: It is the Lord that rules the sea; the voice of the Lord is mighty in its working;
4.tail: the voice of the Lord is a glorious voice.

5.head: The voice of the Lord breaks the cedar trees;
5.tail: indeed, the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.

6.head: He makes them also to skip like a calf,
6.tail: Lebanon also, and Sirion, like a young ox.

7.head: The voice of the Lord divides the flames of fire; the voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;
7.tail: indeed, the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

8.head: The voice of the Lord makes the deer to bring forth young, and strips the forests bare;
8.tail: in his temple all cry,  Glory.

9.head: The Lord sits above the floodwaters,
9.tail: and the Lord remains King for ever.

10.head: The Lord shall give strength to his people;
10.tail: the Lord shall give his people the blessing of peace.

1.head: I will magnify you, O Lord, for you have lifted me up,
1.tail: and have not let my foes triumph over me.

2.head: O Lord my God, I cried unto you,
2.tail: and you have made me whole.

3.head: You, Lord, have brought my soul out of the Grave;
3.tail: you have saved my life from among those who go down to the Pit.

4.head: Sing praises unto the Lord, O you saints of his,
4.tail: and give thanks unto him for the remembrance of his holiness.

5.head: For his wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye, his pleasure for a lifetime;
5.tail: heaviness may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

6.head: In my prosperity I said,  I shall never be moved;
6.tail: you, Lord, of your goodness, have made my hill so strong.

7.head: You turned your face from me,
7.tail: and I was distressed.

8.head: Then I cried unto you, O Lord,
8.tail: and came to my Lord most humbly.

9.head: What profit is there in my bloodshed,
9.tail: if I go down into the Pit?

10.head: Shall the dust give thanks unto you?
10.tail: Or shall it declare your faithfulness?

11.head: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me.
11.tail: O Lord, be my helper.

12.head: You have turned my lamentation into dancing;
12.tail: you have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness.

13.head: Therefore shall my heart sing of your praise without ceasing.
13.tail: O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto you for ever.

1.head: In you, O Lord, have I put my trust;
1.tail: let me never be put to confusion; deliver me in your righteousness.

2.head: Bow down your ear to me,
2.tail: make haste to deliver me,

3.head: And be my strong rock and house of defense,
3.tail: that you may save me.

4.head: For you are my strong rock and my castle;
4.tail: be also my guide, and lead me for your Name's sake.

5.head: Draw me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me,
5.tail: for you are my strength.

6.head: Into your hands I commend my spirit,
6.tail: for you have redeemed me, O Lord, O God of truth.

7.head: I have hated those who hold to worthless vanities,
7.tail: and my trust has been in the Lord.

8.head: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy,
8.tail: for you have considered my trouble, and have known my soul in adversities.

9.head: You have not shut me up in the hand of the enemy,
9.tail: but have set my feet where they may walk at liberty.

10.head: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble;
10.tail: my eye is consumed with heaviness, and also my soul and my body.

11.head: For my life has grown old with heaviness,
11.tail: and my years with mourning.

12.head: My strength fails me because of my iniquity,
12.tail: and my bones are consumed.

13.head: I have become a reproof among all my enemies, but especially among my neighbors;
13.tail: my acquaintances are afraid of me, and those who see me in the street shrink from me.

14.head: I am utterly forgotten, as a dead man, out of mind;
14.tail: I have become like a broken vessel.

15.head: For I have heard the whispering of the multitude, and fear is on every side,
15.tail: while they conspire together against me and take their counsel to take away my life.

16.head: But my hope has been in you, O Lord;
16.tail: I have said,  You are my God.

17.head: My time is in your hand;
17.tail: deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.

18.head: Show your servant the light of your countenance,
18.tail: and save me for your mercy's sake.

19.head: Let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon you;
19.tail: let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.

20.head: Let the lying lips be put to silence,
20.tail: which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully speak against the righteous.

21.head: Oh, how plentiful is your goodness, which you have laid up for those who fear you,
21.tail: and which you have prepared for those who put their trust in you, even before the children of men!

22.head: You hide them in the secret place of your presence from those who conspire against them;
22.tail: you keep them in your refuge from the strife of tongues.

23.head: Thanks be to the Lord,
23.tail: for he has shown me marvellously great kindness in a strong city.

24.head: But when I was afraid, I said in my haste,
24.tail: I am cast out of the sight of your eyes.

25.head: Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer
25.tail: when I cried unto you.

26.head: O love the Lord, all you his saints,
26.tail: for the Lord preserves those who are faithful, and plenteously repays the proud.

27.head: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart,
27.tail: all you that put your trust in the Lord.

1.head: Blessed is the one whose unrighteousness is forgiven,
1.tail: and whose sin is covered.

2.head: Blessed is the one to whom the Lord imputes no sin,
2.tail: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

3.head: For while I held my tongue, my bones wasted away;
3.tail: I ceased not from groaning all the day long.

4.head: For your hand was heavy upon me day and night,
4.tail: and I was dried up and withered, as in the drought of summer.

5.head: Then I acknowledged my sin unto you,
5.tail: and I did not hide my iniquity.

6.head: I said,  I will confess my sins unto the Lord ;
6.tail: and so you forgave the wickedness of my sin.

7.head: For this reason shall all the godly make their prayers unto you at a time when you may be found;
7.tail: when the great floodwaters rise, they shall not reach them.

8.head: You are my hiding-place; you shall preserve me from trouble;
8.tail: you shall encompass me with songs of deliverance.

9.head: I will instruct you and teach you in the way that you should go,
9.tail: and I will guide you with my eye.

10.head: Do not be like the horse and mule, which have no understanding,
10.tail: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, or else they will not come near you.

11.head: Great troubles remain for the ungodly;
11.tail: but mercy embraces those who trust in the Lord.

12.head: Be glad, O you righteous, and rejoice in the Lord;
12.tail: and be joyful, all who are true of heart.

1.head: Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous;
1.tail: it is fitting for the just to be thankful.

2.head: Praise the Lord with the harp;
2.tail: sing praises unto him with the ten-stringed lute.

3.head: Sing unto him a new song;
3.tail: make skillful melody and cry aloud with joy.

4.head: For the word of the Lord is true,
4.tail: and all his works are faithful.

5.head: He loves righteousness and true judgment;
5.tail: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

6.head: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made,
6.tail: and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.

7.head: He gathers the waters of the sea together, as in a heap,
7.tail: and lays up the deep, as in a treasure house.

8.head: Let all the earth fear the Lord;
8.tail: stand in awe of him, all you that dwell in the world.

9.head: For he spoke, and it was done;
9.tail: he commanded and it stood fast.

10.head: The Lord brings the counsel of the nations to naught;
10.tail: he makes the devices of the peoples to be of no effect, and casts out the counsels of princes.

11.head: The counsel of the Lord shall endure for ever,
11.tail: and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

12.head: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
12.tail: and blessed are the people he has chosen for himself to be his inheritance.

13.head: The Lord looks down from heaven and beholds all the children of men;
13.tail: from the habitation of his dwelling he considers all those who dwell on the earth.

14.head: He fashions all the hearts of them
14.tail: and understands all their works.

15.head: There is no king who can be saved by a mighty host;
15.tail: neither is any mighty man delivered by great strength.

16.head: A horse is considered a vain hope to save a man;
16.tail: neither shall it deliver anyone by its great strength.

17.head: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon those who fear him,
17.tail: and upon those who put their trust in his mercy,

18.head: To deliver their soul from death,
18.tail: and to feed them in the time of famine.

19.head: Our soul has patiently waited for the Lord,
19.tail: for he is our help and our shield.

20.head: Our heart shall rejoice in him,
20.tail: because we have hoped in his holy Name.

21.head: Let your merciful kindness, O Lord, be upon us,
21.tail: as we have put our trust in you.

1.head: I will always give thanks unto the Lord;
1.tail: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

2.head: My soul shall make its boast in the Lord;
2.tail: the humble shall hear this and be glad.

3.head: O praise the Lord with me,
3.tail: and let us magnify his Name together.

4.head: I sought the Lord, and he heard me;
4.tail: he delivered me out of all my fears.

5.head: They looked unto him, and were made glad,
5.tail: and their faces were not ashamed.

6.head: Look, the poor man cries, and the Lord hears him,
6.tail: and saves him out of all his troubles.

7.head: The angel of the Lord camps round about those who fear him,
7.tail: and delivers them in time of need.

8.head: O taste and see how gracious the Lord is;
8.tail: blessed is the one who trusts in him.

9.head: O fear the Lord, you that are his saints;
9.tail: for those who fear him lack nothing.

10.head: The lions lack and suffer hunger,
10.tail: but those who seek the Lord shall lack nothing that is good.

11.head: Come, children, and listen to me;
11.tail: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

12.head: Who among you desires to live,
12.tail: and longs to see good days?

13.head: Keep your tongue from evil,
13.tail: and your lips from speaking lies.

14.head: Turn from evil and do good;
14.tail: seek peace and pursue it.

15.head: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous,
15.tail: and his ears are open to their prayers.

16.head: The countenance of the Lord is against those who do evil,
16.tail: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

17.head: The righteous cry, and the Lord hears them
17.tail: and delivers them out of all their troubles.

18.head: The Lord is near to those who are brokenhearted
18.tail: and will save those who are crushed in spirit.

19.head: Great are the troubles of the righteous,
19.tail: but the Lord delivers him out of them all.

20.head: He keeps all his bones,
20.tail: so that not one of them is broken.

21.head: But evil shall slay the ungodly,
21.tail: and those who hate the righteous shall be desolate.

22.head: The Lord delivers the souls of his servants,
22.tail: and all those who put their trust in him shall not be destitute.

1.head: Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me,
1.tail: and fight against those who fight against me.

2.head: Take up the shield and buckler,
2.tail: and stand up to help me.

3.head: Bring forth the spear and bar the way against those who pursue me;
3.tail: say to my soul,  I am your salvation.

4.head: Let them be confounded and put to shame who seek after my life;
4.tail: let them be turned back and brought to confusion who imagine evil against me.

5.head: Let them be as the chaff before the wind,
5.tail: and let the angel of the Lord scatter them.

6.head: Let their way be dark and slippery,
6.tail: and let the angel of the Lord pursue them.

7.head: For they have secretly laid their net to destroy me without a cause;
7.tail: indeed, without a cause have they made a pit to take away my life.

8.head: Let sudden destruction come upon them unawares, and the net, which they have laid secretly, catch themselves,
8.tail: that they may fall into their own trouble.

9.head: Then shall my soul be joyful in the Lord;
9.tail: I shall rejoice in his salvation.

10.head: All my bones shall say,  Lord, who is like you? You deliver the poor from those who are too strong for them;
10.tail: indeed, the poor and those who are in misery from those who rob them.

11.head: Malicious witnesses rise up;
11.tail: they charge me with matters I know nothing about.

12.head: They repay me evil for good,
12.tail: to the great sorrow of my soul.

13.head: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth and humbled myself with fasting;
13.tail: I prayed with my whole heart, as if it had been my friend or my brother.

14.head: I behaved myself as one who mourns for his mother;
14.tail: I was bowed down with heaviness of heart.

15.head: But in my adversity, they rejoiced and gathered themselves together;
15.tail: indeed, those who struck me came together against me, and I had no rest; they tore at me, and would not cease.

16.head: When I stumbled they mocked me exceedingly,
16.tail: and gnashed at me with their teeth.

17.head: Lord, how long will you look on this?
17.tail: O deliver me from the calamities they bring upon me, and my life from the lions.

18.head: So will I give you thanks in the great congregation;
18.tail: I will praise you among many people.

19.head: O let not those who are my enemies triumph over me deceitfully;
19.tail: neither let them wink with their eyes, those who hate me without a cause.

20.head: For their talking is not for peace,
20.tail: but they imagine deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.

21.head: They open their mouths at me, and say,
21.tail: Aha! Aha! We saw it with our own eyes!

22.head: This you have seen, O Lord.
22.tail: Hold not your tongue then; be not far from me, O Lord.

23.head: Awake, and stand up to judge my case;
23.tail: avenge my cause, my God and my Lord.

24.head: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to your righteousness,
24.tail: and let them not triumph over me.

25.head: Let them not say in their hearts,  Aha! We have what we want!
25.tail: Neither let them say,  We have devoured him.

26.head: Let them be put to confusion and shame who rejoice at my trouble;
26.tail: let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who boast against me.

27.head: Let them be glad and rejoice who favor my righteous cause;
27.tail: indeed, let them say always,  Great is the Lord, who takes pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

28.head: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of your righteousness
28.tail: and of your praise all the day long.

1.head: My heart shows me the wickedness of the ungodly;
1.tail: there is no fear of God before his eyes.

2.head: For he flatters himself in his own sight,
2.tail: until his abominable sin is found out.

3.head: The words of his mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit;
3.tail: he has left off behaving wisely and doing good.

4.head: He imagines mischief upon his bed, and has set himself in no good way;
4.tail: neither does he abhor anything that is evil.

5.head: Your mercy, O Lord, reaches to the heavens,
5.tail: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

6.head: Your righteousness stands like the strong mountains; your judgments are like the great deep;
6.tail: you, Lord, shall save both man and beast.

7.head: How excellent is your mercy, O God!
7.tail: The children of men shall take refuge under the shadow of your wings.

8.head: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of your house,
8.tail: and you shall give them drink from your pleasures as out of a river.

9.head: For with you is the well of life,
9.tail: and in your light shall we see light.

10.head: O continue your loving-kindness to those who know you,
10.tail: and your righteousness to those who are true of heart.

11.head: O let not the foot of the proud come against me,
11.tail: and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.

12.head: There have they fallen, all those who work wickedness;
12.tail: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

1.head: Fret not yourself because of the ungodly,
1.tail: neither be envious of those who are evildoers.

2.head: For they shall soon be dried up like the grass,
2.tail: and be withered even as the green herb.

3.head: Put your trust in the Lord, and do good;
3.tail: dwell in the land, and surely you shall be fed.

4.head: Delight yourself in the Lord,
4.tail: and he shall give you your heart's desire.

5.head: Commit your way unto the Lord and put your trust in him,
5.tail: and he shall bring it to pass.

6.head: He shall make your righteousness as clear as the light
6.tail: and your just dealing as the noonday.

7.head: Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for him;
7.tail: do not grieve yourself over the one whose way prospers, over the one who carries out evil counsels.

8.head: Refrain from wrath, and let go of anger;
8.tail: fret not yourself, lest you be moved to do evil.

9.head: For evildoers shall be rooted out,
9.tail: but those who wait patiently for the Lord, they shall inherit the land.

10.head: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone;
10.tail: you shall look for their place, and they shall not be there.

11.head: But the meek-spirited shall possess the land
11.tail: and shall be refreshed with an abundance of peace.

12.head: The ungodly plot against the just
12.tail: and gnash at them with their teeth.

13.head: The Lord shall laugh at them in scorn,
13.tail: for he sees that their day is coming.

14.head: The ungodly have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow
14.tail: to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay those who walk aright.

15.head: Their sword shall go through their own heart,
15.tail: and their bow shall be broken.

16.head: The little that the righteous has
16.tail: is better than great riches of the ungodly.

17.head: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken,
17.tail: but the Lord upholds the righteous.

18.head: The Lord knows the days of the godly,
18.tail: and their inheritance shall endure for ever.

19.head: They shall not be confounded in perilous times,
19.tail: and in the days of famine they shall have enough.

20.head: As for the ungodly, they shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be consumed as in a fiery furnace;
20.tail: even as smoke shall they vanish away.

21.head: The ungodly borrow and do not repay,
21.tail: but the righteous are merciful and generous.

22.head: Those who are blessed by God shall possess the land,
22.tail: but those who are cursed by him shall be rooted out.

23.head: The Lord orders a man's steps;
23.tail: he makes his footsteps sure and preserves him on his path.

24.head: Though he fall, he shall not be cast down,
24.tail: for the Lord upholds him with his hand.

25.head: I have been young, and now I am old,
25.tail: yet I never saw the righteous forsaken, nor his children begging bread.

26.head: The righteous is ever merciful in lending,
26.tail: and his seed shall be blessed.

27.head: Flee from evil, and do that which is good,
27.tail: and dwell in the land for ever.

28.head: For the Lord loves that which is right;
28.tail: he forsakes not those who are godly, and they are preserved for ever.

29.head: The unrighteous shall be punished;
29.tail: as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.

30.head: The righteous shall inherit the land

31.head: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
31.tail: and his tongue talks of judgment.

32.head: The law of his God is in his heart,
32.tail: and his footsteps shall not falter.

33.head: The ungodly lie in wait for the righteous
33.tail: and seek occasion to slay him.

34.head: The Lord will not leave him in their hand,
34.tail: nor allow him to be condemned when he is judged.

35.head: Hope in the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall exalt you so that you shall possess the land;
35.tail: when the ungodly perish, you shall see it.

36.head: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power,
36.tail: and flourishing like a tree in full leaf.

37.head: I went by, and behold, they were gone;
37.tail: I sought them, but their place could nowhere be found.

38.head: Mark the blameless, and take heed of the upright,
38.tail: for there is a future for the peaceable.

39.head: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together,
39.tail: and the end of the ungodly is that they shall be rooted out at the last.

40.head: But the salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord,
40.tail: who is also their strength in the time of trouble.

41.head: And the Lord shall stand by them and save them;
41.tail: he shall deliver them from the ungodly and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.

1.head: Rebuke me not, O Lord, in your anger,
1.tail: neither chasten me in your weighty displeasure.

2.head: For your arrows stick fast in me,
2.tail: and your hand presses me hard.

3.head: There is no health in my flesh, because of your displeasure;
3.tail: neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.

4.head: For my iniquities have gone over my head
4.tail: and are like a heavy burden, too much for me to bear.

5.head: My wounds stink and fester,
5.tail: by reason of my foolishness.

6.head: I am brought into such great trouble and misery
6.tail: that I go about mourning all the day long.

7.head: For my loins are filled with burning,
7.tail: and there is no wholeness in my body.

8.head: I am feeble and sorely smitten;
8.tail: I have roared because of the tumult of my heart.

9.head: Lord, you know all my desire,
9.tail: and my groaning is not hidden from you.

10.head: My heart is panting, my strength has failed me,
10.tail: and the sight of my eyes is gone from me.

11.head: My friends and my neighbors turn away from my trouble,
11.tail: and my kinsmen stand afar off.

12.head: Those also who seek after my life lay snares for me,
12.tail: and those who go about to do me evil talk of wickedness and imagine deceit all the day long.

13.head: As for me, I am like the deaf who do not hear,
13.tail: and as one who is mute, who does not open his mouth.

14.head: I have become like a man who hears not,
14.tail: and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

15.head: For in you, O Lord, have I put my trust;
15.tail: you shall answer for me, O Lord my God.

16.head: I have said,  Let not my enemies triumph over me,
16.tail: for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly over me.

17.head: Truly, I am about to fall,
17.tail: and my pain is ever with me.

18.head: For I will confess my wickedness,
18.tail: and be sorry for my sin.

19.head: But my enemies live, and are mighty,
19.tail: and those who hate me wrongfully are many in number.

20.head: Those also who repay evil for good are against me,
20.tail: because I follow that which is good.

21.head: Forsake me not, O Lord my God;
21.tail: O be not far from me.

22.head: Make haste to help me,
22.tail: O Lord God of my salvation.

1.head: I said,  I will take heed to my ways,
1.tail: that I may not offend with my tongue.

2.head: I will keep my mouth as with a bridle
2.tail: while the ungodly are in my sight.

3.head: I held my tongue and spoke nothing;
3.tail: I kept silence, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.

4.head: My heart was hot within me, and while I was thus pondering the fire kindled,
4.tail: and at the last I spoke with my tongue:

5.head: Lord, let me know my end and the number of my days,
5.tail: that I may learn how short my life is.

6.head: Behold, you have made my days as a span in length,
6.tail: and my age is even as nothing before you; and truly, everyone living is but a breath.

7.head: For everyone walks about as a shadow, and disquiets himself in vain;
7.tail: he heaps up riches and cannot tell who shall gather them.

8.head: And now, Lord, what is my hope?
8.tail: Truly, my hope is in you.

9.head: Deliver me from all my offenses,
9.tail: and make me not a taunt of the foolish.

10.head: I became mute and opened not my mouth,
10.tail: for it was you that brought it to pass.

11.head: Take your affliction from me;
11.tail: I am consumed by the blows of your heavy hand.

12.head: When you, with rebukes, chasten someone for sin, you consume what is dear to him, like a moth eating a garment;
12.tail: everyone therefore is but vanity.

13.head: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and with your ears consider my cry;
13.tail: hold not your peace at my tears.

14.head: For I am a stranger with you,
14.tail: and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

15.head: O turn your gaze from me, that I may again be glad,
15.tail: before I go away to be seen no more.

1.head: I waited patiently for the Lord,
1.tail: and he inclined to me, and heard my call.

2.head: He brought me out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay;
2.tail: he set my feet upon the rock, and secured my footing.

3.head: He has put a new song in my mouth,
3.tail: a song of thanksgiving unto our God.

4.head: Many shall see and fear,
4.tail: and shall put their trust in the Lord.

5.head: Blessed is the man who has set his hope in the Lord,
5.tail: and has not turned to the proud, or to those who go about lying.

6.head: O Lord my God, great are the wondrous works which you have done, and also your thoughts toward us;
6.tail: there is none who can be compared with you.

7.head: If I should declare them and speak of them,
7.tail: they would be more than I am able to express.

8.head: Sacrifice and offering you do not desire,
8.tail: but my ears you have opened.

9.head: Burnt offerings and sin offerings you have not required,
9.tail: and so I said,  Behold, I come;

10.head: In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I delight to do your will, O my God;
10.tail: indeed, your law is within my heart.

11.head: I have declared your righteousness in the great congregation;
11.tail: behold, I will not restrain my lips, O Lord, and that you know.

12.head: I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart;
12.tail: my talk has been of your truth and of your salvation.

13.head: I have not concealed your loving mercy and truth
13.tail: from the great congregation.

14.head: Withdraw not your mercy from me, O Lord;
14.tail: let your loving-kindness and your truth always preserve me.

15.head: For innumerable troubles have encompassed me; my sins have taken such hold of me that I am not able to look up;
15.tail: indeed, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart has utterly failed me.

16.head: O Lord, let it be your pleasure to deliver me;
16.tail: make haste, O Lord, to help me.

17.head: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my soul to destroy it;
17.tail: let them be driven backward and rebuked who wish me evil.

18.head: Let them be desolate and rewarded with shame
18.tail: who say to me,  Aha, Aha.

19.head: Let all those who seek you be joyful and glad in you;
19.tail: and let those who love your salvation say always,  The Lord be praised.

20.head: As for me, I am poor and needy,
20.tail: but the Lord cares for me.

21.head: You are my helper and deliverer;
21.tail: do not tarry, O my God.

1.head: Blessed is the one who considers the poor and needy;
1.tail: the Lord shall deliver him in the time of trouble.

2.head: The Lord preserves him and keeps him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth,
2.tail: and delivers him not over to the will of his enemies.

3.head: The Lord comforts him when he lies sick upon his bed,
3.tail: and restores him from his bed of sickness.

4.head: I said,  Lord, be merciful to me;
4.tail: heal my soul, for I have sinned against you.

5.head: My enemies speak evil of me:
5.tail: When shall he die, and his name perish?

6.head: And if anyone comes to see me, he speaks empty words;
6.tail: his heart conceives falsehood within him, and when he goes forth, he tells it.

7.head: All my enemies whisper together against me;
7.tail: even against me are they devising evil:

8.head: A deadly thing has taken hold of him,
8.tail: and now that he lies down, he will rise up no more.

9.head: Indeed, even my own familiar friend, whom I trusted, who also ate of my bread,
9.tail: has lifted up his heel against me.

10.head: But be merciful to me, O Lord;
10.tail: raise me up again, and I shall repay them.

11.head: By this I know you favor me,
11.tail: that my enemy does not triumph over me.

12.head: And when I am in health, you uphold me,
12.tail: and shall set me before your face for ever.

13.head: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
13.tail: world without end. Amen.

1.head: As the deer desires the water brooks,
1.tail: so longs my soul for you, O God.

2.head: My soul is athirst for God, even for the living God;
2.tail: when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?

3.head: My tears have been my food day and night,
3.tail: while all day long they say to me,  Where now is your God?

4.head: When I think upon these things, I pour out my heart,
4.tail: when I remember how I went with the multitude, and brought them into the house of God,

5.head: With the voice of praise and thanksgiving
5.tail: among those who keep holy day.

6.head: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,
6.tail: and why are you so disquieted within me?

7.head: O put your trust in God,
7.tail: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

8.head: My soul is heavy within me;
8.tail: therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan, and from Mizar among the hills of Hermon.

9.head: One deep calls to another in the noise of your waterfalls;
9.tail: all your waves and storms have gone over me.

10.head: The Lord will grant his loving-kindness in the daytime;
10.tail: and in the night season will I sing of him, and make my prayer to the God of my life.

11.head: I will say to God my rock,  Why have you forgotten me?
11.tail: Why am I full of heaviness, while the enemy oppresses me?

12.head: My bones are broken asunder,
12.tail: while my enemies mock me to my face,

13.head: While all day long they say to me,
13.tail: Where now is your God?

14.head: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,
14.tail: and why are you so disquieted within me?

15.head: O put your trust in God,
15.tail: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

1.head: Give judgment for me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people;
1.tail: O deliver me from the deceitful and the wicked.

2.head: For you are the God of my strength; why have you put me far from you?
2.tail: And why do I go about with heaviness, while the enemy oppresses me?

3.head: O send out your light and your truth, that they may lead me,
3.tail: and bring me to your holy hill, and to your dwelling;

4.head: That I may go to the altar of God, even to the God of my joy and gladness;
4.tail: and on the harp will I give thanks to you, O God, my God.

5.head: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,
5.tail: and why are you so disquieted within me?

6.head: O put your trust in God,
6.tail: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

1.head: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us
1.tail: what you did in the days of old:

2.head: How you drove out the nations with your hand, and planted our fathers in the land;
2.tail: how you destroyed the nations and cast them out.

3.head: For they did not possess the land by their own sword,
3.tail: neither was it their own arm that helped them,

4.head: But by your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your countenance,
4.tail: because you favored them.

5.head: You are my King, O God;
5.tail: you send help to Jacob.

6.head: Through you we will overthrow our enemies,
6.tail: and in your Name will we tread down those who rise up against us.

7.head: For I will not trust in my bow;
7.tail: it is not my sword that shall help me;

8.head: But you save us from our enemies
8.tail: and put to shame those who hate us.

9.head: We make our boast in God all day long
9.tail: and will praise your Name for ever.

10.head: But now you have cast us off and put us to shame,
10.tail: and you do not go forth with our armies.

11.head: You make us turn our backs upon our enemies,
11.tail: so that those who hate us plunder our goods.

12.head: You let us be eaten up like sheep
12.tail: and have scattered us among the nations.

13.head: You sell your people for nothing
13.tail: and take no money for them.

14.head: You make us the reproach of our neighbors,
14.tail: to be laughed to scorn, and held in derision by those who are round about us.

15.head: You make us a byword among the nations,
15.tail: so that the peoples shake their heads at us.

16.head: My disgrace is daily before me,
16.tail: and the shame of my face has covered me,

17.head: Because of the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer,
17.tail: because of the enemy and avenger.

18.head: And though all this has come upon us, yet we do not forget you,
18.tail: nor have we been unfaithful to your covenant.

19.head: Our heart has not turned back,
19.tail: nor have our steps departed from your way,

20.head: Though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,
20.tail: and covered us with the shadow of death.

21.head: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and held up our hands to any strange god,
21.tail: shall not God search it out? For he knows the very secrets of the heart.

22.head: For your sake we are killed all the day long,
22.tail: and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

23.head: Rise up, O Lord! Why are you sleeping?
23.tail: Awake, and cast us not away for ever.

24.head: Why do you hide your face
24.tail: and forget our misery and trouble?

25.head: For our soul is brought low, even to the dust;
25.tail: our belly cleaves to the ground.

26.head: Arise, O Lord, and help us,
26.tail: and deliver us for your mercy's sake.

1.head: My heart overflows with a noble song;
1.tail: I will sing my words to the King; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

2.head: You are fairer than the children of men;
2.tail: full of grace are your lips, because God has blessed you for ever.

3.head: Gird your sword upon your thigh, most mighty one,
3.tail: according to your honor and majesty.

4.head: In your majesty be victorious; ride out for the sake of truth, to bear witness to righteousness,
4.tail: and your right hand shall show you marvelous things.

5.head: Your arrows are very sharp in the heart of the King's enemies,
5.tail: and the peoples shall be subdued under you.

6.head: Your throne, O God, endures for ever;
6.tail: the scepter of your kingdom is a righteous scepter.

7.head: You have loved righteousness and hated iniquity;
7.tail: therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.

8.head: All your garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;
8.tail: out of the ivory palaces, stringed instruments have made you glad.

9.head: Kings' daughters are among your honorable women;
9.tail: at your right hand stands the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought with many colors.

10.head: Hearken, O daughter, and consider; incline your ear;
10.tail: forget your own people, and your father's house.

11.head: So shall the King have pleasure in your beauty;
11.tail: since he is your Lord, honor him.

12.head: And the daughter of Tyre shall bring you gifts;
12.tail: the rich also among the peoples shall seek your favor.

13.head: The King's daughter is all glorious within the palace;
13.tail: her clothing is of wrought gold.

14.head: She shall be brought to the king in embroidered raiment;
