14.tail: the virgins who are her companions shall bring her to you.

15.head: With joy and gladness shall they bring her,
15.tail: and shall enter into the King's palace.

16.head: Instead of your fathers, you shall have sons,
16.tail: whom you shall make princes in all the land.

17.head: I will make your Name to be remembered from one generation to another;
17.tail: therefore the peoples shall praise you, world without end.

1.head: God is our refuge and strength,
1.tail: a very present help in trouble.

2.head: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved,
2.tail: and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;

3.head: Though its waters rage and swell,
3.tail: and though the mountains shake at its tempest.

4.head: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
4.tail: the holy dwelling place of the Most High.

5.head: God is in the midst of her; therefore she shall not be moved.
5.tail: God shall help her at the break of day.

6.head: The nations are in an uproar, and the kingdoms are moved,
6.tail: but God has lifted his voice, and the earth shall melt away.

7.head: The Lord of hosts is with us;
7.tail: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

8.head: O come and behold the works of the Lord,
8.tail: what devastations he has brought upon the earth.

9.head: He makes wars to cease in all the world;
9.tail: he breaks the bow, and shatters the spear, and burns the chariots in the fire.

10.head: Be still then and know that I am God;
10.tail: I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

11.head: The Lord of hosts is with us;
11.tail: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

1.head: O clap your hands together, all you peoples;
1.tail: O cry aloud unto God with shouts of joy.

2.head: For the Lord Most High is to be feared;
2.tail: he is the great King over all the earth.

3.head: He shall subdue the peoples under us,
3.tail: and the nations under our feet.

4.head: He shall choose our inheritance for us,
4.tail: the pride of Jacob whom he loved.

5.head: God has gone up with a shout of triumph,
5.tail: the Lord with the sound of the trumpet.

6.head: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God;
6.tail: O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.

7.head: For God is the King of all the earth;
7.tail: think upon his mighty acts and praise him with a song.

8.head: God reigns over the nations;
8.tail: God sits on his holy throne.

9.head: The princes of the peoples are gathered with the people of the God of Abraham;
9.tail: for the mighty upon earth have become the servants of the Lord, and he is very highly exalted.

1.head: Great is the Lord and highly to be praised
1.tail: in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.

2.head: The hill of Zion is beautiful and lofty;
2.tail: it is the joy of the whole earth.

3.head: Upon the north side lies the city of the great King;
3.tail: God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.

4.head: For behold, the kings of the earth
4.tail: have gathered and advanced together.

5.head: They marvelled to see such things;
5.tail: they were astonished and fled in terror.

6.head: Trembling came upon them, and anguish,
6.tail: as upon a woman in travail.

7.head: You caused the east wind to blow
7.tail: and broke apart the ships of Tarshish.

8.head: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God;
8.tail: God upholds her for ever.

9.head: We wait for your loving-kindness, O God,
9.tail: in the midst of your temple.

10.head: O God, according to your Name, so is your praise to the world's end;
10.tail: your right hand is full of righteousness.

11.head: Let Mount Zion rejoice, and the cities of Judah be glad,
11.tail: because of your judgments.

12.head: Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
12.tail: count the number of her towers.

13.head: Mark well her bulwarks, consider her strongholds,
13.tail: that you may tell those who come after.

14.head: This God is our God for ever and ever;
14.tail: he shall be our guide, even unto death.

1.head: Hear this, all you peoples;
1.tail: ponder it with your ears, all who dwell in the world,

2.head: High and low, rich and poor,
2.tail: everyone with his neighbor.

3.head: My mouth shall speak of wisdom,
3.tail: and my heart shall muse on understanding.

4.head: I will incline my ear to a parable,
4.tail: and declare my dark sayings with the harp.

5.head: Why should I fear in the days of wickedness,
5.tail: and when the wicked at my heels encompass me round about?

6.head: There are some who put their trust in their goods,
6.tail: and boast in the multitude of their riches.

7.head: But no one can deliver his brother,
7.tail: nor pay unto God a price for him;

8.head: For it is so costly to redeem their souls,
8.tail: that we should never have enough to pay it,

9.head: So that they should live for ever,
9.tail: and should not see the grave.

10.head: For we see that wise men die, as well as the ignorant and foolish;
10.tail: they perish alike and leave their riches for others.

11.head: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever, and that their dwelling places shall endure from one generation to another,
11.tail: and they call lands after their own names.

12.head: Man is like an ox that has no understanding;
12.tail: he is like the beasts that perish.

13.head: This is the way of their foolishness,
13.tail: yet their posterity praise their sayings.

14.head: Like sheep they are appointed to die, and death shall be their shepherd;
14.tail: they shall go down straight into the sepulcher.

15.head: Their beauty shall consume away in the grave,
15.tail: which shall be their dwelling place for ever.

16.head: But God shall save me from the power of death,
16.tail: for he shall deliver my soul.

17.head: Be not envious if one is made rich,
17.tail: or if the glory of his house is increased,

18.head: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dies,
18.tail: neither shall his glory follow him.

19.head: For while he lived, he counted himself happy,
19.tail: and so long as he did well for himself, people spoke well of him.

20.head: He shall follow the generation of his fathers
20.tail: and shall never see the light.

21.head: Those who are honored but have no understanding
21.tail: are like the beasts that perish.

1.head: The Lord, even the most mighty God, has spoken
1.tail: and called the world, from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.

2.head: Out of Zion, perfect in her beauty,
2.tail: has God shone forth in glory.

3.head: Our God shall come and shall not keep silence;
3.tail: there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.

4.head: He shall call to the heavens above,
4.tail: and to the earth beneath, that he may judge his people:

5.head: Gather my faithful together unto me,
5.tail: those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

6.head: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness,
6.tail: for God himself is Judge.

7.head: Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
7.tail: I myself will testify against you, O Israel, for I am God, even your God.

8.head: I will not rebuke you because of your sacrifices, or for your burnt offerings,
8.tail: because they are always before me.

9.head: I will take no bull calf out of your house,
9.tail: nor he-goat out of your folds.

10.head: For all the beasts of the forest are mine,
10.tail: and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.

11.head: I know all the birds of the air,
11.tail: and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.

12.head: If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
12.tail: for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.

13.head: Do you think that I will eat the flesh of bulls
13.tail: and drink the blood of goats?

14.head: Offer unto God a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
14.tail: and pay your vows unto the Most High,

15.head: And call upon me in the time of trouble;
15.tail: so will I hear you, and you shall praise me.

16.head: But to the ungodly God says:
16.tail: Why do you recite my laws, and take my covenant in your mouth,

17.head: Though you hate to be disciplined,
17.tail: and have cast my words behind you?

18.head: When you saw a thief, you agreed with him,
18.tail: and you have taken part with adulterers.

19.head: You have let your mouth speak wickedness,
19.tail: and with your tongue you have set forth deceit.

20.head: You sat and spoke against your brother;
20.tail: yes, and have slandered your own mother's son.

21.head: These things you have done, and I held my tongue,
21.tail: and you thought wickedly that I am such a one as yourself.

22.head: But I will reprove you,
22.tail: and set before you the things that you have done.

23.head: O consider this, you who forget God,
23.tail: lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver you.

24.head: Whoever offers me a sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me,
24.tail: and to him who orders his way aright will I show the salvation of God.

1.head: Have mercy upon me, O God, in your great goodness;
1.tail: according to the multitude of your mercies wipe away my offences.

2.head: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness
2.tail: and cleanse me from my sin.

3.head: For I acknowledge my faults,
3.tail: and my sin is ever before me.

4.head: Against you only have I sinned, and done this evil in your sight,
4.tail: so that you are justified in your sentence, and blameless in your judgment.

5.head: Behold, I was brought forth in wickedness,
5.tail: and in sin my mother conceived me.

6.head: But behold, you desire truth in the inward parts
6.tail: and shall make me understand wisdom secretly.

7.head: You shall purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
7.tail: you shall wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

8.head: You shall make me hear of joy and gladness,
8.tail: that the bones which you have broken may rejoice.

9.head: Turn your face from my sins,
9.tail: and blot out all my misdeeds.

10.head: Create in me a clean heart, O God,
10.tail: and renew a right spirit within me.

11.head: Cast me not away from your presence,
11.tail: and take not your holy Spirit from me.

12.head: O give me the comfort of your help again,
12.tail: and sustain me with your willing Spirit.

13.head: Then shall I teach your ways unto the wicked,
13.tail: and sinners shall return unto you.

14.head: Deliver me from blood-guilt, O God, the God of my salvation,
14.tail: and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness.

15.head: O Lord, open my lips,
15.tail: and my mouth shall show forth your praise.

16.head: For you desire no sacrifice, or else I would give it to you;
16.tail: but you delight not in burnt-offerings.

17.head: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit;
17.tail: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you shall not despise.

18.head: O be favorable and gracious unto Zion;
18.tail: may you build up the walls of Jerusalem.

19.head: Then you shall be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations;
19.tail: then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.

1.head: Why do you boast, you tyrant,
1.tail: that you can do evil;

2.head: Whereas the goodness of God
2.tail: endures all the day long?

3.head: Your tongue devises wickedness,
3.tail: and with lies you cut like a sharp razor.

4.head: You have loved unrighteousness more than goodness
4.tail: and to utter lies more than truth.

5.head: You have loved to speak all words that hurt,
5.tail: O you deceitful tongue.

6.head: Therefore, God shall destroy you for ever;
6.tail: he shall catch you, and pluck you out of your dwelling, and root you out of the land of the living.

7.head: The righteous also shall see this and fear,
7.tail: and shall laugh him to scorn:

8.head: Behold, this is the one who did not take God for his strength,
8.tail: but trusted in the multitude of his riches and relied on his wickedness.

9.head: As for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God;
9.tail: my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.

10.head: I will always give thanks unto you for what you have done,
10.tail: and I will declare your Name among the faithful, for it is good.

1.head: The fool has said in his heart,
1.tail: There is no God.

2.head: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their wickedness;
2.tail: there is none that does good.

3.head: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men
3.tail: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.

4.head: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
4.tail: there is none that does good, no, not one.

5.head: Have they no knowledge, all the workers of evil
5.tail: who eat up my people as they would eat bread, and call not upon God?

6.head: They were afraid where no fear was,
6.tail: for God has broken the bones of those who besieged you;

7.head: You have put them to shame,
7.tail: because God has rejected them.

8.head: Oh, that salvation were given unto Israel out of Zion!
8.tail: Oh, that God would deliver his people out of captivity!

9.head: Then shall Jacob rejoice,
9.tail: and Israel shall be glad.

1.head: Save me, O God, for your Name's sake,
1.tail: and avenge me in your strength.

2.head: Hear my prayer, O God,
2.tail: and hearken to the words of my mouth.

3.head: For the arrogant have risen up against me,
3.tail: and tyrants, who do not have God before their eyes, seek after my life.

4.head: Behold, God is my helper;
4.tail: the Lord is he who upholds my life.

5.head: He shall repay the evil of my enemies.
5.tail: O destroy them in your faithfulness.

6.head: A freewill offering will I give you,
6.tail: and praise your Name, O Lord, because it is good.

7.head: For he has delivered me out of all my trouble,
7.tail: and my eye has seen the ruin of my enemies.

1.head: Hear my prayer, O God,
1.tail: and hide not yourself from my petition.

2.head: Give heed to me, and hear me,
2.tail: for I am troubled in my prayer and am tormented,

3.head: Because of the cry of the enemy, and oppression by the ungodly;
3.tail: for they are of a mind to do me great harm, so maliciously are they set against me.

4.head: My heart is disquieted within me,
4.tail: and the fear of death has fallen upon me.

5.head: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me,
5.tail: and a horrible dread has overwhelmed me.

6.head: And I said,  Oh, that I had wings like a dove,
6.tail: for then would I fly away and be at rest.

7.head: Indeed, then I would get away to a far off place
7.tail: and make my dwelling in the wilderness.

8.head: I would make haste to escape,
8.tail: because of the stormy wind and tempest.

9.head: Confuse their speech, O Lord, and divide them,
9.tail: for I have seen unrighteousness and strife in the city.

10.head: Day and night they go about within her walls;
10.tail: trouble and sorrow are in the midst of her.

11.head: Great wickedness is there;
11.tail: deceit and guile do not leave her streets.

12.head: For it is not an enemy who has done me this dishonor,
12.tail: for then I could have borne it;

13.head: Neither was it my adversary who exalted himself against me,
13.tail: for then I would have hidden myself from him.

14.head: But it was you, my companion,
14.tail: my comrade and my own familiar friend.

15.head: We took sweet counsel together
15.tail: and walked in the house of God as friends.

16.head: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down alive into the grave,
16.tail: for there is wickedness in their hearts.

17.head: As for me, I will call upon God,
17.tail: and the Lord shall save me.

18.head: In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray and lament,
18.tail: and he shall hear my voice.

19.head: It is he who shall deliver my soul in peace from the battle that is against me,
19.tail: for there are many who fight me.

20.head: God, who endures for ever, shall hear me and bring them down;
20.tail: for they never change, nor do they fear God.

21.head: My familiar friend has laid his hands upon those who were at peace with him,
21.tail: and he has broken his covenant.

22.head: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, yet war was in his heart;
22.tail: his words were smoother than oil, and yet they were drawn swords.

23.head: O cast your burden upon the Lord, and he shall nourish you,
23.tail: and shall not allow the righteous to fall for ever.

24.head: But as for the bloodthirsty and deceitful,
24.tail: you, O God, shall bring them into the pit of destruction.

25.head: They shall not live out half their days;
25.tail: but my trust shall be in you, O Lord.

1.head: Be merciful to me, O God, for my adversaries are treading me down;
1.tail: they are daily fighting and troubling me.

2.head: My enemies go about hounding me daily,
2.tail: for there are many who fight against me, O Most High.

3.head: Nevertheless, though I am sometimes afraid,
3.tail: yet I put my trust in you.

4.head: In God whose word I praise, in God I trust and fear not,
4.tail: for what can flesh do to me?

5.head: They daily distort my words;
5.tail: all that they imagine is to do me evil.

6.head: They all gather together and lie in wait,
6.tail: and mark my steps, while they seek after my life.

7.head: Shall they escape despite their wickedness?
7.tail: O God, in your displeasure cast them down.

8.head: You record my lamentation; put my tears into your bottle.
8.tail: Are not these things noted in your book?

9.head: Whenever I call upon you, then shall my enemies be put to flight;
9.tail: this I know, for God is on my side.

10.head: In God, whose word I praise,
10.tail: in the Lord, whose word I praise,

11.head: In God have I put my trust;
11.tail: I will not be afraid, for what can mortals do to me?

12.head: Unto you, O God, will I pay my vows;
12.tail: unto you will I give thanks.

13.head: For you have delivered my soul from death and my feet from stumbling,
13.tail: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

1.head: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for my soul trusts in you,
1.tail: and under the shadow of your wings shall be my refuge, until this tribulation has passed.

2.head: I will call unto the Most High God,
2.tail: even unto the God who shall fulfill his purpose for me.

3.head: He shall send from heaven and save me; he shall confound those who trample on me.
3.tail: God shall send forth his mercy and truth.

4.head: My soul is among lions that devour the people;
4.tail: their teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

5.head: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
5.tail: let your glory be over all the earth.

6.head: They have laid a net for my feet, and brought down my soul;
6.tail: they dug a pit before me, but have fallen into the midst of it themselves.

7.head: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed;
7.tail: I will sing and give praise.

8.head: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
8.tail: I myself will awaken the dawn.

9.head: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the peoples,
9.tail: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations.

10.head: For the greatness of your mercy reaches unto the heavens,
10.tail: and your truth unto the clouds.

11.head: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
11.tail: let your glory be over all the earth.

1.head: Do you indeed decree righteousness, O you rulers,
1.tail: and do you judge uprightly, O children of men?

2.head: No, you devise evil in your heart,
2.tail: and on the earth your hands deal out violence.

3.head: The ungodly err even from their mother's womb;
3.tail: as soon as they are born, they go astray and speak lies.

4.head: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent,
4.tail: even like the deaf adder that stops its ears,

5.head: Which refuses to hear the voice of the charmer,
5.tail: no matter how skillful his charming.

6.head: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths;
6.tail: smite the jawbones of the ungodly.

7.head: Let them fall away like water that runs off;
7.tail: let them wither like the grass that is trodden underfoot.

8.head: Let them melt away like a snail,
8.tail: and be like a stillborn child that does not see the sun.

9.head: Before they bear fruit, let them be cut off like a briar;
9.tail: let them be like thorns and weeds that are swept away.

10.head: The righteous shall rejoice when they see the vengeance;
10.tail: they shall wash their feet in the blood of the ungodly.

11.head: So that people shall say,  Truly, there is a reward for the righteous;
11.tail: surely, there is a God who judges the earth.

1.head: Deliver me from my enemies, O God;
1.tail: defend me from those who rise up against me.

2.head: O deliver me from the evildoers,
2.tail: and save me from the bloodthirsty.

3.head: For behold, they lie in wait for my soul;
3.tail: the mighty are gathered against me, without any offense or fault of mine, O Lord.

4.head: They run and prepare themselves without cause.
4.tail: Arise therefore to help me, and behold.

5.head: Rise up, O Lord God of hosts, O God of Israel, to visit all the nations,
5.tail: and be not merciful to those who offend with malicious wickedness.

6.head: They go to and fro in the evening;
6.tail: they howl like dogs, and run about through the city.

7.head: Behold, they boast with their mouths, and taunts are on their lips,
7.tail: for they say,  Who will hear us?

8.head: But you, O Lord, shall hold them in derision,
8.tail: and you shall laugh all the nations to scorn.

9.head: My strength I will ascribe unto you,
9.tail: for you are the God of my refuge.

10.head: God shows me his plenteous goodness,
10.tail: and God shall let me look in triumph upon my enemies.

11.head: Slay them not, lest my people forget it,
11.tail: but scatter them abroad by your might, and put them down, O Lord our shield.

12.head: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride,
12.tail: because their talk is cursing and lies.

13.head: Consume them in your wrath; consume them, that they may perish,
13.tail: and know that it is God who rules in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.

14.head: In the evening they will return,
14.tail: howl like dogs, and run about through the city.

15.head: They will run here and there for meat
15.tail: and growl if they are not satisfied.

16.head: As for me, I will sing of your power, and will praise your mercy early in the morning,
16.tail: for you have been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.

17.head: Unto you, O my strength, will I sing,
17.tail: for you, O God, are my refuge, and my merciful God.

1.head: O God, you have cast us out and scattered us abroad;
1.tail: you have been so displeased; O turn unto us again.

2.head: You have made the land to quake and divided it;
2.tail: heal the breaches in it, for it shakes.

3.head: You have made your people to drink a cup of bitterness;
3.tail: you have filled us with wine that makes us stagger.

4.head: You have set up a banner for those who fear you,
4.tail: that they may triumph because of the truth.

5.head: That your beloved may be delivered,
5.tail: help me with your right hand and hear me.

6.head: God has spoken in his holiness:
6.tail: I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.

7.head: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
7.tail: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

8.head: Moab is my wash pot; on Edom I will cast my shoe;
8.tail: over Philistia will I shout in triumph.

9.head: Who will lead me into the strong city?
9.tail: Who will bring me into Edom?

10.head: Have you not cast us out, O God?
10.tail: Will you not, O God, go out with our armies?

11.head: O be our help in trouble,
11.tail: for vain is the help of man.

12.head: Through God we will do great acts,
12.tail: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.

1.head: Hear my cry, O God;
1.tail: give ear unto my prayer.

2.head: From the ends of the earth I will call upon you
2.tail: when my heart is in heaviness.

3.head: O set me upon the rock that is higher than I,
3.tail: for you have been my refuge and a strong tower for me against the enemy.

4.head: Let me dwell in your tabernacle for ever,
4.tail: and my refuge shall be under the covering of your wings.

5.head: For you, O God, have heard my vows,
5.tail: and have given a heritage to those who fear your Name.

6.head: You shall grant the king a long life,
6.tail: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

7.head: His throne shall abide before God for ever;
7.tail: O prepare your loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

8.head: So will I always sing praise unto your Name,
8.tail: that I may daily perform my vows.

1.head: For God alone my soul in silence waits;
1.tail: from him comes my salvation.

2.head: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
2.tail: he is my defense, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.

3.head: How long will you assail a man to crush him, all of you together,
3.tail: as if you were a tottering wall or a broken fence?

4.head: Their plan is only to bring down the one whom God has exalted;
4.tail: their delight is in lies; they bless with their mouth, but curse with their heart.

5.head: Nevertheless, for God alone my soul in silence waits,
5.tail: for my hope is in him.

6.head: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
6.tail: he is my defense, so that I shall not fall.

7.head: In God is my help and my glory;
7.tail: he is the rock of my might, and in him is my trust.

8.head: O put your trust in him always, you people;
8.tail: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.

9.head: As for the children of men, they are but a breath;
9.tail: the children of men are deceitful; upon the scales, they are altogether lighter than a breath.

10.head: O trust not in oppression; put not vain hopes in robbery;
10.tail: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

11.head: One thing has God spoken; indeed, two things have I heard him say:
11.tail: that power belongs to our God;

12.head: And that you, O Lord, are merciful,
12.tail: for you reward everyone according to his work.

1.head: O God, you are my God;
1.tail: early will I seek you.

2.head: My soul thirsts for you, my flesh also longs after you,
2.tail: in a barren and dry land where there is no water.

3.head: Thus I have looked upon you in your holy place,
3.tail: that I might behold your power and glory.

4.head: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself;
4.tail: my lips shall praise you.

5.head: As long as I live I will magnify you,
5.tail: and lift up my hands in your Name.

6.head: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness,
6.tail: when my mouth praises you with joyful lips.

7.head: When I remember you on my bed,
7.tail: I meditate on you in the watches of the night.

8.head: Because you have been my helper,
8.tail: therefore under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.

9.head: My soul clings to you;
9.tail: your right hand has upheld me.

10.head: Those who seek to destroy my life
10.tail: shall go down into the earth.

11.head: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword,
11.tail: that they may be a portion for jackals.

12.head: But the King shall rejoice in God; all those who swear by him shall be commended,
12.tail: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

1.head: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer;
1.tail: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

2.head: Hide me from the gathering together of the wicked,
2.tail: and from the tumult of evildoers,

3.head: Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
3.tail: and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words,

4.head: That they may secretly shoot at the one who is blameless;
4.tail: suddenly do they shoot him, and fear not.

5.head: They hold fast to their evil purpose,
5.tail: and discuss among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no one shall see them.

6.head: They imagine wickedness, and practice a cunning plot;
6.tail: for the human heart and mind are very deep.

7.head: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow,
7.tail: and they shall be wounded.

8.head: Indeed, their own tongues shall make them fall,
8.tail: so that all who see them shall laugh them to scorn.

9.head: And all shall fear and tell what God has done,
9.tail: for they shall perceive that it is his work.

10.head: The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord and put their trust in him,
10.tail: and all who are true of heart shall be glad.

1.head: You, O God, are to be praised in Zion,
1.tail: and unto you shall vows be performed in Jerusalem.

2.head: You who hear our prayer,
2.tail: unto you shall all flesh come.

3.head: My misdeeds prevail against me;
3.tail: O be merciful and blot out our sins.

4.head: Blessed is the man whom you choose and receive unto yourself;
4.tail: he shall dwell in your courts, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of your house, even of your holy temple.

5.head: You shall show us wonderful things in your righteousness, O God of our salvation,
5.tail: for you are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the isles that are far away.

6.head: You in your strength set firm the mountains,
6.tail: and are girded about with power.

7.head: You still the raging of the seas,
7.tail: the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.

8.head: Those who dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be in fear of your wonders;
8.tail: you make the morning and evening to shout with joy.

9.head: You visit the earth and bless it;
9.tail: you make it very plenteous.

10.head: The river of God is full of water;
10.tail: you prepare the grain, for so you provide for the earth.

11.head: You water its furrows; you send rain into the little valleys;
11.tail: you make it soft with the drops of rain and bless the increase of it.

12.head: You crown the year with your goodness,
12.tail: and your paths overflow with plenty.

13.head: The fields of the wilderness are rich in pasture,
13.tail: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

14.head: The folds shall be full of sheep;
14.tail: the valleys also shall stand so thick with grain that they shall laugh and sing.

1.head: Be joyful in God, all you lands;
1.tail: sing praises to the honor of his Name; make his praise to be glorious.

2.head: Say to God,  How wonderful are your works;
2.tail: through the greatness of your power shall your enemies cower before you.

3.head: For all the world shall worship you,
3.tail: sing to you, and praise your Name.

4.head: O come and see the works of God,
4.tail: how wonderful he is in his doing toward all people.

5.head: He turned the sea into dry land, so that they went through the water on foot;
5.tail: therefore in him let us rejoice.

6.head: He rules with his power for ever; his eyes keep watch over the nations;
6.tail: let not the rebellious exalt themselves.

7.head: Bless our God, you peoples,
7.tail: and make the voice of his praise to be heard,

8.head: Who holds our soul in life,
8.tail: and does not allow our feet to slip.

9.head: For you, O God, have proved us;
9.tail: you have tried us, as silver is tried.

10.head: You brought us into the snare
10.tail: and laid trouble upon our backs.

11.head: You allowed men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and water;
11.tail: but you brought us out into a place of plenty.

12.head: I will go into your house with burnt offerings
12.tail: and will pay you my vows,

13.head: Even those which I promised with my lips
13.tail: and spoke with my mouth when I was in trouble.

14.head: I will offer you burnt sacrifices of fattened beasts, with the incense of rams;
14.tail: I will offer bullocks and goats.

15.head: Come here and listen, all you who fear God,
15.tail: and I will tell you what he has done for me.

16.head: I called to him with my mouth,
16.tail: and gave him praises with my tongue.

17.head: If I had inclined toward wickedness with my heart,
17.tail: the Lord would not have heard me.

18.head: But God has heard me
18.tail: and considered the voice of my prayer.

19.head: Blessed be God who has not refused my prayer,
19.tail: nor turned his mercy from me.

1.head: May God be merciful unto us, and bless us,
1.tail: and show us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us.

2.head: Let your way be known upon earth,
2.tail: your saving health among all nations.

3.head: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
3.tail: indeed, let all the peoples praise you.

4.head: O let the nations rejoice and be glad,
4.tail: for you shall judge the peoples righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

5.head: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
5.tail: let all the peoples praise you.

6.head: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase,
6.tail: and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

7.head: God shall bless us,
7.tail: and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

1.head: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered;
1.tail: let those who hate him also flee before him.

2.head: As the smoke vanishes, so shall you drive them away;
2.tail: and as wax melts before the fire, so let the ungodly perish before the presence of God.

3.head: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God;
3.tail: let them also be merry and joyful.

4.head: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name; magnify him who rides upon the heavens.
4.tail: The Lord is his Name; rejoice before him.

5.head: He is a father of the fatherless and defends the cause of the widows,
5.tail: God in his holy habitation.

6.head: He is the God who gives the solitary a home, and brings the prisoners out of captivity,
6.tail: but lets the rebellious dwell in a desert land.

7.head: O God, when you went forth before the people,
7.tail: when you went through the wilderness,

8.head: The earth shook, and the heavens poured forth rain at the presence of God,
8.tail: even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.

9.head: You, O God, sent a gracious rain upon your inheritance
9.tail: and refreshed the land when it was weary.

10.head: Your congregation found a dwelling there,
10.tail: for you, O God, of your goodness have provided for the poor.

11.head: The Lord gave the word;
11.tail: great was the company of those who proclaimed the tidings.

12.head: Kings with their armies fled, they fled,
12.tail: and the women at home divided the spoil.

13.head: Though you have lain among the sheepfolds,
13.tail: yet shall you be like the wings of a dove that are covered with silver, and whose feathers shine like gold.

14.head: When the Almighty scattered kings,
14.tail: it was as if it snowed in Zalmon.

15.head: As the hill of Bashan, so is God's hill,
15.tail: even a high hill, as the hill of Bashan.

16.head: Why look with envy, you high hills? This is God's hill, on which it pleases him to dwell;
16.tail: surely, the Lord will abide on it for ever.

17.head: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels,
17.tail: and the Lord has come from Sinai into the holy place.

18.head: You have gone up on high; you have led captivity captive, and received gifts from men,
18.tail: even from your enemies, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

19.head: Praised be the Lord daily,
19.tail: even the God who helps us and pours his benefits upon us.

20.head: He is our God, the God from whom salvation comes;
20.tail: God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.

21.head: God shall wound the head of his enemies,
21.tail: and the hairy scalp of those who persist in their wickedness.

22.head: The Lord has said,  I will bring back my people again, as I did from Bashan;
22.tail: my own will I bring back again, as I did before from the depths of the sea,

23.head: That your foot may be dipped in the blood of your enemies,
23.tail: and that the tongues of your dogs may be red with blood.

24.head: Your solemn procession is seen, O God,
24.tail: how you go into the sanctuary, my God and King.

25.head: The singers go before, the musicians follow after;
25.tail: in the midst are the maidens playing the timbrels.

26.head: Give thanks unto God in the congregations,
26.tail: unto the Lord, the fountain of Israel.

27.head: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel,
27.tail: the princes of Zebulon, and the princes of Naphtali.

28.head: O God, send forth your strength;
28.tail: establish, O God, what you have wrought in us.

29.head: For your temple's sake at Jerusalem,
29.tail: kings shall bring presents unto you.

30.head: Rebuke the beasts that dwell among the reeds,
30.tail: a herd of bulls with their calves;

31.head: Rebuke the peoples who trample on those whom you have tried as silver,
31.tail: and scatter the peoples who delight in war.

32.head: Then shall they bring tribute out of Egypt;
32.tail: Ethiopia shall stretch out her hands unto God.

33.head: Sing unto God, O you kingdoms of the earth;
33.tail: O sing praises unto the Lord,

34.head: Unto God who sits in the heavens over all from the beginning;
34.tail: he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.

35.head: Ascribe power to God over Israel;
35.tail: his worship and strength are in the clouds.

36.head: O God, you are wonderful in your holy places;
36.tail: the God of Israel will give strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.

1.head: Save me, O God,
1.tail: for the waters have come up even to my neck.

2.head: I sink down in the deep mire, where there is no ground;
2.tail: I have come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.

3.head: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry;
3.tail: my sight fails me from waiting so long for my God.

4.head: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
4.tail: those who are my enemies, and would destroy me wrongfully, are mighty.

5.head: They bid me restore things I never took.
5.tail: O God, you know my foolishness, and my faults are not hidden from you.

6.head: Let not those who trust in you, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed because of me;
6.tail: let not those who seek you be confounded through me, O God of Israel.

7.head: Surely for your sake have I suffered reproach;
7.tail: shame has covered my face.

8.head: I have become a stranger to my brethren,
8.tail: unknown to my mother's children,

9.head: Because zeal for your house has consumed me,
9.tail: and the reproaches of those who reproached you have fallen upon me.

10.head: I wept, and humbled myself with fasting,
10.tail: but that was turned to my reproach.

11.head: I put on sackcloth also,
11.tail: and I became a byword among them.

12.head: Those who sit in the gate speak against me,
12.tail: and the drunkards make songs about me.

13.head: But, Lord, I make my prayer to you
13.tail: in an acceptable time.

14.head: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of your mercy,
14.tail: even in the truth of your salvation.

15.head: Take me out of the mire, lest I sink;
15.tail: O let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.

16.head: Let not the floodwaters drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up,
16.tail: and let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.

17.head: Hear me, O Lord, for your loving-kindness is good;
17.tail: turn to me according to the multitude of your mercies;

18.head: And hide not your face from your servant, for I am in trouble;
18.tail: O hasten and hear me.

19.head: Draw near to me and save me;
19.tail: O deliver me because of my enemies.

20.head: You have known my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor;
20.tail: my adversaries are all in your sight.

21.head: Reproach has broken my heart; I am full of heaviness;
21.tail: I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no one, neither have I found any to comfort me.

22.head: They gave me gall to eat,
22.tail: and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.head: Let their table become a snare for them,
23.tail: and let their prosperity become a trap for them.

24.head: Let their eyes be blinded, that they may not see,
24.tail: and make their loins tremble continually.

25.head: Pour out your indignation upon them,
25.tail: and let your wrathful displeasure overtake them.

26.head: Let their habitation be desolate,
26.tail: and let no one dwell in their tents.

27.head: For they persecute him whom you have stricken,
27.tail: and they talk of the pain of those you have wounded.

28.head: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt,
28.tail: and let them not receive your vindication.

29.head: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living,
29.tail: and not be written among the righteous.

30.head: As for me, when I am poor and in pain,
30.tail: your help, O God, shall lift me up.

31.head: I will praise the Name of God with a song,

32.head: This also shall please the Lord
32.tail: more than an ox or a bullock that has horns and hooves.

33.head: The humble shall consider this and be glad;
33.tail: seek after God and your hearts shall live.

34.head: For the Lord hears the poor
34.tail: and does not despise his prisoners.

35.head: Let heaven and earth praise him,
35.tail: the sea, and all that moves therein.

36.head: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah,
36.tail: that they may dwell there and have it in possession.

37.head: The posterity of his servants shall inherit it,
37.tail: and those who love his Name shall dwell therein.

1.head: Hasten, O God, to deliver me;
1.tail: make haste to help me, O Lord.

2.head: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my life;
2.tail: let them be turned back and put to confusion who wish me evil.

3.head: Let them be soon brought to shame
3.tail: who cry over me,  Aha! Aha!

4.head: But let all those who seek you be joyful and glad in you;
4.tail: and let all who delight in your salvation say always,  The Lord be praised.

5.head: As for me, I am poor and in misery;
5.tail: hasten to me, O God.

6.head: You are my helper and my deliverer;
6.tail: O Lord, do not tarry.

1.head: In you, O Lord, have I put my trust;
1.tail: let me never be put to shame.

2.head: Rescue me and deliver me in your righteousness;
2.tail: incline your ear to me and save me.

3.head: Be my rock and my refuge, where I may always return;
3.tail: you have promised to help me, for you are my stronghold and my fortress.

4.head: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly,
4.tail: out of the hand of the unrighteous and the cruel.

5.head: For you, O Lord God, are the one I long for;
5.tail: you are my hope, even from my youth.

6.head: Through you have I been upheld ever since I was born;
6.tail: you took me out of my mother's womb; my praise shall be always of you.

7.head: I have become a portent to many;
7.tail: but you are my refuge and my strength.

8.head: O let my mouth be filled with your praise,
8.tail: that I may sing of your glory all the day long.

9.head: Cast me not away in the time of old age;
9.tail: forsake me not when my strength fails me.

10.head: For my enemies speak against me, and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
10.tail: They say,  God has forsaken him; pursue him and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

11.head: Go not far from me, O God;
11.tail: my God, make haste to help me.

12.head: Let those who are my adversaries be confounded and perish;
12.tail: let those who seek to do me evil be covered with shame and dishonor.

13.head: As for me, I will always patiently abide,
13.tail: and will praise you more and more.

14.head: My mouth shall speak daily of your righteousness and salvation,
14.tail: for I know not the end of them.

15.head: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God,
15.tail: and will make mention of your righteousness, yours alone.

16.head: You, O God, have taught me from my youth;
16.tail: even to this day I am telling of your wondrous works.

17.head: Forsake me not, O God, in my old age, when I am gray-headed,
17.tail: until I have proclaimed your strength to this generation, and your power to all those who are yet to come.

18.head: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens;
18.tail: you have done great things. Who is like you, O God?

19.head: Oh, what great troubles and adversities you have shown me! And yet you have turned and refreshed me;
19.tail: indeed, you have brought me again from the depths of the earth.

20.head: You have brought me to great honor
20.tail: and comforted me on every side;

21.head: Therefore will I praise you and your faithfulness, O God, playing on a stringed instrument;
21.tail: to you will I sing with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.

22.head: My lips will rejoice when I sing to you,
22.tail: and so will my soul, which you have delivered.

23.head: My tongue also shall speak of your righteousness all the day long,
23.tail: for they are confounded and brought to shame who seek to do me evil.

1.head: Give the King your judgments, O God,
1.tail: and your righteousness to the King's son.

2.head: Then shall he judge your people with righteousness
2.tail: and defend the poor with justice.

3.head: The mountains also shall bring peace,
3.tail: and the little hills righteousness to the people.

4.head: He shall vindicate the poor among the people,
4.tail: defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrongdoer.

5.head: They shall fear you as long as the sun and moon endure,
5.tail: from one generation to another.

6.head: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass,
6.tail: even as showers that water the earth.

7.head: In his time shall the righteous flourish,
7.tail: even an abundance of peace, so long as the moon endures.

8.head: His dominion shall be also from one sea to the other,
8.tail: and from the river unto the world's end.

9.head: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him;
9.tail: his enemies shall lick the dust.

10.head: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall give presents;
10.tail: the kings of Arabia and Seba shall bring gifts.

11.head: All kings shall fall down before him;
11.tail: all nations shall do him service.

12.head: For he shall deliver the poor when he cries,
12.tail: the needy also, and the one that has no helper.

13.head: He shall be favorable to the lowly and needy,
13.tail: and shall preserve the lives of the poor.

14.head: He shall deliver them from falsehood and wrong,
14.tail: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

15.head: Long may he live! And unto him shall be given the gold of Arabia;
15.tail: prayer shall ever be made unto him, and daily shall he be blessed.

16.head: There shall be an abundance of grain on the earth, thick upon the hilltops;
16.tail: its fruit shall flourish like Lebanon, its grain like the grass upon the earth.

17.head: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain as long as the sun.
17.tail: All the nations shall be blessed through him and shall call him blessed.

18.head: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel,
18.tail: who alone does wondrous things;

19.head: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever;
19.tail: and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.

1.head: Truly, God is loving to Israel,
1.tail: even to those who have a clean heart.

2.head: Nevertheless, my feet had almost stumbled;
2.tail: my steps had nearly slipped.

3.head: For I was envious of the proud
3.tail: when I saw the ungodly in such prosperity.

4.head: For they are in no fear of death,
4.tail: but their bodies are healthy and strong.

5.head: They come to no misfortune like other folk,
5.tail: neither are they afflicted like others.

6.head: Therefore they wear pride as a necklace,
6.tail: and they wrap themselves with violence as with a garment.

7.head: Their eyes swell with greed,
7.tail: and their hearts overflow with wicked thoughts.

8.head: Their talk is malice and mockery;
8.tail: they have proud looks, and tyrannous words are on their lips.

9.head: For they set their mouth against the heavens,
9.tail: and their evil speech spreads through the world.

10.head: Therefore the people turn to them,
10.tail: and find no fault in them.

11.head: They say,  How should God perceive it?
11.tail: Is there knowledge in the Most High?

12.head: Behold, these are the ungodly;
12.tail: they prosper in their ways, and they have riches in possession.

13.head: I said,  Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart
13.tail: and washed my hands in innocence.

14.head: All the day long have I been afflicted,
14.tail: and chastened every morning.

15.head: Indeed, had I spoken as they do,
15.tail: then would I have betrayed the generation of your children.

16.head: When I sought to understand this,
16.tail: it was too hard for me,

17.head: Until I went into the sanctuary of God;
17.tail: then I understood their end.

18.head: Surely, you set them in slippery places,
18.tail: and cast them down, and destroy them.

19.head: Oh, how suddenly are they consumed;
19.tail: they perish and come to a fearful end.

20.head: Indeed, like a dream when one awakens,
20.tail: so shall you make their image vanish out of the city.

21.head: Thus my heart was grieved,
21.tail: and I was wounded within;

22.head: So foolish was I, and ignorant,
22.tail: as if I were a beast before you.

23.head: Nevertheless, I am always with you,
23.tail: for you hold me by my right hand.

24.head: You shall guide me with your counsel,
24.tail: and after that receive me with glory.

25.head: Whom have I in heaven but you?
25.tail: And there is no one on earth whom I desire in comparison with you.

26.head: Though my flesh and my heart fail me,
26.tail: God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

27.head: For behold, those who forsake you shall perish;
27.tail: you destroy all those who are unfaithful to you.

28.head: But it is good for me to hold fast to God, to put my trust in the Lord God,
28.tail: and to speak of all your works in the gates of the city of Zion.

1.head: O God, why have you utterly cast us off?
1.tail: Why is your wrath so hot against the sheep of your pasture?

2.head: O think upon your congregation
2.tail: whom you have purchased and redeemed of old.

3.head: Think upon the tribe of your inheritance,
3.tail: and Mount Zion, where you have dwelt.

4.head: Draw near and behold how all is made desolate
4.tail: and how the enemy has destroyed all that is in your sanctuary.

5.head: Your adversaries roar in the midst of your holy place
5.tail: and set up their banners as tokens of victory.

6.head: Like hewers of timber in a thicket of trees,
6.tail: so have they broken down all the carved work with axes and hammers.

7.head: They have set fire to your holy place
7.tail: and have defiled the dwelling place of your Name, even to the ground.

8.head: They said in their hearts,  Let us make havoc of them altogether.
8.tail: Thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.

9.head: We do not see any signs; there is not one prophet anymore;
9.tail: there is no one who knows how long these things shall continue.

10.head: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonor?
10.tail: How long shall the enemy blaspheme your Name, for ever?

11.head: Why do you withdraw your hand?
11.tail: Why do you not take your right hand out of your bosom to consume the enemy?

12.head: For God is my King of old;
12.tail: he is the one bringing help upon the earth.

13.head: You divided the sea through your power;
13.tail: you broke the heads of the dragons in the waters.

14.head: You smote the heads of Leviathan in pieces
14.tail: and gave him to be food for the people in the wilderness.

15.head: You brought fountains and waters out of the hard rocks,
15.tail: and you dried up mighty waters.

16.head: The day is yours, and the night is yours;
16.tail: you have prepared the light and the sun.

17.head: You have set all the borders of the earth;
17.tail: you have made summer and winter.

18.head: Remember this, O Lord, how the enemy scoffed,
18.tail: and how the foolish people have blasphemed your Name.

19.head: Deliver not the soul of your turtledove to the wild beasts,
19.tail: and forget not for ever the lives of your poor.

20.head: Look upon your covenant,
20.tail: for the dark places of the earth are full of violence.

21.head: Let not the oppressed go away ashamed,
21.tail: but let the poor and needy give praise to your Name.

22.head: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause;
22.tail: remember how the foolish one blasphemes you daily.

23.head: Forget not the voice of your enemies,
23.tail: nor the tumult of those who hate you, which increases ever more and more.

1.head: Unto you, O God, do we give thanks;
1.tail: indeed, unto you do we give thanks.

2.head: Those who call upon your Name
2.tail: declare your wondrous works.

3.head: Surely at the time which I appoint,
3.tail: I, the Lord, will judge according to what is right.

4.head: The earth shakes with fear, and all that dwell therein;
4.tail: but I, even I, have made firm its pillars.

5.head: I say to the proud, 'You should not boast!'
5.tail: And to the ungodly, 'Do not lift up your horn!

6.head: Do not lift up your horn on high,
6.tail: nor speak with a stiff neck.'

7.head: For help comes neither from the east nor from the west,
7.tail: nor yet from the wilderness or the mountains.

8.head: For it is God who is the Judge;
8.tail: he puts down one and lifts up another.

9.head: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is foaming;
9.tail: it is fully mixed, and he pours it out.

10.head: As for the dregs of it,
10.tail: all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them and drain them out.

11.head: But I will magnify the God of Jacob
11.tail: and praise him for ever and ever.

12.head: All the horns of the ungodly will I break,
12.tail: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

1.head: In Judah God is known;
1.tail: his Name is great in Israel.

2.head: At Salem is his tabernacle,
2.tail: and his dwelling is in Zion.

3.head: There he broke the arrows of the bow,
3.tail: the shield, the sword, and the weapons of battle.

4.head: You are of more honor and might
4.tail: than the everlasting hills.

5.head: The strong of heart have been despoiled; they have slept their sleep;
5.tail: and all those whose hands were mighty have lost their strength.

6.head: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
6.tail: both the chariot and horse lie stunned upon the ground.

7.head: You, even you, are to be feared,
7.tail: and who may stand in your sight when you are angry?

8.head: You caused your judgment to be heard from heaven;
8.tail: the earth trembled and was silent,

9.head: When God arose to judgment
9.tail: and to help all the meek upon earth.

10.head: The wrath of man shall be turned to your praise,
10.tail: and the remnant of fierceness you shall restrain.

11.head: Make a vow unto the Lord your God and keep it, all you who are round about him;
11.tail: bring gifts unto him who is worthy to be feared.

12.head: He restrains the spirit of princes,
12.tail: and is feared among the kings of the earth.

1.head: I will cry unto God with my voice;
1.tail: even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.

2.head: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord;
2.tail: my hands were stretched out in the night without rest; my soul refused comfort.

3.head: When I think upon God, I groan;
3.tail: when I ponder, my spirit grows faint.

4.head: You hold my eyelids open;
4.tail: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

5.head: I consider the days of old;
5.tail: I call to remembrance the years that are past.

6.head: In the night I commune with my own heart;
6.tail: I meditate and search my spirit.

7.head: Will the Lord cast me off for ever,
7.tail: and will he no more show his favor?

8.head: Is his mercy gone for ever,
8.tail: and has his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

9.head: Has God forgotten to be gracious,
9.tail: and will he withhold his loving-kindness in displeasure?

10.head: And I said,  Has his right hand become weak?
10.tail: Has the hand of the Most High lost its strength?

11.head: I will remember the works of the Lord,
11.tail: and call to mind your wonders of old time.

12.head: I will think also of all your works,
12.tail: and my talk shall be of your deeds.

13.head: Your way, O God, is holy;
13.tail: who is so great a God as our God?

14.head: You are the God who does wonders,
14.tail: and have declared your power among the peoples.

15.head: You have mightily delivered your people,
15.tail: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

16.head: The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and were afraid;
16.tail: the depths also were troubled.

17.head: The clouds poured out water, the skies thundered,
17.tail: and your arrows flashed on every side.

18.head: The voice of your thunder was heard in the whirlwind; the lightning lit up the world;
18.tail: the earth was moved and shook.

19.head: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters,
19.tail: yet your footsteps were not seen.

20.head: You led your people like sheep
20.tail: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

1.head: Hear my teaching, O my people;
1.tail: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.head: I will open my mouth in a parable;
2.tail: I will utter dark sayings of old,

3.head: Which we have heard and known,
3.tail: and such as our forefathers have told us,

4.head: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come,
4.tail: but show the honor of the Lord, his mighty and wonderful works that he has done.

5.head: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law,
5.tail: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,

6.head: That their posterity might know it,
6.tail: and the children which were yet unborn;

7.head: With the intent that when they came up
7.tail: they might show it to their children,

8.head: That they might put their trust in God,
8.tail: and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments;

9.head: And not be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation,
9.tail: a generation that did not set their heart aright, and whose spirit did not cleave steadfastly to God,

10.head: Like the children of Ephraim, archers carrying bows,
10.tail: who turned back in the day of battle.

11.head: They did not keep the covenant of God,
11.tail: and would not walk in his law,

12.head: But forgot what he had done,
12.tail: and the wonderful works that he had shown them.

13.head: Marvelous things he did in the sight of our forefathers,
13.tail: in the land of Egypt, even in the field of Zoan.

14.head: He divided the sea and let them go through;
14.tail: he made the waters to stand in a heap.

15.head: In the daytime he led them with a cloud,
15.tail: and all the night through with a light of fire.

16.head: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness
16.tail: and gave them drink in abundance, as out of the great deep.

17.head: He brought waters out of the stony rock,
17.tail: so that it gushed out like the rivers.

18.head: Yet for all this they sinned more against him,
18.tail: and provoked the Most High in the wilderness.

19.head: They tested God in their hearts
19.tail: and demanded food for their craving.

20.head: They spoke against God, saying,
20.tail: Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

21.head: Indeed, he smote the stony rock, so that water gushed out, and the streams overflowed;
21.tail: but can he give bread also, or provide meat for his people?

22.head: When the Lord heard this, he was full of wrath;
22.tail: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and there flared up fierce anger against Israel,

23.head: Because they did not believe in God,
23.tail: and did not put their trust in his help.

24.head: So he commanded the clouds above
24.tail: and opened the doors of heaven.

25.head: He rained down manna upon them to eat
25.tail: and gave them food from heaven.

26.head: So mortals ate the bread of angels;
26.tail: for he sent them food enough.

27.head: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,
27.tail: and through his power he brought in the south wind.

28.head: He rained meat upon them as thick as dust
28.tail: and feathered fowl like the sand of the sea.

29.head: He let it fall among their tents,

30.head: So they ate and were well filled, for he gave them what they desired;
30.tail: they did not deny themselves their cravings,

31.head: But while the food was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the mightiest of them,
31.tail: and struck down the young men of Israel.

32.head: But for all this they sinned yet more,
32.tail: and did not believe his wondrous works.

33.head: Therefore he brought their days to an end in vanity

34.head: When he slew them, they sought him,
34.tail: and returned, and inquired after God.

35.head: And they remembered that God was their rock,
35.tail: and the Most High God was their redeemer.

36.head: Nevertheless, they flattered him with their mouth
36.tail: and spoke deceitfully to him with their tongue.

37.head: For their heart was not fixed on him,
37.tail: neither did they continue steadfast in his covenant.

38.head: But he was so merciful that he forgave their iniquities

39.head: Indeed, many times he turned his wrath away
39.tail: and would not permit his displeasure to arise.

40.head: For he considered that they were but flesh,
40.tail: that they were even as the wind that passes away and comes not again.

41.head: Many times they provoked him in the wilderness
41.tail: and grieved him in the desert.

42.head: They turned back, and tested God,
42.tail: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

43.head: They remembered not his power,
43.tail: nor the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy,

44.head: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt
44.tail: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

45.head: He turned their waters into blood,
45.tail: so that they might not drink of the rivers.

46.head: He sent flies among them, which devoured them up,

47.head: He gave their fruit to the grasshopper
47.tail: and their labor to the locust.

48.head: He destroyed their vines with hailstones
48.tail: and their sycamore trees with the frost.

49.head: He smote their cattle also with hailstones
49.tail: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

50.head: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble,
50.tail: sending these destroying angels among them.

51.head: He made a way for his indignation, and did not spare their soul from death,
51.tail: but gave their life over to the pestilence,

52.head: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt,
52.tail: the firstfruits of their strength in the dwellings of Ham.

53.head: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep
53.tail: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

54.head: He brought them out safely, and they were not afraid;
54.tail: he overwhelmed their enemies with the sea,

55.head: And brought them within the borders of his holy land,
55.tail: to his mountain which he obtained with his right hand.

56.head: He cast out the nations before them,
56.tail: and caused their land to be divided among them for an inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

57.head: But they tested and displeased the Most High God,
57.tail: and did not keep his testimonies,

58.head: But turned their backs and fell away like their forefathers,
58.tail: twisting aside like a broken bow.

59.head: For they grieved him with their hill altars
59.tail: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

60.head: When God heard this, he was full of wrath

61.head: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh,
61.tail: even the tent that he had pitched among them.

62.head: He delivered the ark into captivity,
62.tail: and his glory into the enemy's hand.

63.head: He gave his people over to the sword
63.tail: and was angry with his inheritance.

64.head: Fire consumed their young men,
64.tail: and their maidens had no marriage songs.

65.head: Their priests were slain with the sword,
65.tail: and their widows made no lamentation.

66.head: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,
66.tail: and like a warrior recovered from wine.

67.head: He drove his enemies backward
67.tail: and put them to a perpetual shame.

68.head: He rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
68.tail: and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,

69.head: But chose the tribe of Judah,
69.tail: even the hill of Zion which he loved.

70.head: And there he built his sanctuary, like the heights of heaven,
70.tail: like the earth which he had established for ever.

71.head: He chose David his servant,
71.tail: and took him away from the sheepfolds;

72.head: As he was following the ewes that were great with young, God took him,
72.tail: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

73.head: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart,
73.tail: and guided them with skillful hands.

1.head: O God, the nations have come into your inheritance;
1.tail: they have defiled your holy temple, and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.

2.head: The dead bodies of your servants have they given to be meat for the birds of the air,
2.tail: and the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the land.

3.head: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem,
3.tail: and there was no one to bury them.

4.head: We have become a reproach to our enemies,
4.tail: an object of scorn and derision to those who are round about us.

5.head: O Lord, how long will you be angry?
5.tail: Shall your jealousy burn like fire for ever?

6.head: Pour out your indignation upon the nations that have not known you,
6.tail: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.

7.head: For they have devoured Jacob
7.tail: and laid waste his dwelling place.

8.head: O remember not our past sins, but have mercy on us speedily,
8.tail: for we have come to great misery.

9.head: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your Name;
9.tail: O deliver us and forgive our sins for your Name's sake.

10.head: Why do the nations say,
10.tail: Where now is their God?

11.head: O let the vengeance of your servants' blood that is shed
11.tail: be known in our sight among the nations.

12.head: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you;
12.tail: according to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are condemned to die.

13.head: As for the blasphemy by which our neighbors have blasphemed you,
13.tail: repay them, O Lord, seven-fold into their bosoms.

14.head: So we, who are your people and the sheep of your pasture, shall give you thanks for ever,
14.tail: and will always be showing forth your praise from generation to generation.

1.head: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a sheep;
1.tail: show yourself also, you that sit upon the cherubim.

2.head: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
2.tail: stir up your strength and come to help us.

3.head: Restore us again, O God;
3.tail: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

4.head: O Lord God of hosts,
4.tail: how long will you be angry with your people that pray?

5.head: You feed them with the bread of tears
5.tail: and give them plenteous tears to drink.

6.head: You have made us the derision of our neighbors,
6.tail: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

7.head: Restore us again, O God of hosts;
7.tail: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

8.head: You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
8.tail: you have cast out the nations and planted it.

9.head: You made room for it,
9.tail: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.

10.head: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
10.tail: and the boughs thereof were like the mighty cedar trees.

11.head: It stretched out its branches to the sea
11.tail: and its boughs to the river.

12.head: Why have you broken down its hedge,
12.tail: so that all those who go by pluck off its grapes?

13.head: The wild boar out of the wood roots it up,
13.tail: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

14.head: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
14.tail: behold, and visit this vine,

15.head: And the place of the vineyard that your right hand has planted,
15.tail: and the branch that you made so strong for yourself.

16.head: As for those who burn it with fire and cut it down,
16.tail: let them perish at the rebuke of your countenance.

17.head: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand
17.tail: and upon the son of man, whom you made so strong for yourself.

18.head: And so we will not turn back from you;
18.tail: O let us live, and we shall call upon your Name.

19.head: Restore us again, O Lord God of hosts;
19.tail: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

1.head: O sing merrily unto God our strength;
1.tail: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

2.head: Take the psalm, bring hither the timbrel,
2.tail: the merry harp with the lute.

3.head: Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
3.tail: even in the time appointed, and on our solemn feast day.

4.head: For this was made a statute for Israel
4.tail: and a law of the God of Jacob.

5.head: This he laid upon Joseph for a testimony,
5.tail: when he came out of the land of Egypt.

6.head: I eased his shoulder from the burden,
6.tail: and his hands were delivered from bearing the load.

7.head: You called upon me in troubles, and I delivered you,
7.tail: and I answered you in the thundercloud and tested you at the waters of strife.

8.head: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
8.tail: O Israel, if you will hearken unto me,

9.head: There shall be no strange god among you,
9.tail: neither shall you worship any other god.

10.head: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
10.tail: open your mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

11.head: But my people would not hear my voice,
11.tail: and Israel would not obey me.

12.head: So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their hearts,
12.tail: and let them follow their own imaginations.

13.head: Oh, that my people would have hearkened unto me,
13.tail: that Israel had walked in my ways.

14.head: I would soon have put down their enemies
14.tail: and turned my hand against their adversaries.

15.head: The haters of the Lord would humble themselves before him,
15.tail: and their time of punishment would endure for ever.

16.head: But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat-flour,
16.tail: and with honey out of the stony rock would I satisfy him.

1.head: God stands in the council of princes;
1.tail: he is a Judge among gods.

2.head: How long will you give wrong judgment
2.tail: and accept the ungodly?

3.head: Defend the poor and fatherless;
3.tail: see that those who are in need and necessity have what is right.

4.head: Deliver the outcast and poor;
4.tail: save them from the hand of the ungodly.

5.head: They will not learn nor understand, but walk about in darkness;
5.tail: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

6.head: I have said,  You are gods,
6.tail: and you are all the children of the Most High;

7.head: But you shall die like mortals,
7.tail: and fall like one of the princes.

8.head: Arise, O God, and judge the earth,
8.tail: for you shall take all nations for your inheritance.

1.head: Hold not your tongue, O God; keep not silent,
1.tail: but rouse yourself, O God.

2.head: For behold, your enemies murmur,
2.tail: and those who hate you have lifted up their head.

3.head: They have conspired secretly against your people
3.tail: and taken counsel against your cherished ones.

4.head: They have said,  Come, and let us wipe them out, that they may be no more a people,
4.tail: and that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.

5.head: For they have brought their heads together with one consent
5.tail: and are aligned against you:

6.head: The tents of the Edomites and the Ishmaelites,
6.tail: the Moabites and Hagarenes,

7.head: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek,
7.tail: the Philistines with those who dwell at Tyre.

8.head: Assyria also has joined with them,
8.tail: and has helped the children of Lot.

9.head: But do to them as you did to the Midianites,
9.tail: to Sisera and to Jabin at the brook of Kishon,

10.head: Who perished at Endor
10.tail: and became as dung on the earth.

11.head: Make their princes like Oreb and Ze b;
11.tail: indeed, make all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

12.head: Who said,  Let us take for ourselves
12.tail: the pastures of God as our possession.

13.head: O my God, make them like whirling dust
13.tail: and like stubble before the wind,

14.head: Like the fire that burns up the woods
14.tail: and like the flame that consumes the mountains.

15.head: Pursue them even with your tempest,
15.tail: and make them afraid with your storm.

16.head: Cover their faces with shame, O Lord,
16.tail: that they may seek your Name.

17.head: Let them be disgraced and dismayed ever more and more;
17.tail: let them be put to shame and perish.

18.head: And they shall know that you, whose Name is the Lord,
18.tail: are alone the Most High over all the earth.

1.head: How lovely are your dwellings,
1.tail: O Lord God of hosts!

2.head: My soul has a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the Lord;
2.tail: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

3.head: Indeed, the sparrow has found her a house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young,
3.tail: even your altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

4.head: Blessed are they who dwell in your house;
4.tail: they will be always praising you.

5.head: Blessed is the one whose strength is in you,
5.tail: in whose heart are your ways,

6.head: Who going through the valley of misery uses it for a well;
6.tail: indeed, the early rains fill the pools with water.

7.head: They will go from strength to strength,
7.tail: and the God of gods shall be seen by them in Zion.

8.head: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer;
8.tail: hearken, O God of Jacob.

9.head: Behold, O God, our defender,
9.tail: and look upon the face of your Anointed.

10.head: For one day in your courts
10.tail: is better than a thousand;

11.head: I would rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God
11.tail: than dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

12.head: For the Lord God is a light and defense;
12.tail: the Lord will give grace and honor, and no good thing shall he withhold from those who live a godly life.

13.head: O Lord God of hosts,
13.tail: blessed is the one who puts his trust in you.

1.head: Lord, you have been gracious to your land;
1.tail: you have turned away the captivity of Jacob.

2.head: You have forgiven the offence of your people
2.tail: and covered all their sins.

3.head: You have taken away all your displeasure
3.tail: and turned yourself from your wrathful indignation.

4.head: Restore us then, O God our Savior,
4.tail: and let your anger cease from us.

5.head: Will you be displeased at us for ever,
5.tail: and will you stretch out your wrath from one generation to another?

6.head: Will you not turn again and quicken us,
6.tail: that your people may rejoice in you?

7.head: Show us your mercy, O Lord,
7.tail: and grant us your salvation.

8.head: I will hearken to what the Lord God will say,
8.tail: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.

9.head: For his salvation is near to those who fear him,
9.tail: that glory may dwell in our land.

10.head: Mercy and truth have met together;
10.tail: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

11.head: Truth shall flourish out of the earth,
11.tail: and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

12.head: Indeed, the Lord shall show goodness,
12.tail: and our land shall give its increase.

13.head: Righteousness shall go before him,
13.tail: and he shall direct his going in the way.

1.head: Bow down your ear, O Lord, and hear me,
1.tail: for I am poor and in misery.

2.head: Preserve my life, for I am faithful;
2.tail: my God, save your servant who puts his trust in you.

3.head: Be merciful unto me, O Lord,
3.tail: for I will call daily upon you.

4.head: Comfort the soul of your servant,
4.tail: for to you, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

5.head: For you, Lord, are good and gracious,
5.tail: and of great mercy to all those who call upon you.

6.head: Give ear, Lord, unto my prayer,
6.tail: and attend to the voice of my humble supplications.

7.head: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you,
7.tail: for you answer me when I call.

8.head: Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord,
8.tail: nor are there any deeds like yours.

9.head: All nations that you have made shall come and worship you, O Lord,
9.tail: and shall glorify your Name.

10.head: For you are great and do wondrous things;
10.tail: indeed, you are God alone.

11.head: Teach me your way, O Lord, and I will walk in your truth;
11.tail: O knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.

12.head: I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
12.tail: and will praise your Name for evermore.

13.head: For great is your mercy toward me;
13.tail: you have delivered my life from the nethermost Pit.

14.head: O God, the proud have risen up against me,
14.tail: and the company of violent men have sought after my life, and have not set you before their eyes.

15.head: But you, O Lord God, are full of compassion and mercy,
15.tail: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

16.head: O turn then unto me, and have mercy upon me;
16.tail: give your strength unto your servant, and help the son of your handmaid.

17.head: Show me some token of your favor, that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed,
17.tail: because you, Lord, have been my helper and comforter.

1.head: The Lord loves the foundation which he has laid upon the holy hills;
1.tail: the gates of Zion are dearer to him than all the dwellings of Jacob.

2.head: Very excellent things are spoken of you,
2.tail: O city of God.

3.head: I will consider Egypt and Babylon
3.tail: among those who know me.

4.head: Behold Philistia also, and Tyre, with Ethiopia;
4.tail: each one was born in her.

5.head: And of Zion it shall be reported that each one was born in her,
5.tail: and the Most High shall establish her.

6.head: The Lord shall record it when he registers the people,
6.tail: that each one was born there.

7.head: The singers and the dancers also shall say,
7.tail: All my fresh springs are in you.

1.head: O Lord God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you;
1.tail: O let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to my call.

2.head: For my soul is full of trouble,
2.tail: and my life draws nigh to the Grave.

3.head: I am counted as one of those who go down into the pit,
3.tail: and I have become as one who has no strength.

4.head: I have become like the dead, and like the slain who lie in the grave,
4.tail: whom you remember no more, and who are cut off from your hand.

5.head: You have laid me in the lowest pit,
5.tail: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

6.head: Your indignation lies heavy upon me,
6.tail: and you have overwhelmed me with all your storms.

7.head: You have put my friends far from me,
7.tail: and made me to be abhorred by them.

8.head: I am in prison;
8.tail: I cannot go forth.

9.head: My sight fails because of trouble;
9.tail: Lord, I have called daily upon you; I have stretched forth my hands unto you.

10.head: Do you show wonders among the dead,
10.tail: or shall the dead rise up again and praise you?

11.head: Shall your loving-kindness be shown in the grave,
11.tail: or your faithfulness in destruction?

12.head: Shall your wondrous works be known in the dark,
12.tail: and your righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

13.head: Unto you have I cried, O Lord,
13.tail: and early shall my prayer come before you.

14.head: Lord, why do you cast off my soul
14.tail: and hide your face from me?

15.head: I am in misery, like one who is at the point of death;
