15.tail: even from my youth, your terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

16.head: Your wrathful displeasure goes over me,
16.tail: and the fear of you has undone me.

17.head: Daily they come round about me like water,
17.tail: and encompass me on every side.

18.head: My companions and neighbors you have put away from me,
18.tail: and hidden my friends out of my sight.

1.head: My song shall be always of the loving-kindness of the Lord;
1.tail: with my mouth will I ever be proclaiming your faithfulness, from one generation to another.

2.head: For I have said,  Mercy shall be built up for ever;
2.tail: your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.

3.head: I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
3.tail: I have sworn to David my servant:

4.head: Your seed will I establish for ever,
4.tail: and set up your throne from one generation to another.

5.head: O Lord, the heavens will praise your wondrous works
5.tail: and your faithfulness in the assembly of the saints.

6.head: For who in the clouds can be compared unto the Lord?
6.tail: And who among the gods is like unto the Lord?

7.head: God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints,
7.tail: and to be held in reverence by all those who are round about him.

8.head: O Lord God of hosts, who is like you?
8.tail: Your faithfulness, most mighty Lord, is round about you.

9.head: You rule the raging of the sea;
9.tail: you still the waves when they arise.

10.head: You have subdued Rahab of the deep, and destroyed her;
10.tail: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

11.head: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours;
11.tail: you laid the foundation of the world, and all that is in it.

12.head: You have made the north and the south;
12.tail: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in your Name.

13.head: You have a mighty arm;
13.tail: strong is your hand, and high is your right hand.

14.head: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
14.tail: mercy and truth shall go before your face.

15.head: Blessed are the people, O Lord, who rejoice in you;
15.tail: they shall walk in the light of your countenance.

16.head: Their delight shall be in your Name all the day long,
16.tail: and in your righteousness shall they make their boast.

17.head: For you are the glory of their strength,
17.tail: and by your favor you shall lift up our might.

18.head: For the Lord is our defense;
18.tail: the Holy One of Israel is our King.

19.head: You spoke in a vision to your saints, and said,
19.tail: I have set the crown upon one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

20.head: I have found David my servant;
20.tail: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

21.head: My hand shall hold him fast,
21.tail: and my arm shall strengthen him.

22.head: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence;
22.tail: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

23.head: I will smite his foes before his face
23.tail: and strike down those who hate him.

24.head: My faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him,
24.tail: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

25.head: I will give him dominion over the sea,
25.tail: and with his right hand shall he rule the rivers.

26.head: He shall say to me, 'You are my Father,
26.tail: my God, and the rock of my salvation.'

27.head: And I will make him my firstborn,
27.tail: higher than the kings of the earth.

28.head: My mercy will I keep for him for ever,
28.tail: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

29.head: His seed will I make to endure for ever
29.tail: and his throne as the days of heaven.

30.head: But if his children forsake my law,
30.tail: and do not walk in my judgments,

31.head: If they break my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
31.tail: I will punish their offenses with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

32.head: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness I will not utterly take from him,
32.tail: nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

33.head: My covenant I will not break,
33.tail: nor alter the word that has gone out of my lips.

34.head: I have sworn once by my holiness
34.tail: that I will not fail David.

35.head: His seed shall endure for ever
35.tail: and his throne as the sun before me.

36.head: It shall endure for evermore as the moon,
36.tail: and as the faithful witness in the heavens.

37.head: But you have rejected and forsaken your Anointed;
37.tail: you are full of wrath against him.

38.head: You have broken the covenant with your servant;
38.tail: you have defiled his crown and cast it to the ground.

39.head: You have overthrown all his walls

40.head: All those who go by plunder him,
40.tail: and he has become a reproach to his neighbors.

41.head: You have exalted the right hand of his enemies,
41.tail: and made all his adversaries rejoice.

42.head: You have turned back the edge of his sword
42.tail: and have not given him victory in the battle.

43.head: You have taken away his glory
43.tail: and cast his throne down to the ground.

44.head: The days of his youth you have shortened

45.head: Lord, how long will you utterly hide yourself?
45.tail: How long shall your wrath burn like fire?

46.head: O remember how short my time is;
46.tail: why have you made all people for nought?

47.head: What man is there who lives and shall not see death,
47.tail: and shall deliver his soul from the power of the Grave?

48.head: Lord, where are your loving-kindnesses of old,
48.tail: which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

49.head: Remember, Lord, how your servants are reproached,
49.tail: and how I bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;

50.head: Remember how your enemies have reproached you, O Lord,
50.tail: how they have called after your Anointed King with cries of scorn.

51.head: Praised be the Lord for evermore.

1.head: Lord, you have been our refuge
1.tail: from one generation to another.

2.head: Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made,
2.tail: you are God from everlasting, and world without end.

3.head: You turn man back to the dust;
3.tail: you say,  Return, O children of men.

4.head: For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday,
4.tail: even as a day that is past.

5.head: You scatter them as a night-watch that comes quickly to an end;
5.tail: they are even as a dream and fade away.

6.head: They are like the grass, which in the morning is green,
6.tail: but in the evening is dried up and withered.

7.head: For we consume away in your displeasure
7.tail: and are afraid at your wrathful indignation.

8.head: You have set our misdeeds before you,
8.tail: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.

9.head: For when you are angry, all our days are gone;
9.tail: we bring our years to an end, as a tale that is told.

10.head: The days of our life are seventy years, and though some be so strong that they come to eighty years,
10.tail: yet is their span but labor and sorrow; so soon it passes away, and we are gone.

11.head: But who regards the power of your wrath,
11.tail: and who considers the fierceness of your anger?

12.head: So teach us to number our days,
12.tail: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

13.head: Turn again, O Lord, and tarry not;
13.tail: be gracious unto your servants.

14.head: O satisfy us with your mercy in the morning;
14.tail: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

15.head: Comfort us again, according to the measure of the days that you have afflicted us,
15.tail: and for the years in which we have suffered adversity.

16.head: Show your servants your work
16.tail: and their children your glory.

17.head: And may the grace of the Lord our God be upon us;
17.tail: prosper the work of our hands; O prosper our handiwork.

1.head: Whoever dwells under the defense of the Most High
1.tail: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

2.head: I will say unto the Lord,  You are my refuge and my stronghold,
2.tail: my God in whom I will trust.

3.head: For he shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter
3.tail: and from the deadly pestilence.

4.head: He shall defend you under his wings, and you shall be safe under his feathers;
4.tail: his faithfulness and truth shall be your shield and buckler.

5.head: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night,
5.tail: nor of the arrow that flies by day,

6.head: Of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
6.tail: nor of the sickness that destroys at noonday.

7.head: A thousand shall fall beside you, and ten thousand at your right hand,
7.tail: but it shall not come near you.

8.head: Indeed, with your eyes you shall behold
8.tail: and see the reward of the ungodly.

9.head: Because you have said,  The Lord is my refuge,
9.tail: and have made the Most High your stronghold,

10.head: There shall no evil happen to you,
10.tail: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.

11.head: For he shall give his angels charge over you,
11.tail: to keep you in all your ways.

12.head: They shall bear you in their hands,
12.tail: that you hurt not your foot against a stone.

13.head: You shall tread upon the lion and adder;
13.tail: the young lion and the serpent you shall trample under your feet.

14.head: Because he has set his love upon me, therefore I will deliver him;
14.tail: I will lift him up, because he has known my Name.

15.head: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him;
15.tail: indeed, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him and bring him honor.

16.head: With long life I will satisfy him,
16.tail: and show him my salvation.

1.head: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord,
1.tail: and to sing praises unto your Name, O Most High,

2.head: To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning,
2.tail: and of your faithfulness in the night season,

3.head: Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute,
3.tail: with the sound of melody upon the harp.

4.head: For you, Lord, have made me glad by your deeds,
4.tail: and I will shout for joy because of your handiwork.

5.head: O Lord, how glorious are your works;
5.tail: your thoughts are very deep.

6.head: The dull of heart does not consider this,
6.tail: and a fool does not understand it:

7.head: Though the ungodly are as green as the grass, and though all the workers of wickedness flourish,
7.tail: they shall be destroyed for ever; but you, Lord, are the Most High for evermore.

8.head: For lo, your enemies, O Lord, lo, your enemies shall perish,
8.tail: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

9.head: But my horn shall be exalted like the horns of wild bulls;
9.tail: for I am anointed with fresh oil.

10.head: My eye also shall see its desire upon my enemies,
10.tail: and my ear shall hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.

11.head: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree,
11.tail: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Lebanon.

12.head: Those who are planted in the house of the Lord
12.tail: shall flourish in the courts of our God.

13.head: They also shall bring forth fruit in their old age,
13.tail: and shall be green and full of sap,

14.head: That they may show how upright the Lord is,
14.tail: my rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness.

1.head: The Lord is King and has put on glorious apparel;
1.tail: the Lord has put on his apparel and girded himself with strength.

2.head: He has made the round world so sure
2.tail: that it cannot be moved.

3.head: Ever since the world began, your throne has been established;
3.tail: you are from everlasting.

4.head: The floods have risen, O Lord; the floods have lifted up their voice;
4.tail: the floods have lifted up their waves.

5.head: Mightier than the sound of many waters, mightier than the waves of the sea,
5.tail: the Lord who dwells on high is mightier.

6.head: Your testimonies, O Lord, are very sure;
6.tail: holiness adorns your house for ever.

1.head: O Lord God to whom vengeance belongs,
1.tail: O God to whom vengeance belongs, show yourself.

2.head: Arise, O Judge of the world,
2.tail: and reward the proud according to their deserving.

3.head: O Lord, how long shall the ungodly,
3.tail: how long shall the ungodly triumph?

4.head: How long shall all evildoers speak so disdainfully
4.tail: and make such proud boasting?

5.head: They smite down your people, O Lord,
5.tail: and trouble your heritage.

6.head: They murder the widow and the stranger,
6.tail: and put the fatherless to death.

7.head: And yet they say,  The Lord shall not see,
7.tail: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

8.head: Take heed, you unwise among the people;
8.tail: O you fools, when will you understand?

9.head: He who planted the ear, shall he not hear?
9.tail: Or he who made the eye, shall he not see?

10.head: Or he who nurtures the nations,
10.tail: he who teaches humanity knowledge, shall he not punish?

11.head: The Lord knows the thoughts of man,
11.tail: that they are but vain.

12.head: Blessed is the one whom you chasten, O Lord,
12.tail: and whom you teach your law,

13.head: That you may give him patience in time of adversity,
13.tail: until a pit is dug for the ungodly.

14.head: For the Lord will not fail his people,
14.tail: neither will he forsake his inheritance,

15.head: But righteousness shall return to the place of judgment,
15.tail: and all those who are true of heart shall follow it.

16.head: Who will rise up with me against the wicked,
16.tail: or who will take my part against the evildoers?

17.head: If the Lord had not helped me,
17.tail: my soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.

18.head: But when I said,  My foot has slipped,
18.tail: your mercy, O Lord, held me up.

19.head: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart,
19.tail: your comforts refreshed my soul.

20.head: Will you have anything to do with the council of wickedness,
20.tail: which turns evil into law?

21.head: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous
21.tail: and condemn the innocent to death.

22.head: But the Lord is my refuge,
22.tail: and my God is the rock of my confidence.

23.head: He shall recompense them for their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice;
23.tail: indeed, the Lord our God shall destroy them.

1.head: O come, let us sing unto the Lord;
1.tail: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

2.head: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving
2.tail: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

3.head: For the Lord is a great God
3.tail: and a great King above all gods.

4.head: In his hand are all the depths of the earth,
4.tail: and the heights of the hills are his also.

5.head: The sea is his, for he made it,
5.tail: and his hands prepared the dry land.

6.head: O come, let us worship and fall down,
6.tail: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

7.head: For he is our God,
7.tail: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

8.head: Today, if you will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
8.tail: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness,

9.head: When your fathers tested me,
9.tail: and put me to the proof, though they had seen my works.

10.head: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation and said,
10.tail: It is a people that err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways,

11.head: Of whom I swore in my wrath
11.tail: that they should not enter into my rest.

1.head: O sing unto the Lord a new song;
1.tail: sing unto the Lord, all the whole earth.

2.head: Sing unto the Lord and praise his Name;
2.tail: tell of his salvation from day to day.

3.head: Declare his honor to the nations,
3.tail: and his wonders to all peoples.

4.head: For the Lord is great, and highly to be praised;
4.tail: he is more to be feared than all gods.

5.head: As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols;
5.tail: but it is the Lord who made the heavens.

6.head: Glory and majesty are before him;
6.tail: power and honor are in his sanctuary.

7.head: Ascribe unto the Lord, O you families of the peoples,
7.tail: ascribe unto the Lord worship and power.

8.head: Ascribe unto the Lord the honor due unto his Name;
8.tail: bring offerings and come into his courts.

9.head: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness;
9.tail: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

10.head: Tell it out among the nations,  The Lord is King;
10.tail: it is he who has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he shall judge the peoples righteously.

11.head: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
11.tail: let the sea make a noise, and all that is therein.

12.head: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
12.tail: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord.

13.head: For he comes, for he comes to judge the earth,
13.tail: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the peoples with his truth.

1.head: The Lord is King; let the earth be glad.
1.tail: Indeed, let the multitude of the isles be glad.

2.head: Clouds and darkness are round about him;
2.tail: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

3.head: There goes a fire before him
3.tail: and burns up his enemies on every side.

4.head: His lightnings gave light to the world;
4.tail: the earth saw it and was afraid.

5.head: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord,
5.tail: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

6.head: The heavens have declared his righteousness,
6.tail: and all the people have seen his glory.

7.head: Confounded be all those who worship carved images, and who delight in false gods;
7.tail: worship him, all you gods.

8.head: Zion heard of it and rejoiced,
8.tail: and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of your judgments, O Lord.

9.head: For you, Lord, are most high over all the earth;
9.tail: you are exalted far above all gods.

10.head: O you who love the Lord, see that you hate the thing which is evil;
10.tail: the Lord preserves the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

11.head: A light has sprung up for the righteous,
11.tail: and joyful gladness for those who are truehearted.

12.head: Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous,
12.tail: and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

1.head: O sing unto the Lord a new song,
1.tail: for he has done marvelous things.

2.head: With his own right hand and with his holy arm,
2.tail: he has won for himself the victory.

3.head: The Lord declared his salvation;
3.tail: his righteousness has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.

4.head: He has remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel,
4.tail: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

5.head: Show yourselves joyful in the Lord, all you lands;
5.tail: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

6.head: Praise the Lord with the harp;
6.tail: sing with the harp a psalm of thanksgiving.

7.head: With trumpets also and horns,
7.tail: O show yourselves joyful before the Lord, the King.

8.head: Let the sea make a noise, and all that is in it,
8.tail: the round world, and those who dwell therein.

9.head: Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord,
9.tail: for he has come to judge the earth.

10.head: With righteousness shall he judge the world,
10.tail: and the peoples with equity.

1.head: The Lord is King; let the peoples tremble;
1.tail: he sits between the cherubim; let the earth shake.

2.head: The Lord is great in Zion
2.tail: and high above all peoples.

3.head: They shall give thanks unto his Name, which is great and wonderful;
3.tail: holy is he and mighty, a King who loves justice.

4.head: You have established equity;
4.tail: you have executed judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

5.head: O magnify the Lord our God,
5.tail: and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.

6.head: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his Name,
6.tail: they called upon the Lord, and he heard them.

7.head: He spoke to them out of the cloudy pillar,
7.tail: for they kept his testimonies and the law that he gave them.

8.head: You heard them, O Lord our God;
8.tail: you forgave them, O God, yet punished their evildoings.

9.head: O magnify the Lord our God, and worship him upon his holy hill,
9.tail: for the Lord our God is holy.

1.head: O be joyful in the Lord, all you lands;
1.tail: serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

2.head: Be assured that the Lord, he is God;
2.tail: it is he that has made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

3.head: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise;
3.tail: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

4.head: For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting,
4.tail: and his truth endures from generation to generation.

1.head: My song shall be of mercy and judgment;
1.tail: unto you, O Lord, will I sing.

2.head: O let me have understanding
2.tail: in the way of godliness.

3.head: When will you come to me?
3.tail: I will walk in my house with integrity of heart.

4.head: I will set no wicked thing before my eyes;
4.tail: I hate the sins of unfaithfulness; no such thing shall cleave to me.

5.head: A crooked heart shall depart from me;
5.tail: I will not know a wicked person.

6.head: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor,
6.tail: him will I destroy.

7.head: Whoever has a proud look and an arrogant heart,
7.tail: I will not suffer him.

8.head: My eyes shall look with favor upon the faithful in the land,
8.tail: that they may dwell with me.

9.head: Whoever leads a godly life,
9.tail: he shall be my servant.

10.head: No deceitful person shall dwell in my house;
10.tail: the one who tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.

11.head: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly who are in the land,
11.tail: that I may root out all evildoers from the city of the Lord.

1.head: Hear my prayer, O Lord,
1.tail: and let my cry come unto you.

2.head: Hide not your face from me in the time of my trouble;
2.tail: incline your ear to me when I call; O hear me, and very soon.

3.head: For my days are consumed like smoke,
3.tail: and my bones are burnt up as in a furnace.

4.head: My heart is smitten and withered like grass,
4.tail: so that I forget to eat my bread.

5.head: Because of the voice of my groaning,
5.tail: my bones will scarcely cleave to my flesh.

6.head: I have become like an owl in the wilderness
6.tail: and like a screech-owl among the ruins.

7.head: I am solitary, and lie sleepless because of my groaning;
7.tail: I am like a sparrow that sits alone upon the housetop.

8.head: My enemies revile me all day long,
8.tail: and those who are enraged against me conspire to do me hurt.

9.head: For I have eaten ashes as if they were bread
9.tail: and mingled my drink with weeping,

10.head: Because of your indignation and wrath,
10.tail: for you have taken me up and cast me down.

11.head: My days are gone like a shadow,
11.tail: and I am withered like grass.

12.head: But you, O Lord, shall endure for ever,
12.tail: and your remembrance throughout all generations.

13.head: You shall arise and have mercy upon Zion,
13.tail: for it is time for you to have mercy upon her; indeed, the time has come.

14.head: For your servants love her very stones,
14.tail: and are moved to pity to see her in the dust.

15.head: The nations shall fear your Name, O Lord,
15.tail: and all the kings of the earth your majesty,

16.head: When the Lord shall build up Zion,
16.tail: and when his glory shall appear,

17.head: When he turns to the prayer of the destitute
17.tail: and despises not their plea.

18.head: This shall be written for those that come after,
18.tail: and a people that shall yet be born shall praise the Lord.

19.head: For he has looked down from his sanctuary;
19.tail: from the heavens the Lord has beheld the earth,

20.head: That he might hear the groanings of those who are in captivity,
20.tail: and deliver those who are condemned to die,

21.head: That they may declare the Name of the Lord in Zion,
21.tail: and his praises in Jerusalem;

22.head: When the peoples are gathered together,
22.tail: and the kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.

23.head: He brought down my strength before my time,
23.tail: and shortened my days.

24.head: But I said,  O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days;
24.tail: for your years endure throughout all generations.

25.head: You, Lord, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth,
25.tail: and the heavens are the work of your hands.

26.head: They shall perish, but you shall endure;
26.tail: they all shall wear out, as does a garment;

27.head: And as a garment you shall change them, and they shall be changed;
27.tail: but you are the same, and your years shall not fail.

28.head: The children of your servants shall continue,
28.tail: and their seed shall stand fast in your sight.

1.head: Praise the Lord, O my soul,
1.tail: and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.

2.head: Praise the Lord, O my soul,
2.tail: and forget not all his benefits:

3.head: Who forgives all your sin
3.tail: and heals all your infirmities,

4.head: Who saves your life from the pit
4.tail: and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness,

5.head: Who satisfies you with good things,
5.tail: renewing your youth like an eagle's.

6.head: The Lord executes righteousness and judgment
6.tail: for all those who are oppressed with wrong.

7.head: He showed his ways to Moses,
7.tail: his works to the children of Israel.

8.head: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy,
8.tail: long-suffering and of great goodness.

9.head: He will not always chide us,
9.tail: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

10.head: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
10.tail: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.

11.head: For as the heavens are high above the earth,
11.tail: so great is his mercy also toward those who fear him.

12.head: As far as the east is from the west,
12.tail: so far has he set our sins from us.

13.head: As a father pities his own children,
13.tail: so is the Lord merciful to those who fear him.

14.head: For he knows whereof we are made;
14.tail: he remembers that we are but dust.

15.head: The days of man are as grass;
15.tail: he flourishes as a flower of the field.

16.head: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone,
16.tail: and its place shall know it no more.

17.head: But the merciful goodness of the Lord endures for ever and ever upon those who fear him,
17.tail: and his righteousness upon children's children,

18.head: Even upon those who keep his covenant
18.tail: and think upon his commandments to do them.

19.head: The Lord has prepared his throne in heaven,
19.tail: and his kingdom rules over all.

20.head: O praise the Lord, you angels of his, you that excel in strength,
20.tail: you that fulfill his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.

21.head: O praise the Lord, all you his hosts,
21.tail: you servants of his that do his pleasure.

22.head: O speak good of the Lord, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion;
22.tail: praise the Lord, O my soul.

1.head: Praise the Lord, O my soul.
1.tail: O Lord my God, you have become exceedingly glorious; you are clothed with majesty and honor.

2.head: You clothe yourself with light as with a garment,
2.tail: and spread out the heavens like a curtain.

3.head: You lay the beams of your chambers in the waters,
3.tail: and make the clouds your chariot, and walk upon the wings of the wind.

4.head: You make winds your messengers,
4.tail: and flames of fire your ministers.

5.head: You laid the foundations of the earth,
5.tail: that it never should move at any time.

6.head: You cover it with the deep as with a garment;
6.tail: the waters stand above the hills.

7.head: At your rebuke they fled;
7.tail: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

8.head: They went up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath,
8.tail: even to the place you had appointed for them.

9.head: You have set bounds for them which they shall not pass;
9.tail: neither shall they again cover the earth.

10.head: You send the springs into the rivers,
10.tail: which run among the hills.

11.head: All beasts of the field drink thereof,
11.tail: and the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

12.head: Beside them shall the birds of the air have their habitation
12.tail: and sing among the branches.

13.head: You water the hills from above;
13.tail: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

14.head: You bring forth grass for the cattle,
14.tail: and plants for the service of mankind,

15.head: That they may bring food out of the earth, and wine that makes glad the heart,
15.tail: and oil to make a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen the heart.

16.head: The trees of the Lord also are full of sap,
16.tail: even the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,

17.head: Wherein the birds make their nests,
17.tail: and the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

18.head: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats,
18.tail: and so are the stony cliffs for the rock badgers.

19.head: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons,
19.tail: and the sun knows its going down.

20.head: You make darkness that it may be night,
20.tail: in which all the beasts of the forest move.

21.head: The lions, roaring after their prey,
21.tail: seek their meat from God.

22.head: The sun arises, and they go away together,
22.tail: and lay themselves down in their dens.

23.head: Man goes forth to his work,
23.tail: and to his labor until the evening.

24.head: O Lord, how manifold are your works;
24.tail: in wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.

25.head: So is the great and wide sea also,
25.tail: in which are things creeping innumerable, creatures both small and great.

26.head: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan,
26.tail: whom you made to take its pleasure therein.

27.head: These all wait upon you,
27.tail: that you may give them food in due season.

28.head: When you give it to them, they gather it,
28.tail: and when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.

29.head: When you hide your face, they are troubled;
29.tail: when you take away their breath, they die, and are turned again to their dust.

30.head: When you let your breath go forth, they shall be made,
30.tail: and you shall renew the face of the earth.

31.head: The glorious majesty of the Lord shall endure for ever;
31.tail: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

32.head: He looks at the earth and it trembles;
32.tail: if he even touches the hills, they shall smoke.

33.head: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live;
33.tail: I will praise my God while I have my being,

34.head: And so shall my words please him;
34.tail: my joy shall be in the Lord.

35.head: As for sinners, they shall perish from the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end.
35.tail: Praise the Lord, O my soul. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Give thanks unto the Lord and call upon his Name;
1.tail: tell the peoples what things he has done.

2.head: O let your songs be of him, and praise him,
2.tail: and let your speech be of all his wondrous works.

3.head: Rejoice in his holy Name;
3.tail: let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.

4.head: Seek the Lord and his strength;
4.tail: seek his face evermore.

5.head: Remember the marvelous works that he has done,
5.tail: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

6.head: O seed of Abraham his servant,
6.tail: O children of Jacob his chosen.

7.head: He is the Lord our God;
7.tail: his judgments are in all the world.

8.head: He has always been mindful of his covenant,
8.tail: and the promise that he made to a thousand generations,

9.head: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham,
9.tail: and the oath that he swore to Isaac,

10.head: Which he appointed to Jacob for a law,
10.tail: and to Israel for an everlasting testament,

11.head: Saying,  To you will I give the land of Canaan
11.tail: to be the portion of your inheritance.

12.head: When there were yet but a few of them,
12.tail: and they were strangers in the land,

13.head: And they wandered from nation to nation,
13.tail: and from one kingdom to another,

14.head: He allowed no one to do them wrong,
14.tail: but reproved even kings for their sakes:

15.head: Do not touch my Anointed,
15.tail: and do my prophets no harm.

16.head: Moreover, he called for a famine in the land
16.tail: and destroyed all the provision of bread.

17.head: But he had sent a man before them:
17.tail: Joseph, who was sold to be a bondservant,

18.head: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks;
18.tail: they put an iron collar around his neck.

19.head: Until the time came that his sayings were fulfilled,
19.tail: the word of the Lord tried him.

20.head: The king sent and delivered him;
20.tail: the ruler of the people let him go free.

21.head: He made him lord over his house,
21.tail: and ruler of all his possessions,

22.head: That he might instruct his princes according to his will
22.tail: and teach his elders wisdom.

23.head: Israel also came into Egypt,
23.tail: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

24.head: And he increased his people exceedingly,
24.tail: and made them stronger than their enemies,

25.head: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people,
25.tail: and dealt deceitfully with his servants.

26.head: Then he sent Moses his servant,
26.tail: and Aaron whom he had chosen,

27.head: And they worked his signs among them,
27.tail: and wonders in the land of Ham.

28.head: He sent darkness, and it was dark;
28.tail: but they were not obedient to his word.

29.head: He turned their waters into blood
29.tail: and caused their fish to die.

31.head: He spoke the word, and there came all manner of flies,
31.tail: and gnats in all their borders.

32.head: He gave them hailstones for rain,
32.tail: and flames of fire in their land.

33.head: He smote their vines also, and their fig trees,
33.tail: and destroyed the trees that were in their borders.

34.head: He spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came, and locusts innumerable,
34.tail: which ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.

35.head: He smote all the firstborn in their land,
35.tail: even the firstfruits of all their strength.

36.head: He brought forth Israel with silver and gold;
36.tail: in all their tribes there was not one who stumbled.

37.head: Egypt was glad at their departing,
37.tail: for they were afraid of them.

38.head: He spread out a cloud to be a covering,
38.tail: and fire to give light in the night season.

39.head: At their desire he brought quail,
39.tail: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

40.head: He opened the rock, and the waters flowed out,
40.tail: so that rivers ran in the dry places.

41.head: For he remembered his holy promise

42.head: And he brought forth his people with joy,
42.tail: and his chosen ones with gladness,

43.head: And gave them the lands of the nations,
43.tail: and they took the labors of the peoples in possession,

44.head: That they might keep his statutes
44.tail: and observe his laws. Praise the Lord.

1.head: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
1.tail: and his mercy endures for ever.

2.head: Who can express the mighty acts of the Lord,
2.tail: or show forth all his praise?

3.head: Blessed are those who act with justice,
3.tail: and who always do righteousness.

4.head: Remember me, O Lord, according to the favor that you show to your people;
4.tail: O visit me with your salvation,

5.head: That I may see the felicity of your chosen,
5.tail: and rejoice in the gladness of your people, and give thanks with your inheritance.

6.head: We have sinned like our fathers;
6.tail: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

7.head: Our fathers regarded not your wonders in Egypt, neither did they keep your great goodness in remembrance,
7.tail: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

8.head: Nevertheless, he saved them for his Name's sake,
8.tail: that he might make his power known.

9.head: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up;
9.tail: so he led them through the deep as through a wilderness.

10.head: And he saved them from the adversary's hand,
10.tail: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

11.head: As for those who troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;
11.tail: there was not one of them left.

12.head: Then they believed his words
12.tail: and sang praises unto him.

13.head: But soon they forgot his works
13.tail: and would not wait for his counsel.

14.head: A craving came upon them in the wilderness,
14.tail: and they tempted God in the desert.

15.head: So he gave them their desire,
15.tail: and sent leanness into their soul.

16.head: They were envious of Moses also in the camp,
16.tail: and of Aaron the holy one of the Lord.

17.head: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
17.tail: and covered the company of Abiram,

18.head: And fire was kindled in their company;
18.tail: the flame burnt up the ungodly.

19.head: They made a calf in Horeb
19.tail: and worshiped a molten image.

20.head: Thus they exchanged their glory
20.tail: for the image of a calf that feeds on hay.

21.head: And they forgot God their Savior,
21.tail: who had done great things in Egypt,

22.head: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
22.tail: and fearful things by the Red Sea.

23.head: So he said he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap
23.tail: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

24.head: Then they scorned that pleasant land
24.tail: and gave no credence to his word,

25.head: But murmured in their tents
25.tail: and did not hearken to the voice of the Lord.

26.head: Then he lifted up his hand against them
26.tail: to overthrow them in the wilderness,

27.head: To cast out their seed among the nations,
27.tail: and to scatter them in all the lands.

28.head: They joined themselves to Baal-Peor
28.tail: and ate the offerings to the dead.

29.head: Thus they provoked him to anger with their wanton deeds,
29.tail: and the plague broke out among them.

30.head: Then Phineas stood up and interceded,
30.tail: and so the plague was ended;

31.head: And that was counted to him as righteousness

32.head: They angered him also at the waters of strife,
32.tail: so that he punished Moses for their misdeeds;

33.head: For they provoked him to anger,
33.tail: so that he spoke rashly with his lips.

34.head: Neither did they destroy the peoples

36.head: So that they worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them;
36.tail: they offered their sons and their daughters to demons,

37.head: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
37.tail: whom they offered to the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

38.head: Thus were they defiled by their own works
38.tail: and went whoring with their own deeds.

39.head: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people,
39.tail: and he abhorred his own inheritance,

40.head: And he gave them over into the hands of the nations,
40.tail: and those who hated them were lords over them.

42.head: Many a time did he deliver them,
42.tail: but they rebelled against him through their own devices, and were brought down in their wickedness.

43.head: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity,

44.head: He remembered his covenant and pitied them, according to the multitude of his mercies;
44.tail: he made all those who led them away captive to pity them.

45.head: Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the nations,
45.tail: that we may give thanks to your holy Name and make our boast of your praise.

46.head: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and world without end,
46.tail: and let all the people say,  Amen.  Praise the Lord.

1.head: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
1.tail: and his mercy endures for ever.

2.head: Let those whom the Lord has redeemed give thanks,
2.tail: whom he has delivered from the hand of the enemy,

3.head: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west,
3.tail: from the north and from the south.

4.head: They went astray in the wilderness, even in the desert,
4.tail: and found no city to dwell in;

5.head: They were hungry and thirsty,
5.tail: and their soul fainted within them.

6.head: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
6.tail: and he delivered them from their distress.

7.head: He led them forth by a straight path
7.tail: until they came to a city where they might dwell.

8.head: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
8.tail: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

9.head: For he satisfies the empty soul
9.tail: and fills the hungry soul with goodness.

10.head: Some sat in darkness, and in the shadow of death,
10.tail: being bound fast in misery and iron,

11.head: Because they rebelled against the words of God
11.tail: and lightly regarded the counsel of the Most High.

12.head: He also brought down their heart with heaviness;
12.tail: they fell down, and there was none to help them.

13.head: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
13.tail: and he delivered them out of their distress.

14.head: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death,
14.tail: and broke their bonds asunder.

15.head: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
15.tail: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

16.head: For he has broken the gates of brass
16.tail: and shattered the bars of iron asunder.

17.head: The foolish were plagued for their offense
17.tail: and because of their wickedness.

18.head: Their soul abhorred all manner of food,
18.tail: and they were even close to death's door.

19.head: So when they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
19.tail: he delivered them out of their distress.

20.head: He sent his word and healed them,
20.tail: and they were saved from destruction.

21.head: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
21.tail: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

22.head: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving
22.tail: and tell of his works with gladness!

23.head: Those who go down to the sea in ships,
23.tail: who carry out their business in great waters,

24.head: They behold the works of the Lord
24.tail: and his wonders in the deep.

25.head: For at his word the stormy wind arises,
25.tail: which lifts up the waves.

26.head: They are carried up to heaven and down again to the deep;
26.tail: their soul melts away because of the trouble.

27.head: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
27.tail: and are at their wits' end.

28.head: So when they cry unto the Lord in their trouble,
28.tail: he delivers them out of their distress.

29.head: For he makes the storm to cease,
29.tail: so that the waves are still.

30.head: Then they are glad, because they are at rest,
30.tail: and so he brings them into the haven where they desire to be.

31.head: Oh, that they would therefore praise the Lord for his goodness
31.tail: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

32.head: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people
32.tail: and praise him in the seat of the elders!

33.head: He turns rivers into a wilderness

34.head: A fruitful land he makes barren,
34.tail: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.

35.head: Again, he makes the wilderness into pools of water

36.head: And there he sets the hungry
36.tail: that they may build a city to dwell in,

37.head: That they may sow their land and plant vineyards
37.tail: to yield the fruits of increase.

38.head: He blesses them, so that they multiply exceedingly,
38.tail: and does not allow their cattle to decrease.

39.head: And again, when they are diminished and brought low,
39.tail: through oppression, through any plague or trouble,

40.head: Though he pours contempt on princes
40.tail: and lets them wander in the pathless wilderness,

41.head: Yet he helps the poor out of misery
41.tail: and increases their households like a flock of sheep.

42.head: The righteous will consider this and rejoice,
42.tail: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

43.head: Whoever is wise will ponder these things,
43.tail: and shall understand the loving-kindness of the Lord.

1.head: O God, my heart is fixed, my heart is firmly fixed;
1.tail: I will sing and give praise with the best that I have.

2.head: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
2.tail: I myself will awaken the dawn.

3.head: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the peoples,
3.tail: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations,

4.head: For the greatness of your mercy reaches to the heavens,
4.tail: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

5.head: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
5.tail: let your glory be over all the earth.

6.head: That your beloved may be delivered,
6.tail: save me by your right hand, and answer me.

7.head: God has spoken in his holiness:
7.tail: I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.

8.head: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
8.tail: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

9.head: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast my shoe;
9.tail: over Philistia will I triumph.

10.head: Who will lead me into the strong city,
10.tail: and who will bring me into Edom?

11.head: Have you not forsaken us, O God?
11.tail: And will you not, O God, go forth with our hosts?

12.head: O help us against the enemy,
12.tail: for vain is the help of man.

13.head: Through God we shall do great acts,
13.tail: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.

1.head: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise,
1.tail: for the mouth of the ungodly, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

2.head: They have spoken against me with false tongues;
2.tail: they encompassed me with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

3.head: In return for the love that I had for them, they have become my adversaries;
3.tail: but I give myself to prayer.

4.head: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good,
4.tail: and hatred for my love.

5.head: Set an ungodly man to be ruler over him,
5.tail: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.

6.head: When judgment is given, let him be condemned,
6.tail: and let sentence be passed on him for guilt.

7.head: Let his days be few,
7.tail: and let another take his office.

8.head: Let his children be fatherless
8.tail: and his wife a widow.

9.head: Let his children be vagabonds and beg their bread;
9.tail: let them be driven out, even from desolate places.

10.head: Let the creditor consume all that he has,
10.tail: and let strangers take his labor for spoil.

11.head: Let there be no one to pity him,
11.tail: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

12.head: Let his posterity be destroyed,
12.tail: and in the next generation let his name be blotted out.

13.head: Let the wickedness of his fathers be held in remembrance in the sight of the Lord,
13.tail: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

14.head: Let them be always before the Lord,
14.tail: that he may root out the memorial of them from the earth,

15.head: Because he was not minded to do good,
15.tail: but persecuted to death the poor and needy, and those who were brokenhearted.

16.head: His delight was in cursing; let curses come upon him;
16.tail: he loved not blessing; therefore let it be far from him.

17.head: He clothed himself with cursing as with a garment,
17.tail: so let it soak into his body like water, and like oil into his bones.

18.head: Let it be to him as the cloak that he has on
18.tail: and as the belt that he always wears.

19.head: Let this be the recompense from the Lord to my enemies,
19.tail: and to those who speak evil against my soul.

20.head: But deal with me, O Lord God, according to your Name;
20.tail: for sweet is your mercy.

21.head: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor,
21.tail: and my heart is wounded within me.

22.head: I disappear like the shadow that lengthens,
22.tail: and am shaken off like a grasshopper.

23.head: My knees are weak through fasting;
23.tail: my flesh is grown lean for want of nourishment.

24.head: I have become a reproach to them;
24.tail: when they look on me, they shake their heads.

25.head: Help me, O Lord my God;
25.tail: save me according to your mercy;

26.head: And they shall know that this is your hand,
26.tail: and that you, O Lord, have done it.

27.head: Though they curse, yet you bless;
27.tail: let them be confounded who rise up against me, but let your servant rejoice.

28.head: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame,
28.tail: and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a cloak.

29.head: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the Lord with my mouth,
29.tail: and praise him among the multitude,

30.head: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,
30.tail: to save their souls from the unrighteous judges.

1.head: The Lord said unto my Lord,  Sit at my right hand,
1.tail: until I make your enemies your footstool.

2.head: The Lord shall send the scepter of your power out of Zion:
2.tail: Rule in the midst of your enemies.

3.head: In the day of your power the people, in holy raiment, shall offer you freewill offerings;
3.tail: from the womb of the morning, the dew of your youth belongs to you.

4.head: The Lord has sworn and will not recant:
4.tail: You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

5.head: The Lord at your right hand
5.tail: shall smite kings in the day of his wrath.

6.head: He shall judge the nations;
6.tail: he shall fill the lands with dead bodies, and strike down heads over many countries.

7.head: He shall drink from the brook by the way;
7.tail: therefore shall he lift up his head.

1.head: Praise the Lord. I will give thanks unto the Lord with my whole heart,
1.tail: in the company of the upright, and among the congregation.

2.head: The works of the Lord are great,
2.tail: sought out by all who have pleasure in them.

3.head: His work is worthy to be praised and held in honor,
3.tail: and his righteousness endures for ever.

4.head: He has made his marvelous works to be had in remembrance;
4.tail: The Lord is gracious and merciful.

5.head: He has given food to those who fear him;
5.tail: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

6.head: He has shown his people the power of his works,
6.tail: that he may give them the heritage of the nations.

7.head: The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice;
7.tail: all his commandments are true.

8.head: They stand fast for ever and ever,
8.tail: and are done in truth and equity.

9.head: He sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant for ever;
9.tail: holy and awesome is his Name.

10.head: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom;
10.tail: a good understanding have all those who live accordingly; his praise endures for ever.

1.head: Praise the Lord! Blessed is the one who fears the Lord,
1.tail: who has great delight in his commandments.

2.head: His seed shall be mighty in the land;
2.tail: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

3.head: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house,
3.tail: and his righteousness shall endure for ever.

4.head: For the upright, there rises light in the darkness;
4.tail: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

5.head: It is good for him to be generous in lending
5.tail: and to guide his words with discretion.

6.head: For he shall never be moved,
6.tail: and the righteous shall be kept in everlasting remembrance.

7.head: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings,
7.tail: for his heart is steadfast and trusts in the Lord.

8.head: His heart is established, and will not fear;
8.tail: at the last he shall see his desire upon his enemies.

9.head: He has given freely to the poor,
9.tail: and his righteousness endures for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.

10.head: The ungodly shall see it, and shall be angry;
10.tail: he shall gnash his teeth, and waste away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

1.head: Praise the Lord. Sing praises, you servants of the Lord;
1.tail: O praise the Name of the Lord.

2.head: Blessed be the Name of the Lord,
2.tail: from this time forth for evermore.

3.head: The Lord's Name be praised
3.tail: from the rising up of the sun to the going down of the same.

4.head: The Lord is high above all nations,
4.tail: and his glory above the heavens.

5.head: Who is like the Lord our God, who has his dwelling so high,
5.tail: and yet humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?

6.head: He takes up the lowly out of the dust,
6.tail: and lifts the poor out of the ashes,

7.head: That he may set them with the princes,
7.tail: even with the princes of his people.

8.head: He gives the barren woman a home to dwell in,
8.tail: and makes her to be a joyful mother of children. Praise the Lord.

1.head: When Israel came out of Egypt,
1.tail: and the house of Jacob from among a people of a foreign tongue,

2.head: Judah was God's sanctuary,
2.tail: and Israel his dominion.

3.head: The sea beheld it and fled;
3.tail: Jordan was driven back.

4.head: The mountains skipped like rams,
4.tail: and the little hills like young sheep.

5.head: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled?
5.tail: O Jordan, that you were driven back?

6.head: You mountains, that you skipped like rams,
6.tail: and you little hills like young sheep?

7.head: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
7.tail: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

8.head: Who turned the hard rock into a pool of water,
8.tail: and the flint stone into a springing well.

1.head: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto your Name give the praise,
1.tail: for your loving mercy and for your truth's sake.

2.head: Why shall the nations say,
2.tail: Where now is their God?

3.head: As for our God, he is in heaven;
3.tail: he has done whatsoever pleased him.

4.head: Their idols are silver and gold,
4.tail: even the work of human hands.

5.head: They have mouths, but they speak not;
5.tail: eyes have they, but they see not.

6.head: They have ears, but they hear not;
6.tail: noses have they, but they smell not.

7.head: They have hands, but they feel not; feet have they, but they walk not;
7.tail: neither is there any sound in their throat.

8.head: Those who make them are like them,
8.tail: and so are all who put their trust in them.

9.head: But you, O house of Israel, trust in the Lord;
9.tail: he is their helper and defender.

10.head: You house of Aaron, put your trust in the Lord;
10.tail: he is their helper and defender.

11.head: You who fear the Lord, put your trust in the Lord;
11.tail: he is their helper and defender.

12.head: The Lord has been mindful of us, and he shall bless us;
12.tail: he shall bless the house of Israel; he shall bless the house of Aaron;

13.head: He shall bless those who fear the Lord,
13.tail: both small and great together.

14.head: The Lord shall increase you more and more,
14.tail: you and your children after you.

15.head: You are the blessed of the Lord,
15.tail: who has made heaven and earth.

16.head: The heavens are the Lord's;
16.tail: the earth has he given to the children of men.

17.head: The dead praise you not, O Lord,
17.tail: neither all those who go down into silence.

18.head: But we will praise the Lord,
18.tail: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the Lord.

1.head: I love the Lord,
1.tail: because he heard the voice of my prayer,

2.head: Because he inclined his ear to me;
2.tail: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

3.head: The snares of death encompassed me, and the pains of the Grave laid hold of me;
3.tail: I suffered trouble and sorrow.

4.head: Then I called upon the Name of the Lord:
4.tail: O Lord, I beseech you, deliver my soul.

5.head: Gracious is the Lord and righteous;
5.tail: indeed, our God is full of compassion.

6.head: The Lord preserves the simple;
6.tail: I was in misery, and he helped me.

7.head: Turn again to your rest, O my soul,
7.tail: for the Lord has rewarded you.

8.head: You have delivered my soul from death,
8.tail: my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

9.head: I will walk before the Lord
9.tail: in the land of the living.

10.head: I believed, and therefore will I speak:  I am greatly troubled.
10.tail: I said in my haste,  All men are liars.

11.head: What shall I give unto the Lord
11.tail: for all the benefits that he has done unto me?

12.head: I will lift up the cup of salvation
12.tail: and call upon the Name of the Lord.

13.head: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the presence of all his people;
13.tail: dear in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

14.head: O Lord, I am your servant;
14.tail: I am your servant, and the child of your handmaid; you have broken my bonds asunder.

15.head: I will offer you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
15.tail: and will call upon the Name of the Lord.

16.head: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the sight of all his people,
16.tail: in the courts of the Lord's house, even in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

1.head: O praise the Lord, all you nations;
1.tail: praise him, all you peoples.

2.head: For great is his loving-kindness towards us,
2.tail: and the faithfulness of the Lord endures for ever. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious;
1.tail: his mercy endures for ever.

2.head: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious,
2.tail: that his mercy endures for ever.

3.head: Let the house of Aaron now confess
3.tail: that his mercy endures for ever.

4.head: Indeed, let those who fear the Lord confess
4.tail: that his mercy endures for ever.

5.head: I called upon the Lord in trouble,
5.tail: and the Lord heard me and set me free.

6.head: The Lord is on my side;
6.tail: I will not fear what man can do to me.

7.head: The Lord takes my side with those who help me;
7.tail: therefore shall I look in triumph on my enemies.

8.head: It is better to trust in the Lord
8.tail: than to put any confidence in man.

9.head: It is better to trust in the Lord
9.tail: than to put any confidence in princes.

10.head: All the nations encompass me,
10.tail: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

11.head: They hem me in on every side; indeed, they hem me in on every side,
11.tail: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

12.head: They come about me like bees, and blaze like fire among the thorns,
12.tail: but in the Name of the Lord will I cut them off.

13.head: I was thrust aside so that I almost fell,
13.tail: but the Lord was my help.

14.head: The Lord is my strength and my song,
14.tail: and has become my salvation.

15.head: The voice of joy and deliverance is in the dwellings of the righteous;
15.tail: the right hand of the Lord brings mighty things to pass.

16.head: The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
16.tail: the right hand of the Lord brings mighty things to pass.

17.head: I shall not die, but live,
17.tail: and declare the works of the Lord.

18.head: The Lord has chastened and corrected me,
18.tail: but he has not given me over to death.

19.head: Open unto me the gates of righteousness,
19.tail: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the Lord.

20.head: This is the gate of the Lord;
20.tail: the righteous shall enter into it.

21.head: I will thank you, for you have heard me,
21.tail: and have become my salvation.

22.head: The same stone which the builders refused
22.tail: has become the chief cornerstone.

23.head: This is the Lord's doing,
23.tail: and it is marvelous in our eyes.

24.head: This is the day that the Lord has made;
24.tail: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

25.head: Help me now, O Lord;
25.tail: O Lord, send us now prosperity.

26.head: Blessed is he who comes in the Name of the Lord;
26.tail: we bless you from the house of the Lord.

27.head: God is the Lord, who has shown us light;
27.tail: bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

28.head: You are my God, and I will thank you;
28.tail: you are my God, and I will exalt you.

29.head: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious;

1.head: Blessed are those who are undefiled in their ways,
1.tail: and walk in the law of the Lord.

2.head: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies
2.tail: and seek him with their whole heart,

3.head: Even those who do no wickedness
3.tail: and perfectly walk in his ways.

4.head: You have ordered your precepts
4.tail: that we should diligently keep them.

5.head: O that my ways were made so direct
5.tail: that I might keep your statutes!

6.head: Then would I not be put to shame
6.tail: while I give heed unto all your commandments.

7.head: I will thank you with an upright heart,
7.tail: when I have learned your righteous judgments.

8.head: I will keep your statutes;
8.tail: O do not forsake me utterly.

9.head: How shall a young man cleanse his way?
9.tail: By ruling himself according to your word.

10.head: With my whole heart I have sought you;
10.tail: O let me not go astray from your commandments.

11.head: Your words have I hidden within my heart,
11.tail: that I may not sin against you.

12.head: Blessed are you, O Lord;
12.tail: teach me your statutes.

13.head: With my lips have I been telling
13.tail: of all the judgments of your mouth.

14.head: I have had greater delight in the way of your testimonies
14.tail: than in all manner of riches.

15.head: I will meditate on your commandments
15.tail: and have respect for all your ways.

16.head: My delight will be in your statutes,
16.tail: and I will not forget your word.

17.head: O do well unto your servant,
17.tail: that I may live, and keep your word.

18.head: Open my eyes that I may see
18.tail: the wondrous things of your law.

19.head: I am a sojourner on earth;
19.tail: O hide not your commandments from me.

20.head: My soul is consumed with the fervent desire
20.tail: that it always has for your judgments.

21.head: You have rebuked the proud,
21.tail: and cursed are those who stray from your commandments.

22.head: O turn from me shame and contempt,
22.tail: for I have kept your testimonies.

23.head: Though princes sit and speak against me,
23.tail: yet will your servant meditate on your statutes;

24.head: For your testimonies are my delight,
24.tail: and they are my counselors.

25.head: My soul cleaves to the dust;
25.tail: O revive me, according to your word.

26.head: I have acknowledged my ways, and you heard me;
26.tail: O teach me your statutes.

27.head: Make me to understand the way of your commandments,
27.tail: and so shall I meditate on your wondrous works.

28.head: My soul melts away for heaviness;
28.tail: comfort me according to your word.

29.head: Take from me the way of lying,
29.tail: and graciously teach me your law.

30.head: I have chosen the way of truth,
30.tail: and your judgments have I set before me.

31.head: I hold fast to your testimonies;
31.tail: O Lord, let me not be put to shame.

32.head: I will run the way of your commandments
32.tail: when you enlarge my heart with understanding.

33.head: Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes,
33.tail: and I shall keep it to the end.

34.head: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law;
34.tail: indeed, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

35.head: Make me go in the path of your commandments,

36.head: Incline my heart to your testimonies,

37.head: O turn away my eyes, lest they behold vanity,
37.tail: and revive me in your ways.

38.head: Confirm your word to your servant,
38.tail: and to all those who fear you.

39.head: Take away the reproach that I am afraid of,

40.head: Behold, my delight is in your precepts;
40.tail: O revive me in your righteousness.

41.head: Let your loving mercy come to me, O Lord,
41.tail: even your salvation, according to your word.

42.head: So shall I answer those who taunt me,
42.tail: for my trust is in your word.

43.head: O do not take the word of your truth utterly out of my mouth,
43.tail: for my hope is in your judgments.

44.head: So shall I always keep your law,

45.head: And I will walk at liberty,

46.head: I will speak of your testimonies also, even before kings,

47.head: And my delight shall be in your commandments,

48.head: My hands also will I lift up to your commandments,
48.tail: and I will meditate on your statutes.

49.head: O remember your word to your servant,
49.tail: in which you have caused me to put my trust.

50.head: This is my comfort in my trouble,
50.tail: for your word has given me life.

51.head: The proud have held me exceedingly in derision,
51.tail: yet I have not turned aside from your law.

52.head: For I have remembered, O Lord, your judgments from of old,
52.tail: and by them I have received comfort.

53.head: I am filled with indignation,
53.tail: because of the ungodly who forsake your law.

54.head: Your statutes have been my songs
54.tail: in the house of my pilgrimage.

55.head: I have thought upon your Name, O Lord, in the night season,
55.tail: and I have kept your law.

56.head: This has been my reward,
56.tail: because I have kept your commandments.

57.head: You are my portion, O Lord;
57.tail: I have promised to keep your law.

58.head: I made my humble petition in your presence with my whole heart;
58.tail: O be merciful to me, according to your word.

59.head: I have called my ways to remembrance
59.tail: and turned my feet to your testimonies.

60.head: I made haste and did not delay

61.head: The cords of the ungodly have encircled me,
61.tail: but I have not forgotten your law.

62.head: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,

63.head: I am a companion of all those who fear you

64.head: The earth, O Lord, is full of your mercy;

65.head: O Lord, you have dealt graciously with your servant,

66.head: O teach me true understanding and knowledge,
66.tail: for I have believed your commandments.

67.head: Before I was afflicted I went astray,
67.tail: but now I keep your word.

69.head: The proud have slandered me with lies,
69.tail: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.

70.head: Their heart has become gross with fatness,
70.tail: but my delight is in your law.

71.head: It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
71.tail: that I may learn your statutes.

72.head: The law of your mouth is dearer to me
72.tail: than thousands in gold and silver.

73.head: Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
73.tail: O give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

74.head: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me,
74.tail: because I have put my trust in your word.

75.head: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right,
75.tail: and that in your faithfulness you have caused me to be afflicted.

76.head: O let your merciful kindness be my comfort,
76.tail: according to your word to your servant.

77.head: O let your loving mercies come to me, that I may live,
77.tail: for your law is my delight.

78.head: Let the proud be put to shame, for they go about wickedly to destroy me;
78.tail: but I will meditate on your commandments.

79.head: Let those who fear you turn to me,
79.tail: even those who know your testimonies.

80.head: O let my heart be sound in your statutes,
80.tail: that I may never be put to shame.

81.head: My soul has longed for your salvation,
81.tail: and I have a good hope because of your word.

82.head: My eyes long sorely for your word,
82.tail: saying,  O when will you comfort me?

83.head: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
83.tail: yet I do not forget your statutes.

84.head: How many are the days of your servant?
84.tail: When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?

85.head: The proud have dug pits for me;
85.tail: they do not walk after your law.

86.head: All your commandments are true.
86.tail: They persecute me falsely; O Lord, be my help.

87.head: They had almost made an end of me on earth,
87.tail: but I have not forsaken your commandments.

88.head: O revive me with your loving-kindness,
88.tail: and so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth.

89.head: O Lord, your word endures for ever;

90.head: Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another;
90.tail: you have laid the foundation of the earth, and it abides.

91.head: Surely your ordinances stand firm this day,
91.tail: for all things are your servants.

92.head: If my delight had not been in your law,
92.tail: I should have perished in my affliction.

93.head: I will never forget your commandments,
93.tail: for with them you have enlivened me.

94.head: I am yours; O save me!
94.tail: For I have sought your commandments.

95.head: The ungodly lie in wait for me to destroy me,
95.tail: but I will consider your testimonies.

96.head: I see that all things come to an end,
96.tail: but your commandment has no bounds.

97.head: Lord, what love I have for your law;
97.tail: all the day long I meditate on it.

98.head: You, through your commandment, have made me wiser than my enemies,
98.tail: for it is always with me.

99.head: I have more understanding than my teachers,
99.tail: for your testimonies are my study.

100.head: I am wiser than the ag d,

101.head: I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
101.tail: that I may keep your word.

102.head: I have not turned aside from your judgments,
102.tail: for you yourself have taught me.

103.head: Oh, how sweet are your words to my taste;
103.tail: indeed, sweeter than honey to my mouth.

104.head: Through your commandments I get understanding;
104.tail: therefore I hate all evil ways.

105.head: Your word is a lantern to my feet
105.tail: and a light upon my path.

106.head: I have sworn and am steadfastly purposed

107.head: I am troubled above measure;
107.tail: revive me, O Lord, according to your word.

108.head: Let the freewill offerings of my mouth please you, O Lord;

109.head: My life is always in my hand,
109.tail: yet I do not forget your law.

110.head: The ungodly have laid a snare for me,
110.tail: yet I have not strayed from your commandments.

111.head: Your testimonies have I claimed as my heritage for ever,
111.tail: and why? They are the very joy of my heart.

112.head: I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes always,

113.head: I hate those who are double-minded,
113.tail: but your law do I love.

114.head: You are my defense and shield,
114.tail: and my trust is in your word.

115.head: Away from me, you wicked.
115.tail: I will keep the commandments of my God.

116.head: Establish me according to your word, that I may live,
116.tail: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.

117.head: Hold me up, and I shall be safe;
117.tail: indeed, my delight shall be ever in your statutes.

118.head: You have trodden down all those who depart from your statutes,

119.head: You put away all the ungodly of the earth like dross;

120.head: My flesh trembles for fear of you,
120.tail: and I am afraid of your judgments.

121.head: I have done that which is lawful and right;
121.tail: O give me not over to my oppressors.

122.head: Be surety for your servant's good;
122.tail: O let not the arrogant oppress me.

123.head: My eyes have wasted away with looking for your salvation,
123.tail: and for the word of your righteousness.

124.head: O deal with your servant according to your loving mercy,

125.head: I am your servant; O grant me understanding,
125.tail: that I may know your testimonies.

126.head: It is time for you, O Lord, to act,
126.tail: for they have broken your law.

127.head: For I love your commandments above all things,
127.tail: more than gold and precious stones.

128.head: Therefore I hold all your commandments to be right,
128.tail: and all false ways I utterly abhor.

129.head: Your testimonies are wonderful;
129.tail: therefore does my soul keep them.

130.head: When your word goes forth it gives light

131.head: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath,
131.tail: for my delight was in your commandments.

132.head: O look upon me, and be merciful unto me,
132.tail: as you always do for those who love your Name.

133.head: Order my steps according to your word,
133.tail: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

134.head: O deliver me from those who deal wrongfully,
134.tail: and so shall I keep your commandments.

135.head: Show the light of your countenance upon your servant,

136.head: My eyes gush out water
136.tail: because of those who do not keep your law.

138.head: The testimonies that you have commanded

139.head: My zeal has even consumed me,
139.tail: because my enemies have forgotten your words.

140.head: Your word is tested to the uttermost,
140.tail: and therefore your servant loves it.

141.head: I am small, and of no reputation,
141.tail: yet I do not forget your commandments.

142.head: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
142.tail: and your law is the truth.

143.head: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold of me,
143.tail: yet my delight is in your commandments.

144.head: The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting;
144.tail: O grant me understanding, and I shall live.

145.head: I call with my whole heart.
145.tail: Hear me, O Lord; I will keep your statutes.

146.head: Even unto you do I call;
146.tail: help me, and I shall keep your testimonies.

147.head: Early in the morning do I cry unto you,
147.tail: for in your word is my trust.

148.head: My eyes open before the night watches,
148.tail: that I may meditate on your words.

149.head: Hear my voice, O Lord, according to your loving-kindness;
149.tail: give me life according to your judgments.

150.head: They draw nigh who in malice persecute me,
150.tail: and are far from your law.

151.head: Be near at hand, O Lord,
151.tail: for all your commandments are true.

152.head: Concerning your testimonies, I have known long ago
152.tail: that you have founded them for ever.

153.head: O consider my adversity and deliver me,
153.tail: for I do not forget your law.

154.head: Plead my cause and deliver me;
154.tail: give me life according to your word.

155.head: Salvation is far from the ungodly,
155.tail: for they do not regard your statutes.

156.head: Great is your mercy, O Lord;
156.tail: give me life according to your judgments.

157.head: Many there are who trouble me and persecute me,
157.tail: yet I do not swerve from your testimonies.

158.head: It grieves me when I see the transgressors,
158.tail: because they do not keep your law.

159.head: Consider, O Lord, how I love your commandments;
159.tail: O give me life according to your loving-kindness.

160.head: Your word is true from everlasting;
160.tail: all the judgments of your righteousness endure for evermore.

161.head: Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
161.tail: but my heart stands in awe of your word.

162.head: I am as glad of your word
162.tail: as one who finds great spoils.

163.head: As for lies, I hate and abhor them,
163.tail: but your law do I love.

164.head: Seven times a day do I praise you,

165.head: Great is the peace they have who love your law
165.tail: and find in it no stumbling block.

166.head: Lord, I have looked for your saving health

167.head: My soul has kept your testimonies,
167.tail: and I have loved them exceedingly.

168.head: I have kept your commandments and testimonies,
168.tail: for all my ways are before you.

169.head: Let my complaint come before you, O Lord;
169.tail: give me understanding, according to your word.

170.head: Let my supplication come before you;
170.tail: deliver me, according to your word.

171.head: My lips shall pour forth your praise,
171.tail: when you have taught me your statutes.

172.head: Surely my tongue shall sing of your word,
172.tail: for all your commandments are righteous.

173.head: Let your hand be strong to help me,
173.tail: for I have chosen your commandments.

174.head: I have longed for your saving health, O Lord,
174.tail: and in your law is my delight.

175.head: O let my soul live, and it shall praise you;
175.tail: and let your judgments help me.

176.head: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost;
176.tail: O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

1.head: When I was in trouble I called upon the Lord,
1.tail: and he hearkened to my calling.

2.head: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips
2.tail: and from a deceitful tongue.

3.head: What reward shall be given or done unto you, O false tongue?
3.tail: Even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

4.head: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell in Meshech,
4.tail: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.

5.head: My soul has long dwelt among those
5.tail: who are enemies of peace.

6.head: I labor for peace, but when I speak to them of it,
6.tail: they make themselves ready for battle.

1.head: I will lift up my eyes unto the hills;
1.tail: from whence comes my help?

2.head: My help comes from the Lord,
2.tail: who has made heaven and earth.

3.head: He will not let your foot be moved,
3.tail: and he who keeps you will not sleep.

4.head: Behold, he who keeps Israel
4.tail: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

5.head: The Lord himself is your keeper;
5.tail: the Lord is your defense upon your right hand,

6.head: So that the sun shall not burn you by day,
6.tail: neither the moon by night.

7.head: The Lord shall preserve you from all evil;
7.tail: indeed, it is he who shall keep your soul.

8.head: The Lord shall preserve your going out and your coming in,
8.tail: from this time forth for evermore.

1.head: I was glad when they said unto me,
1.tail: We will go into the house of the Lord.

2.head: Now our feet are standing
2.tail: within your gates, O Jerusalem.

3.head: Jerusalem is built as a city
3.tail: that is at unity in itself.

4.head: For there the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord,
4.tail: as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord.

5.head: For there is the throne of judgment,
5.tail: even the throne of the house of David.

6.head: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem;
6.tail: they shall prosper that love you.

7.head: Peace be within your walls
7.tail: and plenteousness within your palaces.

8.head: For my brethren and companions' sakes,
8.tail: I will wish you prosperity.

9.head: Indeed, because of the house of the Lord our God,
9.tail: I will seek to do you good.

1.head: Unto you I lift up my eyes,
1.tail: you who are enthroned in the heavens.

2.head: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters,
2.tail: and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress,

3.head: Even so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God,
3.tail: until he show us his favor.

4.head: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us,
4.tail: for we have suffered more than enough contempt.

5.head: Long has our soul suffered the scorn of the wealthy
5.tail: and the spitefulness of the proud.

1.head: If the Lord himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say:
1.tail: if the Lord himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us,

2.head: Then would they have swallowed us up alive,
2.tail: when they were so wrathfully displeased with us;

3.head: Then the waters would have drowned us, and the torrent gone over us;
3.tail: then the raging waters would have gone clean over us.

4.head: But praised be the Lord,
4.tail: who has not given us over to be prey for their teeth.

5.head: We escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowler;
5.tail: the snare is broken, and we have been delivered.

6.head: Our help is in the Name of the Lord,
6.tail: the maker of heaven and earth.
