1.head: Those who put their trust in the Lord shall be like Mount Zion,
1.tail: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.

2.head: The hills stand about Jerusalem
2.tail: even as the Lord stands round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

3.head: For the scepter of the ungodly shall not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous,
3.tail: lest the righteous put forth their hand to do wickedness.

4.head: Do good, O Lord, unto those who are good,
4.tail: unto those who are good and true of heart.

5.head: As for those who turn aside to their own wicked ways, the Lord shall lead them away with the evildoers;
5.tail: but peace shall be upon Israel.

1.head: When the Lord overturned the captivity of Zion,
1.tail: then were we like those who dream.

2.head: Then was our mouth filled with laughter
2.tail: and our tongue with shouts of joy.

3.head: Then they said among the nations,
3.tail: The Lord has done great things for them.

4.head: Indeed, the Lord has done great things for us already,
4.tail: whereof we rejoice.

5.head: Overturn our captivity, O Lord,
5.tail: as when streams refresh the deserts of the south.

6.head: Those who sow in tears
6.tail: shall reap with songs of joy.

7.head: He who goes on his way weeping and bears good seed
7.tail: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

1.head: Unless the Lord builds the house,
1.tail: their labor is in vain who build it.

2.head: Unless the Lord keeps the city,
2.tail: the watchman keeps vigil in vain.

3.head: It is in vain that you rise up early, and take rest so late, and eat the bread of toil,
3.tail: for he gives to his beloved sleep.

4.head: Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord,
4.tail: and the fruit of the womb is a gift that comes from him.

5.head: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
5.tail: so are the children of one's youth.

6.head: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them;
6.tail: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.

1.head: Blessed are all those who fear the Lord
1.tail: and walk in his ways.

2.head: For you shall eat of the labors of your hands;
2.tail: it shall be well with you, and happy you shall be.

3.head: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine
3.tail: upon the walls of your house,

4.head: Your children like the olive branches
4.tail: round about your table.

5.head: Indeed, thus shall the man be blessed
5.tail: who fears the Lord.

6.head: May the Lord bless you out of Zion;
6.tail: may you see Jerusalem in prosperity all your life long.

7.head: May you see your children's children,
7.tail: and may there be peace upon Israel.

1.head: Many a time have they fought against me from my youth on,
1.tail: may Israel now say;

2.head: Indeed, many a time have they afflicted me from my youth on,
2.tail: but they have not prevailed against me.

3.head: The plowers plowed upon my back,
3.tail: and made long furrows.

4.head: But the righteous Lord
4.tail: has hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.

5.head: Let them be ashamed and turned backward,
5.tail: as many as hate Zion.

6.head: Let them be as the grass growing upon the housetops,
6.tail: which withers before it grows up,

7.head: Which does not fill the hand of the reaper,
7.tail: neither the bosom of him who binds up the sheaves,

8.head: So that those who go by say not so much as,  The Lord prosper you.
8.tail: We bless you in the Name of the Lord.

1.head: Out of the deep have I called unto you, O Lord;
1.tail: Lord, hear my voice.

2.head: O let your ears consider well
2.tail: the voice of my supplications.

3.head: If you, Lord, were to mark what is done amiss,
3.tail: O Lord, who could abide it?

4.head: For there is mercy with you;
4.tail: therefore you shall be feared.

5.head: I wait for the Lord; my soul waits for him;
5.tail: in his word is my trust.

6.head: My soul waits for the Lord,
6.tail: more than watchmen for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.

7.head: O Israel, trust in the Lord, for with the Lord there is mercy,
7.tail: and with him is plenteous redemption;

8.head: And he shall redeem Israel
8.tail: from all their sins.

1.head: O Lord, I am not haughty;
1.tail: I have no proud looks.

2.head: I do not occupy myself with great matters,
2.tail: or with things that are too high for me.

3.head: But I have stilled and quieted my soul, like a weaned child upon his mother's breast;
3.tail: so is my soul quieted within me.

4.head: O Israel, trust in the Lord
4.tail: from this time forth for evermore.

1.head: Lord, remember David,
1.tail: and all his tribulations,

2.head: How he swore unto the Lord,
2.tail: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob:

3.head: I will not come within the tabernacle of my house,
3.tail: nor climb up into my bed,

4.head: I will not allow my eyes to sleep, nor my eyelids to slumber,
4.tail: neither the temples of my head to take any rest,

5.head: Until I find a place for the temple of the Lord,
5.tail: a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

6.head: Lo, we heard of the ark at Ephrathah
6.tail: and found it in the wood.

7.head: We will go into his tabernacle,
7.tail: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

8.head: Arise, O Lord, into your resting-place,
8.tail: you and the ark of your strength.

9.head: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,
9.tail: and let your saints sing with joy.

10.head: For your servant David's sake,
10.tail: turn not away the presence of your Anointed.

11.head: The Lord has made a faithful oath unto David,
11.tail: and he shall not shrink from it:

12.head: Of the fruit of your body
12.tail: shall I set upon your throne.

13.head: If your children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall teach them,
13.tail: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.

14.head: For the Lord has chosen Zion for himself;
14.tail: he has longed for her to be his habitation:

15.head: This shall be my rest for ever;
15.tail: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

16.head: I will bless her provisions with increase,
16.tail: and will satisfy her poor with bread.

17.head: I will clothe her priests with salvation,
17.tail: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

18.head: There shall I make the horn of David flourish;
18.tail: I have prepared a lantern for my Anointed.

19.head: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame;
19.tail: but upon his head shall his crown flourish.

1.head: Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is
1.tail: when brethren dwell together in unity.

2.head: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard,
2.tail: even Aaron's beard, and went down to the edges of his clothing,

3.head: Like the dew of Hermon,
3.tail: which falls upon the hills of Zion.

4.head: For there the Lord promised his blessing,
4.tail: even life for evermore.

1.head: Behold now, praise the Lord,
1.tail: all you servants of the Lord,

2.head: You that stand by night in the house of the Lord,
2.tail: even in the courts of the house of our God.

3.head: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
3.tail: and sing praises unto the Lord.

4.head: The Lord who made heaven and earth
4.tail: give you blessing out of Zion.

1.head: O praise the Lord. Praise the Name of the Lord;
1.tail: offer praise, you servants of the Lord,

2.head: You who stand in the house of the Lord,
2.tail: in the courts of the house of our God.

3.head: O praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
3.tail: sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

4.head: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself
4.tail: and Israel for his own possession.

5.head: For I know that the Lord is great,
5.tail: and that our Lord is above all gods.

6.head: Whatsoever the Lord pleases he does, in heaven and on earth,
6.tail: in the seas and in all the deep places.

7.head: He brings forth clouds from the ends of the earth
7.tail: and sends forth lightning with the rain, bringing the wind out of his treasuries.

8.head: It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
8.tail: both of man and beast.

9.head: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O land of Egypt,
9.tail: against Pharaoh and all his servants.

10.head: He smote many nations,
10.tail: and slew mighty kings:

11.head: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan,
11.tail: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

12.head: And he gave their land to be an inheritance,
12.tail: an inheritance for Israel his people.

13.head: Your Name, O Lord, endures for ever;
13.tail: so does your renown, O Lord, from one generation to another.

14.head: For the Lord will avenge his people
14.tail: and have compassion upon his servants.

15.head: As for the idols of the nations, they are but silver and gold,
15.tail: the work of human hands.

16.head: They have mouths, but they speak not;
16.tail: eyes have they, but they see not;

17.head: They have ears, and yet they hear not,
17.tail: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

18.head: Those who make them are like them,
18.tail: and so are all who put their trust in them.

19.head: Praise the Lord, O house of Israel;
19.tail: praise the Lord, O house of Aaron.

20.head: Praise the Lord, O house of Levi;
20.tail: you who fear the Lord, praise the Lord.

21.head: Praised be the Lord from Zion,
21.tail: who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.

1.head: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is gracious,
1.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

2.head: O give thanks unto the God of all gods,
2.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

3.head: O give thanks unto the Lord of all lords,
3.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

4.head: Who alone does great wonders,
4.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

5.head: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens,
5.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

6.head: Who laid out the earth above the waters,
6.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

7.head: Who made the great lights,
7.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

8.head: The sun to rule the day,
8.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

9.head: The moon and the stars to govern the night,
9.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

10.head: Who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
10.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

11.head: And brought out Israel from among them,
11.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

12.head: With a mighty hand and an outstretched arm,
12.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

13.head: Who divided the Red Sea in two parts,
13.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

14.head: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it,
14.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

15.head: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea,
15.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

16.head: Who led his people through the wilderness,
16.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

17.head: Who smote great kings,
17.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

18.head: And slew mighty kings,
18.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

19.head: Sihon king of the Amorites,
19.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

20.head: And Og the king of Bashan,
20.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

21.head: And gave away their land for an inheritance,
21.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

22.head: Even for an inheritance for Israel his servant,
22.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

23.head: Who remembered us when we were in trouble,
23.tail: for his mercy endures for ever;

24.head: And delivered us from our enemies,
24.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

25.head: Who gives food to all flesh,
25.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

26.head: O give thanks unto the God of heaven,
26.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

27.head: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords
27.tail: for his mercy endures for ever.

1.head: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,
1.tail: when we remembered you, O Zion.

2.head: As for our harps, we hung them up
2.tail: upon the trees that are therein.

3.head: For those who led us away captive required of us a song and melody in our heaviness:
3.tail: Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

4.head: How shall we sing the Lord's song
4.tail: in the land of our captivity?

5.head: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
5.tail: let my right hand forget its skill.

6.head: If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
6.tail: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my dearest joy.

7.head: Remember the children of Edom, O Lord, in the day of Jerusalem,
7.tail: how they said,  Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.

8.head: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery,
8.tail: happy shall be the one who rewards you as you have done to us.

9.head: Blessed shall he be who takes your children
9.tail: and throws them against the stones.

1.head: I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart;
1.tail: even before the gods will I sing praises to you.

2.head: I will worship toward your holy temple and praise your Name, because of your loving-kindness and truth,
2.tail: for you have magnified your Name and your word above all things.

3.head: When I called upon you, you heard me
3.tail: and gave me increase of strength.

4.head: All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O Lord,
4.tail: for they have heard the words of your mouth.

5.head: They shall sing of the ways of the Lord,
5.tail: that great is the glory of the Lord.

6.head: For though the Lord be high, yet he has respect for the lowly;
6.tail: as for the proud, he beholds them from afar.

7.head: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shall you refresh me;
7.tail: you shall stretch forth your hand upon the furiousness of my enemies, and your right hand shall save me.

8.head: The Lord shall make good his loving-kindness toward me;
8.tail: your mercy, O Lord, endures for ever; despise not the works of your own hands.

1.head: O Lord, you have searched me out and known me;
1.tail: you know my sitting down and my rising up; you understand my thoughts from afar.

2.head: You examine my path and my places of rest,
2.tail: and are acquainted with all my ways.

3.head: Indeed, there is not a word on my tongue,
3.tail: but you, O Lord, know it altogether.

4.head: You have enclosed me behind and before,
4.tail: and have laid your hand upon me.

5.head: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
5.tail: so excellent I cannot attain to it.

6.head: Where shall I go then from your Spirit,
6.tail: or where shall I flee from your presence?

7.head: If I climb up to heaven, you are there;
7.tail: if I make my bed in the Grave, you are there also.

8.head: If I take the wings of the morning
8.tail: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

9.head: Even there shall your hand lead me,
9.tail: and your right hand shall hold me.

10.head: If I say,  Surely the darkness shall cover me,
10.tail: then shall my night be turned to day.

11.head: Even the darkness is not dark to you, and the night is as clear as the day;
11.tail: the darkness and the light to you are both alike.

12.head: For you yourself made my inmost parts;
12.tail: you knit me together in my mother's womb.

13.head: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;
13.tail: marvelous are your works, and my soul knows it very well.

14.head: My bones were not hidden from you
14.tail: when I was made in secret and fashioned in the depths of the earth.

15.head: Your eyes beheld my substance, while I was yet unformed;
15.tail: and in your book were all my members written,

16.head: Which day by day were fashioned,
16.tail: when as yet there was none of them.

17.head: How dear to me are your thoughts, O God.
17.tail: How great is the sum of them!

18.head: If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand.
18.tail: When I wake up, I am present with you.

19.head: Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God!
19.tail: Depart from me, you bloodthirsty men.

20.head: For they speak unrighteously against you;
20.tail: your enemies take your Name in vain.

21.head: Do I not hate those, O Lord, who hate you,
21.tail: and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?

22.head: Indeed, I hate them with a perfect hatred;
22.tail: they have become my own enemies.

23.head: Search me, O God, and know my heart;
23.tail: try me and examine my thoughts.

24.head: Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me,
24.tail: and lead me in the way everlasting.

1.head: Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers,
1.tail: and preserve me from the violent,

2.head: Who imagine evil in their hearts
2.tail: and stir up strife all the day long.

3.head: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent;
3.tail: adders' poison is under their lips.

4.head: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the ungodly;
4.tail: preserve me from the violent, who have purposed to overthrow my steps.

5.head: The proud have laid a snare for me and spread out a net with cords;
5.tail: they have set traps in my way.

6.head: I said unto the Lord,  You are my God;
6.tail: hear the voice of my prayers, O Lord.

7.head: O Lord God, the strength of my salvation,
7.tail: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

8.head: Let not the ungodly have their desire, O Lord;
8.tail: let not their evil imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.

9.head: Let not those who encompass me lift up their heads;
9.tail: let the evil of their own lips consume them.

10.head: Let hot burning coals fall upon them;
10.tail: let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they may never rise up again.

11.head: A slanderer shall not prosper upon the earth;
11.tail: evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.

12.head: I am sure that the Lord will avenge the poor
12.tail: and maintain the cause of the helpless.

13.head: Surely, the righteous shall give thanks unto your Name,
13.tail: and the just shall continue in your sight.

1.head: Lord, I call upon you; hasten unto me,
1.tail: and hear my voice when I cry unto you.

2.head: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense,
2.tail: and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.

3.head: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth,
3.tail: and keep the door of my lips.

4.head: O let not my heart be inclined to any evil thing;
4.tail: let me not be occupied in ungodly works with those who work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.

5.head: Rather, let the righteous smite me,
5.tail: and in their loving-kindness reprove me.

6.head: But let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head;
6.tail: while I live, I will pray against their wickedness.

7.head: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places,
7.tail: that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.

8.head: Let their bones lie scattered at the mouth of the grave,
8.tail: as when the ploughman scatters the earth in furrows.

9.head: But my eyes look unto you, O Lord God;
9.tail: in you is my refuge; O do not cast out my soul.

10.head: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
10.tail: and from the traps of the evildoers.

11.head: Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together,
11.tail: and let me ever escape them.

1.head: I cried unto the Lord with my voice;
1.tail: even unto the Lord I made my supplication.

2.head: I poured out my complaints before him,
2.tail: and showed him my trouble.

3.head: When my spirit was in heaviness, you knew my path;
3.tail: in the way wherein I walked they had secretly laid a snare for me.

4.head: I looked also to my right hand
4.tail: and saw there was no one who would know me.

5.head: I had no place to flee to,
5.tail: and no one cared for my soul.

6.head: I cried out to you, O Lord, and said,
6.tail: You are my refuge, and my portion in the land of the living.

7.head: Consider my complaint,
7.tail: for I am brought very low.

8.head: O deliver me from my persecutors,
8.tail: for they are too strong for me.

9.head: Bring me out of prison, that I may give thanks unto your Name.
9.tail: When you show me your loving-kindness, then shall the righteous gather around me.

1.head: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and consider my supplications;
1.tail: hearken to me, for your truth and righteousness' sake.

2.head: Enter not into judgment with your servant,
2.tail: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.

3.head: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground;
3.tail: he has laid me in the darkness, like those who have been long dead.

4.head: Therefore my spirit faints within me,
4.tail: and my heart within me is desolate.

5.head: Yet I remember the time past; I muse upon all your works;
5.tail: indeed, I meditate on the works of your hands.

6.head: I stretch forth my hands to you;
6.tail: my soul gasps for you as a thirsty land.

7.head: Hear me, O Lord, and very soon, for my spirit grows faint;
7.tail: hide not your face from me, lest I be like those who go down into the pit.

8.head: O let me hear your loving-kindness in the morning, for in you have I put my trust;
8.tail: show me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto you.

9.head: Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies,
9.tail: for I flee unto you to hide me.

10.head: Teach me to do the thing that pleases you, for you are my God;
10.tail: let your loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.

11.head: Revive me, O Lord, for your Name's sake;
11.tail: and for your righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

12.head: Of your goodness slay my enemies,
12.tail: and destroy all those who afflict my soul, for I am your servant.

1.head: Blessed be the Lord my strength,
1.tail: who teaches my hands to war and my fingers to fight,

2.head: My hope and my fortress, my stronghold and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust,
2.tail: who subdues the peoples under me.

3.head: O Lord, what is man, that you have shown such respect to him,
3.tail: or the son of man, that you so regard him?

4.head: Man is like a thing of nought;
4.tail: his time passes away like a shadow.

5.head: Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down;
5.tail: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

6.head: Cast forth your lightning and scatter them;
6.tail: shoot out your arrows and consume them.

7.head: Send down your hand from above;
7.tail: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strangers,

8.head: Whose mouth talks of vain things,
8.tail: and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

9.head: I will sing a new song unto you, O God,
9.tail: and sing praises unto you upon a ten-stringed lute.

10.head: You have given victory to kings,
10.tail: and have delivered David your servant from the peril of the sword.

11.head: Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strangers,
11.tail: whose mouth talks of vain things, and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood;

12.head: That our sons may grow up as young plants,
12.tail: and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple,

13.head: That our storehouses may be full and plenteous with all manner of grain,
13.tail: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields,

14.head: That our oxen may be strong to labor, that there be no decay,
14.tail: no leading into captivity, and no outcry in our streets.

15.head: Happy are the people of whom this is so;
15.tail: indeed, blessed are the people who have the Lord for their God.

1.head: I will magnify you, O God my King,
1.tail: and I will praise your Name for ever and ever.

2.head: Every day will I give thanks to you,
2.tail: and praise your Name for ever and ever.

3.head: Great is the Lord, and most worthy to be praised;
3.tail: there is no end of his greatness.

4.head: One generation shall praise your works to another,
4.tail: and shall declare your power.

5.head: As for me, I will be talking of the glorious splendor of your majesty,
5.tail: and of all your wondrous works.

6.head: They shall speak of the might of your marvelous acts,
6.tail: and I also will tell of your greatness.

7.head: The remembrance of your abundant goodness shall they proclaim,
7.tail: and they shall sing of your righteousness.

8.head: The Lord is gracious and merciful,
8.tail: long-suffering, and of great kindness.

9.head: The Lord is loving to everyone,
9.tail: and his mercy is over all his works.

10.head: All your works praise you, O Lord,
10.tail: and your faithful servants give thanks to you.

11.head: They speak of the glory of your kingdom
11.tail: and talk of your power,

12.head: That your power may be known to the children of men,
12.tail: even the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

13.head: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
13.tail: and your dominion endures throughout all ages.

14.head: The Lord upholds all those who fall
14.tail: and lifts up all those who are bowed down.

15.head: The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord,
15.tail: and you give them their food in due season.

16.head: You open wide your hand,
16.tail: and fill all things living with plenteousness.

17.head: The Lord is righteous in all his ways
17.tail: and merciful in all his works.

18.head: The Lord is near to all those who call upon him,
18.tail: to all who call upon him faithfully.

19.head: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him;
19.tail: he also will hear their cry and will help them.

20.head: The Lord preserves all those who love him,
20.tail: but he will destroy all the ungodly.

21.head: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord;
21.tail: and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

1.head: Praise the Lord, O my soul;
1.tail: while I live I will praise the Lord.

2.head: Indeed, as long as I have my being,
2.tail: I will sing praises unto my God.

3.head: Put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man,
3.tail: for there is no help in them.

4.head: For when one breathes his last, he shall return again to the earth,
4.tail: and in that day all his thoughts perish.

5.head: Blessed is the one who has the God of Jacob for his help
5.tail: and whose hope is in the Lord his God,

6.head: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is therein;
6.tail: who keeps his promise for ever;

7.head: Who does right to those who suffer wrong;
7.tail: and who feeds the hungry.

8.head: The Lord sets prisoners free;
8.tail: the Lord gives sight to the blind.

9.head: The Lord helps those who have fallen;
9.tail: the Lord loves the righteous.

10.head: The Lord cares for the strangers in the land; he defends the fatherless and widow;
10.tail: but the way of the ungodly he makes crooked.

11.head: The Lord shall be King for evermore,
11.tail: even your God, O Zion, throughout all generations. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Praise the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God;
1.tail: indeed, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.

2.head: The Lord builds up Jerusalem,
2.tail: and gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

3.head: He heals those who are broken in heart,
3.tail: and binds up their wounds.

4.head: He counts the number of the stars,
4.tail: and calls them all by their names.

5.head: Great is our Lord, and great is his power;
5.tail: indeed, his wisdom is infinite.

6.head: The Lord lifts up the meek,
6.tail: and brings the ungodly down to the ground.

7.head: O sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving;
7.tail: sing praises with the harp unto our God,

8.head: Who covers the heavens with clouds, and prepares rain for the earth,
8.tail: and makes the grass to grow upon the mountains, and plants for the use of men,

9.head: Who gives food to the cattle
9.tail: and feeds the young ravens that call upon him.

10.head: He has no pleasure in the strength of a horse;
10.tail: neither does he delight in any man's strength.

11.head: But the Lord's delight is in those who fear him
11.tail: and put their trust in his mercy.

12.head: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem;
12.tail: praise your God, O Zion.

13.head: For he has made strong the bars of your gates
13.tail: and has blessed your children within you.

14.head: He makes peace in your borders
14.tail: and fills you with the finest of wheat.

15.head: He sends forth his commandment upon the earth,
15.tail: and his word runs very swiftly.

16.head: He gives snow like wool
16.tail: and scatters the white frost like ashes.

17.head: He casts forth his ice like crumbs;
17.tail: who is able to abide his frost?

18.head: He sends out his word and melts them;
18.tail: he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.

19.head: He declares his word unto Jacob,
19.tail: his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.

20.head: He has not dealt so with other nations;
20.tail: neither have they knowledge of his laws. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Praise the Lord. O praise the Lord of heaven;
1.tail: praise him in the heights.

2.head: Praise him, all you angels of his;
2.tail: praise him, all his host.

3.head: Praise him, sun and moon;
3.tail: praise him, all you stars of light.

4.head: Praise him, all you highest heavens,
4.tail: and you waters that are above the heavens.

5.head: Let them praise the Name of the Lord,
5.tail: for he spoke the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.

6.head: He has made them stand fast for ever and ever;
6.tail: he has given them a law which shall not be broken.

7.head: Praise the Lord upon earth,
7.tail: you sea monsters and all deeps;

8.head: Fire and hail, snow and fog,
8.tail: wind and storm, fulfilling his word;

9.head: Mountains and all hills,
9.tail: fruitful trees and all cedars;

10.head: Beasts and all cattle,
10.tail: creeping things and birds of the air;

11.head: Kings of the earth and all peoples,
11.tail: princes and all rulers of the world;

12.head: Young men and maidens,
12.tail: old men and children together.

13.head: Let them praise the Name of the Lord,
13.tail: for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.

14.head: He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his faithful shall praise him,
14.tail: the children of Israel, the people who are near him. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Praise the Lord. O sing unto the Lord a new song;
1.tail: let the congregation of the faithful praise him.

2.head: Let Israel rejoice in the one who made him,
2.tail: and let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

3.head: Let them praise his Name in the dance;
3.tail: let them sing praises unto him with timbrel and harp.

4.head: For the Lord has pleasure in his people
4.tail: and gives victory to those who are oppressed.

5.head: Let the faithful be joyful with glory;
5.tail: let them rejoice upon their beds.

6.head: Let the praises of God be in their mouth
6.tail: and a two-edged sword in their hands,

7.head: To inflict vengeance on the nations,
7.tail: and to rebuke the peoples,

8.head: To bind their kings in chains,
8.tail: and their nobles with links of iron,

9.head: That they may execute judgment upon them, as it is written;
9.tail: this is the honor of all his servants. Praise the Lord.

1.head: Praise the Lord. Praise God in his holiness;
1.tail: praise him in the firmament of his power.

2.head: Praise him for his mighty acts;
2.tail: praise him for his excellent greatness.

3.head: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet;
3.tail: praise him upon the lute and harp.

4.head: Praise him with the timbrels and dances;
4.tail: praise him upon the strings and pipe.

5.head: Praise him with the resounding cymbals;
5.tail: praise him with the loud cymbals.

6.head: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord.
6.tail: O praise the Lord.
